科號  Course Number ： 11210AES 520300學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：環境化學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Environment Chemistry
任課教師  Instructor ：吳劍侯
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is designed for those students who have interest in environemntal
science and technology. Several fundamental courses including physical
chemistry, analytical chemistry and/or organic chemistry are needed.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. Brezonik, P. L. and Arnold, W. A. Water Chemistry: The Chemical Processes and
Composition of Natural and Engineered Aquatic Systems, 2nd Edition; Oxford
University Press: New York, NY, 2022.
2. Stumm, W. and Morgan, J. J. Aquatic Chemistry: Chemical Equilibria and Rates in
Natural Waters, 3rd Edition; John Wiley & Sons: New York, NY, 1996.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Weiner, E. R. Applications of Environmental Aquatic Chemistry: A Practical
Guide, 3rd Edition; CRC Press: Boca Raton, FL, 2013.
2. Sawyer, C. N.; McCarty, P. L. and Parkin, G. F. Chemistry for Environmental
Engineering and Science, 5th Edition; McGraw Hill: New York, NY, 2003.
3. Schwarzenbach, R. P.; Gschwend, P. M.; Imboden, D. M. Environmental Organic
Chemistry, 2nd Edition; John Wiley & Sons: New York, NY, 2003.
4. Morel, F. M. M. and Hering, J. G. Principles and Applications of Aquatic
Chemistry; John Wiley & Sons: New York, NY, 1993.
5. Brezonik, P. L. Chemical Kinetics and Process Dynamics in Aquatic Systems; CRC
Press-Lewis Publishers: Boca Raton, FL, 1994.
6. Butler, J. N. and Cogley, D. R. Ionic Equilibrium: Solubility and pH
Calculations; John Wiley & Sons: New York, NY, 1998.
7. Masten, S. J. and Davis, M. L. Principles of Environmental Engineering and
Science, 4th International Edition; McGraw-Hill Education: New York, NY, 2020.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week Topic Reading (Brezonik/Stumm)
1 Prologue Chap. 1, 2/Chap. 1
2-3 Chemical Thermodynamics Chap. 3/Chap. 2
4 Chemical Kinetics Chap. 5/Chap. 2
5 Acids and bases Chap. 4, 7/Chap. 3
6 Dissolved Carbon Dioxide Chap. 8/Chap. 4
7 Atmosphere-Water Interactions Chap. 8/Chap. 5, 13
8 1st Midterm Exam
9 Complexation Reactions and metal Ion Speciation Chap. 9/Chap. 6
10 Precipitation and Dissolution Chap. 10/Chap. 7
11-12 Oxidation and Reduction Chap. 11/Chap. 8
13 The Solid-Solution Interface Chap. 12/Chap. 9
14-15 Photochemical Processes Chap. 14/Chap. 12
16 Final Exam
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
20% Homework and attitudes
40% Midterm Exam
40% Final Exam

科號  Course Number ： 11210AES 611100學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 35
中文名稱  Course Title ：專題書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：周⼦勤
上課時間  Time ： W5W6 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
A one-semester course teaching graduate students how to deliver an oral
presentation. Students will be required to give presentation and host a
discussion session. The topics are limited to the areas of students'
specialties.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No textbook assigned.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Mostly group discussion in class.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Lectures will be given only in two classes for guiding the fundamentals of
presentation. Students will be assigned topics to give a presentation in one
semester.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Discussion participation (30%)
Presentation (70%)

科號  Course Number ： 11210ASTR510000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：恒星天文物理學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Stellar Astrophysics
任課教師  Instructor ：陳惠茹
上課時間  Time ： M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is intended for graduate and senior undergraduate students whose major
is Physics or Astrophysics. We will discuss the nature of stars in the context of
astrophysics, such topics as interactions between matter and radiation, heat
transfer, interior structures, as well as their evolution. The class is aimed at
building a solid foundation for students to further pursue astrophysical research
in all fields of astronomy.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
Handouts based on The Physics of Stars (2ed) by A.C. Phillips 1999, Wiley (very
expensive in Taiwan)
三、參考書籍  (References)
The Physical Universe by Frank H. Shu 1982, University Science Books
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Basic Concepts in Astrophysics
2. Properties of Matter and Radiation
3. Heat Transfer in Stars
4. Thermonuclear Fusion in Stars
5. Stellar Structures
6. The End-Points of Stellar Evolution
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
Problem sets and examinations
七、可連結之網⾴位址
http://orion.astr.nthu.edu.tw/star/

科號  Course Number ： 11210ASTR600700學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：天文物理的前沿⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Frontier of Astrophysics Seminars (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：後藤友嗣
上課時間  Time ： TnWnRn 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
-課程說明  (Course Description)
It is an important task for all researchers to keep up with the latest publications in their
field. However, in the field of astronomy alone, nearly 40 new papers are published every
day. It is a significant amount of work to keep up with this flood of papers. The purpose
of this course is to train students to efficiently read and understand the essence of new
research papers within a limited amount of time. Students will spend no more than one
hour reading a paper of their choice and will then take turns presenting a short
summary in 10 minutes. The focus will be on understanding the main points rather than
getting into the details. It is not necessary to read every single detail of the paper.
Additionally, other students in the class will have a valuable opportunity to learn about
the latest papers while listening to the speaker. After each presentation, the instructor
will teach a relevant physics concept related to the reviewed paper.
The course will take place every Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday from 12:10 pm to 1
pm. During each session, two papers will be reviewed. Therefore, over the course of one
semester, we will review almost 100 papers. By the end of the semester, students will be
familiar with the latest advancements in astronomy.
Previous knowledge is not required. We will focus on learning key concepts of
astronomy as they arise in research papers. This approach reflects the practical and
realistic nature of everyday research life. The course will be conducted in English.
-參考書籍  (References)
Papers to be presented are selected from the following archive servers.
https://www.benty-fields.com/
https://arxiver.moonhats.com/
http://arxiv.org/list/astro-ph/new
-教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Presentations by students followed by a review by the instructor.
-成績考核 (Evaluation)
Attendance, questions, and presentations.

Course Description:
Please note that this course is a graduate course and you are expected to have basic skills of astronomical
observations with research grade telescopes. If you did not attend "Fundamentals of Observational
Astronomy ( 基礎天文觀測 )" (PHYS391 or PHYS392) before, you may be required to have an interview
before
admitting to this course.
The course will be conducted in English.
Overview:
An introduction to modern observational techniques of astronomy. The course will cover astronomical
observations across the electromagnetic spectrum, an introduction to gravitational wave and neutrino
observatories, and statistical analysis of astronomical data.
A visit (2 nights) to the Lulin Observatory will be arranged on Nov 10-12, and all the students are expected to
use the 1m telescope to carry out a small research project.
Teaching Method:

2. Demonstrations
3. Lab exercises

astronomy, observation planning and review, data analysis, and model fitting

中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼能天文物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： High Energy Astrophysics
任課教師  Instructor ：楊湘怡
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Syllabus -- High Energy Astrophysics (ASTR635)
High energy astrophysics is one of the core disciplines in modern Astronomy. It studies objects that are
relativistic in nature (such as neutron stars and black holes) and emit in the X-ray and gamma-ray bands,
though high energy processes can manifest themselves throughout the entire electromagnetic spectrum. The
course will present an integrated, in-depth description of modern high energy astrophysics.
This course is designed to provide graduate students background knowledge as well as trainings of research
skills that are essential for future research, including self-motivated learning, literature review, and
presentation skills. Specifically, in addition to lectures and homework assignments, there will be two oral
presentations: one on a recent news, one on a review paper; the topic can be any subject of your choice
related to high energy astrophysics. This course will be offered in English.
Topics that will be covered in this course:
-- Brief overview of high energy astrophysics and underlying physics
-- Observational high energy astrophysics: instrumentation, detectors, observational techniques
-- Radiative processes: synchrotron radiation, Comptonization, Bremsstrahlung, Cherenkov radiation
-- High energy particle astrophysics: particle acceleration, pair creation, hadronic processes, neutrino
production, cosmic rays
-- Compact objects: formation and properties of white dwarfs, neutron stars, and black holes
-- Accretion onto compact objects: dynamics, angular momentum transport, thermal and radiative
properties
of different accretion flows
-- Astrophysical high energy objects: supernovae, pulsars, galaxy clusters, active galactic nuclei, X-ray
binaries, gamma-ray bursts
**Starting from the 2023-2024 academic year, Department of Physics and Institute of Astronomy at NTHU
adopt the flexible curriculum of 16 weeks per semester. Extra resources/activities will be included in the 16
weeks of schedule.
References: 
"High Energy Astrophysics", by M. S. Longair (2011) 
"High Energy Astrophysics", by F. Melia (2009) 
"Introduction to High-energy Astrophysics", by S. Rosswog and M. Bruggen
"Radiative Processes in Astrophysics", by G. B. Rybicki and A. P. Lightman 
Instructor:

Institute of Astronomy and Department of Physics
National Tsing Hua University
R504, General Building II

by the students. In all cases where the AI is used, please clearly specify how it has been used.

中文名稱  Course Title ：計算天文物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computational Astrophysics
任課教師  Instructor ：安德魯 ˙ 古柏
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 521 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明  (Course Description)
This is a graduate-level course offered by the Institute of Astronomy. It is
focused on the practical application of computational skills (tools, algorithms
and programming) to problems in modern astrophysics and cosmology (observational
and theoretical).
Practice is the only efficient way to learn programming. There will be a very
strong emphasis on independent learning, because that is a vital skill in solving
real-life computing problems. You will be expected to work on your own initiative
between classes and discuss what you have learned in class.
The course will be interactive and adapted to the level and interests of the
class. The classes will be conducted in English.
Please read “requirements and expectations” below carefully before signing up.
Course website: http://www.phys.nthu.edu.tw/~acooper/teaching/compastro/
(This will not be available until shortly before the start of the semester).
教學進度 (Syllabus; indicative)
* Programming concepts and practice
* Basic tools, techniques and concepts (including precision, convergence)
* Numerical libraries
* Efficient array manipulation
* Fundamental numerical methods (linear algebra, root finding, interpolation)
* Methods in high performance computing
* The gravitational N-Body problem
* Astrophysical fluids
* Solving ODEs and systems of PDEs
教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Short lectures, in-class discussion (often led by the students), in-class
supervised practice.
The class will be taught to a 16-week syllabus but the full 18-week term will be
used to give more time and flexibility for project work.
成績考核  (Evaluation)
The assessment will be 70% by homework assignments (including leading short class
discussion) and 30% by a final project (including a midterm project proposal).
In the first few lectures we will discuss and agree together on the grading scheme
and the nature of the projects. In general speaking, the projects will involve
approximately one month of independent work on a numerical problem, with
possibilities including:
* Reproducing a published numerical result;
* Developing a simple but useful python package;
* Adding a new feature to an existing code;
* Writing worked examples for a tutorial on a particular method or astrophysical
topic.
A final grade of “A” in this course will correspond to being ready to work
independently and efficiently on computational problems at graduate level. A grade
of “B+” will correspond to being able to work effectively on such problems if
guided by others.
## Requirements and Expectations ##
**This course is not suitable as an introduction to programming for beginners!**
Prior experience with at least one programming language suitable for high-
performance numerical work (e.g. Fortran, C, C++, Python) is almost essential.
Examples in the course will be given in Fortran 90 and Python. We will also
discuss C and C++.
Limited extra support will be given to IoA graduate students who do not have
computing experience and allowance will be made for the range of experience in the
class. For NTHU undergraduates, other, more introductory computational courses are
available. If you are an NTHU undergraduate taking this course before
undergraduate computational courses, you will not be given extra support to catch
up (if you struggle for that reason, that will be your responsibility). You have
been warned.
The course may be suitable for students from other departments (in particular
maths, computer science and engineering) with a strong interest in astronomy and
computing.
It is expected that students who join this course will have their own computer
capable of completing the assignments. If this is not the case, please let the
lecturer know. All IoA graduate students will have access to the CICA HPC cluster
at NTHU; non-IoA students will be given temporary accounts for the duration of the
course.
You will be expected to use a Unix-like operating system (e.g., Linux, Mac OS X,
or Windows Subsystem for Linux) from day 1 of the course. “Use” means (at
minimum) being able navigate a directory hierarchy at the command line, run simply
commands to move and inspect files, and edit text files.
AI DISCLAIMER
We will discuss the use of AI in the lectures. AI methods to speed up code writing
are increasingly common but require understanding and care. We can spend time
exploring these methods and their limitations. Use of AI assistance is permitted
but should be clearly disclosed in any assessment. Undisclosed and un-critical use
of AI will be penalized.
指定⽤書  (Text Books)
More references will be added later!
1. “Numerical Recipes” by Press & Schechter (http://www.nr.com)

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫材料特性分析
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Analytical and Sensing Technologies in Biomedical Sciences
任課教師  Instructor ：萬德輝
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is divided into 2 semesters, including basic analytical theory (I) and instrumental sensing methods
(II). Semester One introduces fundamental concepts of analytical chemistry with an emphasis on the
approaches relevant to measurements in biochemistry. Topics include error analysis, statistical treatment of
data, acid-base chemistry, titrations, spectroscopy, and chromatography.
本⾨課將分為上下學期教授，涵蓋基礎分析化學理論 ( 上學期 ) 以及儀器感測⽅法 ( 下學期 ) ，並著重分析
化學在⽣物醫學⼯程之應⽤實例。在上學期的課程中，將以建立良好化學基礎為主軸，引導學⽣從邏
輯思考進⽽瞭解⽣物分析化學原理，同時增強學⽣應有的實驗理論，包含統計學、資料處理分析、酸
鹼滴定、錯合物滴定、氧化還原滴定、光譜學、層析法及電化學，並針對⽣物分⼦進⾏其分析技術之
介紹。本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.D. A. Skoog, D. M. West, F. J. Holler, and S. R. Crouch, "Fundamentals of Analytical Chemistry", 9th Ed.,
Mary Finch.
2.A. Manz, N. Pamme, and D. Iossifidis, "Bioanalytical Chemistry", 2004, Wiley.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint presentation
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1.Introduction to Analytical Chemistry
2.Tools of Analytical Chemistry:
Errors in Chemical Analyses and Chemical Equilibria
3.Classical Methods of Analysis:
Gravimetric Methods, Titrations, and Complex Acid/base System
4.Spectrochemical Analysis:
Instruments, Absorption, Fluorescence, Atomic, and Mass Spectrometry
6.Kinetics and Separations:
Gas Chromatography and High Performance Liquid Chromatography
7.Molecular Recognition:
Bioassays, Biosensors, DNA-Arrays and Pyrosequencing

科號  Course Number ： 11210BME 500800學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 24
中文名稱  Course Title ：癌症⽣物學與治療
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Cancer Biology and Therapy
任課教師  Instructor ：陳韻晶
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀. 課程⽬標 (Course objective)
1. Develop basic concepts of Cancer Biology
2. Learn to integrate and apply various concepts to Cancer Therapy
⼆. 課程說明 (Course Description)
The impact of cancer on human health is immense, driving force to accelerate
research effort
on
understanding of the basic biology of cancer, leading to more effective treatment
strategies
and more
sensitive and accurate diagnosis tools. This course will provide a comprehensive
coverage of
virtually all
areas of cancer research, emphasizing the cellular and molecular basis of cancer
and
development of
therapeutic strategy. The first half of the course will discuss the genetic and
molecular basis
of cancer. We
will explore the regulation of cell cycle, cell death, cell signaling and
metabolism in cancer.
The second
half
of the course will focus on the tumor microenvironment and therapy strategy. We
will shift our
attention to
the surrounding stromal cells instead of cancer cells. Every lecture will include
a discussion of
the rational
treatment of cancer. In the final section, we will explore the development of
novel therapeutic
strategies for
cancer.
⼆、指定⽤書或參考書籍 (Text Books and References)
The Biology of Cancer, 2nd edition, 2013; Garland Science; Robert A. Weinberg.
三、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Exam (mid-term and final) 60%
Writing assignment 20%
Group performance 10%
Attendance 10%
四、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction of Cancer Biology and Therapy
2. Cell cycle and Cancer
3. Senescence and Cancer
4. Cell death and Cancer
5. Apoptosis, Autophagy and Cancer
6. Cell signaling and Cancer
7. Midterm
8. metabolism and Cancer
9. Angiogenesis and Cancer
10. metastasis I
11. metastasis II
13. Cancer immunity
14. Cancer Diagnosis and Treatment
15. Cancer Nanotech
16. Final Exam

延伸⾄癌細胞代謝和⾎管新⽣ , 癌轉移和免疫脫逃 …… 等 .
每⼀單元根據其相關機制探討和設計相應的治療策略 ,
在治療端的探討包含⼩分⼦藥物 , ⼤分⼦蛋⽩藥 , 基因治療 ,
免疫治療 , 利⽤藥物輸送系統克服癌症治療上的困難 …… 等 .

如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據本
校
公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，請註明如何
使
⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告，說明如下
學⽣可於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議題
發
想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。然⽽，在本課程的「個⼈反思報告」、「⼩組採訪作業」中，
學
⽣不得使⽤⽣成式 AI ⼯具撰寫作業。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相關單位
有
權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
The first lecture (course introduction) will be started at 11:00 on 9/14.
本課程內容包含細胞⽣物學、⽣物化學與分⼦⽣物學，旨在提供⼯程背景學⽣基礎⽣命科學知識，歡

This course aims to introduce the fundamentals of cellular and molecular biology to the students with an
engineering background. The purpose of the course is to provide students with a comprehensive and concise
overview of biological science with emphases on its relationship with biomedical engineering, such as tissue
engineering, drug/gene delivery and molecular imaging.

Course content:

上課時間  Time ： M2M3M4 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本⾨課程旨在 (1) 回顧四⼤⽣物分⼦及基礎無機化學、 (2) ⾦屬酵素功能以及作⽤機制介紹、 (3) 臨床
使⽤⾦屬⽣物醫藥介紹、 (4) ⾦屬⽣物醫藥及⽣醫材料的設計與開發。於學期末則安排由學⽣挑選相
關主題，進⾏⼝頭報告。
This class aims to (1) review four kinds of biomolecules and basic inorganic
chemistry, (2) function and reaction mechanism of metalloenzymes, (3)
introduction of FDA-approved metallopharmaceutics, (4) design and development
of
metal-based biomedicine and biomaterials. In the end of the semester,
students
have to choose a topic and give an oral presentation relevant to the metal
pharmaceutical chemistry & biomaterial.

ISBN:1891389432

Discovery, structure, and function of Fe-containing metalloenzyme
Week 9-10
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物： cis-platin 抗癌藥物
metal complexes for biomedical application: anti-cancer drug cis-platin
Week 11-12
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物： Tc/Gd/Mn/Fe3O4 ⽣物影像顯影劑
metal complexes for biomedical application: contrast reagent for bioimaging
Week 13-15
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物：⼀氧化氮控制遞送及⽣醫應⽤
metal complexes for biomedical application: controlled delivery of nitric
oxide
and biomedical application
Week 16-18
期末考及期末⼝頭報告  Final exam and oral presentation

中文名稱  Course Title ：機率與統計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Probability and Statistics
任課教師  Instructor ：陳之碩
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W2 上課教室  Room ：醫環 110 ／ 72
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This is one-semester based introduction to probability and statistics for
undergraduate students in engineering. The course aims to provide elementary
topics needed for an understanding of basic statistics and its applications.
Topics cover probability, random variables, sampling, point estimation,
statistical intervals, test of statistical hypotheses, and linear regression.
Python with statistic toolbox will be introduced in class.
1.Text Book:
R26;Applied Statistics and Probability for Engineers,
Douglas C. Montgomery, 6th Edition, 2014. John Wiley & Sons
2.References:
R26;Essentials of Probability and Statistics for Engineers & Scientists Ronald
E.
Walpole, 2013. Pearson
R26;Statistics for Engineers and Scientists,
William Navidi, 4th Edition, 2014. McGraw-Hill
3.Teaching Methods:
Lectures
4.Syllabus:
1.Introduction to Statistics and Probability
2.Random variables
3.Probability distributions
4.Sampling distributions
5.Point estimation of parameters
6.Statistical intervals
7.Test of statistical hypotheses
8.Simple linear regression and correlation
A 3 hr lecture "applications of statistics in biomedical research"
will be delivered by Dr. Hsu-Chang Hao
5.Evaluation:
Midterm I (25%)
Midterm II (25%)
Final Exam (30%)
Homework/quiz (20%)

課程說明：
1. 選課：考量儀器可⽤數量，每班上限 25 ⼈，兩班皆滿額時才可加簽。
2. 分組：由授課教師將每班分為四組 ( 週⼀： ABCD ，週⼆： EFGH) 。
3. 評分⽅式：各實驗負責老師針對所負責的實驗評分。期末成績以各老師之授課時間權重後相加平
均。
4. 出席：遲到 10 分鐘內扣該實驗成績的 20% ，超過 10 分鐘該實驗成績零分。未到者該實驗零分。若有
由正當程序請假，實驗負責老師認可後，可找各實驗助教補做實驗。
5. 報告繳交：統⼀於實驗下⼀次上課時繳交，課堂開始時收⿑，遲交以零分計算。若上課老師不同，
請各老師協助移交報告。

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)

and the genetic information.

Chap. 5. Proteins: their primary structure and biological functions

Chap. 8. Lipids
Chap. 9: Membranes and membrane transport
Chap. 10: Nucleotides and nucleic acids
Chap. 11: Structure of Nucleic acids
Chap. 13: Enzymes-kinetics and specificity
Chap. 14: Mechanisms of enzyme action

科號  Course Number ： 11210BMES323100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：數值⽅法
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Numerical Methods
任課教師  Instructor ：劉耕⾕
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程簡述  (Brief course description)
This course provides students with basic mathematics knowledge and computational
tools for solving science and engineering problems. Topics that will be covered
include modeling, computers and error analysis, roots and optimization, linear
systems, curve fitting, integration and differentiation, and ordinary differential
equations.
課程⼤綱  (Syllabus)
Course keywords: Numerical methods, modeling, roots and optimization, linear
systems, curve fitting, integration and differentiation.
Course description:
PART ONE Modeling, Computers, and Error Analysis
Chapter 1 Mathematical Modeling, Numerical Methods, and Problem
Solving
Chapter 4 Roundoff and Truncation
Errors
PART TWO Roots and Optimization
Chapter 5 Roots: Bracketing Methods
Chapter 6 Roots: Open Methods
Chapter 7 Optimization
PART FOUR Curve Fitting
Chapter 14 Linear Regression
Chapter 15 General Linear Least-Squares and Nonlinear Regression
Chapter 17 Polynomial Interpolation
PART FIVE Integration and Differentiation
Chapter 19 Numerical Integration Formulas
Chapter 20 Numerical Integration of Functions
Chapter 21 Numerical Differentiation
PART SIX Ordinary Differential Equations
Chapter 22 Initial-Value Problems
Textbook:
Steven C. Chapra, Applied Numerical Methods with MATLAB for Engineers and
Scientists, 4th., McGraw-Hill, (2018)
References:
1.Abdelwahab Kharab and Ronald B. Guenther, An Introduction to Numerical Methods -
A MATLAB Approach, 3rd Ed., CRCPress, (2012).
2. Michael R. King and Nipa A. Mody, Numerical and Statistical Methods for
Bioengineering, Cambridge University Press, (2011)
3. J. Douglas Faires and Richard L. Burden, Numerical Methods, 4th Ed.,Cengage,
(2013)
Evaluation:
Homework: 30%, Midterm: 30%, Final Exam: 40%
Note: This course does not involve the use of AI.
科號  Course Number ： 11210BMES327200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫材料
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：胡尚秀
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F2 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is to provide the students who lack basic training in materials
science an introduction to the fundamental concepts of biomaterials, including
three types of biomaterials (metals, ceramics and synthetic and natural
macromolecules) and their chemical structure, physical properties, processing
and
applications. Biocompatibility of materials pertinent to their applications in
biomedical engineering is the other important issue to be given in this course.
This includes the interactions of biomaterials with proteins and cells and
biomaterial-elicited specific immune responses.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
1. W. D. Challister, Materials Science and Engineering, 8th Ed..
2. B. D. Ratner, Biomaterials Science, 3rd Ed., 2013.
3. S. V. Bhat, Biomaterials, Alpha Science, 2nd Ed., 2005.
4. W. Smith, Foundations of Materials Science and Engineering, McGraw-Hill, 2nd
Ed., 1993.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Contents
1. Introduction
2. Atomic structure and Bonding
3. Crystalline Solids
4. Imperfection in Solid
5. Strengthening Mechanism
6. Mechanical Properties of Materials
7. Phase Diagrams
8. Biomaterial Applications
9. Functional Biomaterials
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
30% The 1st Midterm Exam
30% The 2nd Midterm Exam
30% Final Exam
10% On-class discussion
100% Total

本課程實施 16 週課程 , 本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤
本課程將提供⼤學部學⽣基礎的分析基礎化學結構與組成所需之重要儀器分析技術，包括基本原 ?
972;、儀
器介紹、  及主要應⽤。擬介紹之儀器分析技術包括層析技術、光譜技術 ( 如紫外光 / 可⾒光光吸收光

科號  Course Number ： 11210BMES337100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Physical Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：吳劍侯
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 618 ／ 28
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
開課對象 : 醫環系⼆年級以上
課程內容 :
Physical chemistry is the branch of chemistry that establishes and develops the
principles of the subjects. Its concepts are used to explain and interpret
observations on the physical and chemical properties of matter. Physical
chemistry is also essential for developing and interpreting the modern
techniques used to determine the structure and properties of matter. The
course will focus on the topic of equilibrium.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Engel, T.; Reid, P. Physical Chemistry, 3rd ed., Pearson New International
Edition, Pearson Education Limited, Harlow, Essex, England, 2014.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Atkins, P. W.; de Paula, J. C. Physical Chemistry, 10th ed., Freeman, New
York, NY, 2014.
2. Ball, D. W. Essentials of Physical Chemistry, Cengage Learning, Taipei,
Taiwan, ROC, 2014.
3. Silbey, R. J.; Alberty, R. A.; Bawendi, M. G. Physical Chemistry, 4th ed.,
John Wiley & Sons, New York, NY, 2005.
4. Mortimer, R. G. Physical Chemistry, 3rd ed., Harcourt/Academic Press, San
Diego, CA, 2008.
5. Laidler, K. J.; Meiser, J. H.; Sanctuary, B. C. Physical Chemistry, Houghton
Mifflin, Boston, MA, 2003.
6. McQuarrie, D. A.; Simon, J. D. Physical Chemistry: A Molecular Approach,
University Science Books, Sausalito, CA, 1997.
7. Levine, I. N. Physical Chemistry, 6th ed., McGraw-Hill, New York, NY, 2009.
8. Castellan, G. W. Physical Chemistry, Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, 1983.
9. Klotz, I. M.; Rosenberg, R. M. Chemical Thermodynamics: Basic Theory and
Methods, 6th ed., John Wiley, New York, NY, 2000.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
板書
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week Topic Reading
1 Fundamental Concepts of Thermodynamics Chap. 1
2-3 The First Law of Thermodynamics Chap. 2
4-5 State Functions: Internal Energy and Enthalpy Chap. 3
6 Thermochemistry Chap. 4
1st Midterm Exam Chap. 1-4
7-8 The Second and Third Laws of Thermodynamics Chap. 5
9-11 Chemical Equilibrium Chap. 6
12 The Properties of Real Gases Chap. 7
2nd Midterm Exam Chap. 5-7
13 Phase Diagrams Chap. 8
14-15 Ideal and Real Solutions Chap. 9
16 Final Exam Cover all
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
20% Homework, Quizzes, and Attitude
50% 2 Midterm Exams
30% Final Exam

中文名稱  Course Title ：全球能源短缺衝擊
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Impact of Global Energy Shortage

上課時間  Time ： R7R8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 120 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
⼯業⾰命以來的這百多年，⼈類耗能⼤增，  每 33 年翻⼀倍；擁有能源極⼤蘊藏量的國家，都是懷璧其
罪的兵
家四戰之地；耗能的八成是釋放巨量⼆氧化碳的含碳能源，同學們有⽣之年，應可親⾝體驗原油與天
然氣枯
竭、全球暖化與極端氣候的困局
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
教學⽅式：講授、專題講座、影⾳教學與堂課習作，本課程學期中不接受⼆階停修退選申請；因應新
冠疫情，
本課程依政府規定，亦可應急處置切換成遠距教學。本課程不涉及 AI 使⽤，且列入⽀援「選修通
識」，⼤學部
各系均可做為通識學分課程，亦列入跨院系能源科技與永續學分學程。指定習作：課堂電⼦講義，助
教於課前
會側傳電⼦檔⾄校園數位學習平台的 http://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw ，給修課同學在 eeclass 網站閱讀。

⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
現今臨床醫學⼤量應⽤各類影像檢查以提升診療品質  本課程由臨床診察需求為起點  以影像判讀
的⾓度  介紹現⾏常⾒之醫療影像檢查與預期之未來發展⽅向  適於醫學物理與⼯程及分⼦⽣醫⼯程
之課程

課程說明
介紹臨床醫學的基本觀念，討論和其相關的議題，瞭解各科疾病，諸如 : 內科、外科、婦產科、⼩兒
科、急救
等之臨床表徵及其治療上的重點，當今治療⾯臨的問題，並學習與⽇常⽣活習習相關的醫療知識，最
後展望未來
醫學發展，推展⽣醫科技領域當中基礎與臨床之結合。
將專業艱澀的醫學知識，由受過醫環系教育的醫師整理介紹給醫環系或相關科系學⽣，藉以了解醫環
系的研究
如何在臨床醫學中找到相對應的研究題⽬。或是藉由課程的修習，能增加醫學常識，促進⾃⼰及周遭
親朋好友的
健康。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The departmental colloquium is a research talk that is supposed to be accessible
to everyone who does research in BMES department, i.e. it will assume that you
have familiarity with all the basic ideas of the field that everyone in the
department ought to know, but not a specialized knowledge of the subfield that
the talk is about. It ought to be pitched at the level of a beginning graduate
student.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No textbook assigned.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Listen and Discussion
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1.不分領域，本學期每⼈⾄少參加 10 次演講。
2.每學期每⼈⾄少發問 1 次  ( 全勤者可抵免；演講後附上問題交回助教登記 )
3.演講前、後均需簽到  ( 只簽到沒簽退者，倒扣⼀次 ) ，代簽者以不及格論處。

Topic 6: Bioelectronics and Biosensors

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程名稱：分⼦⽣醫基礎
英文課名： Introduction to Molecular biomedicine
課程編號： BMES 520100; 學  分  數： 3
地點時間：醫環系 101R / Wednesday Morning 2nd, 3rd, 4th class (9:20-12:00)
授課教師：莊淳宇  / Room 217 / ext 34229 / cychuang@mx.nthu.edu.tw
講 義：  eeclass (https://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw/)
Purpose
This course consists of lecture topics, concept of lab technique and periodic
examinations for basic molecular biology and medicine. The students are expected
to develop a comprehensive understanding of molecular biology and to be able to
critically select necessary techniques in their own research. This course is
designed for the graduate and advanced undergraduate students interested in
molecular biomedicine even though without biology background.
Performance: Lecture, Presentation, Examination
Schedule

Introduction
Ch. 3, 4: DNA Nature [Ch. 21: Purification of nucleic acid]
Ch. 5: DNA Replication [Ch. 21: Detection of nucleic acid]
Ch. 6: Gene Transcription
Ch. 13: Mutations [Ch. 23: PCR]
Ch. 14: Repair
Ch. 22, 16: Recombinant DNA [Ch. 22: Restriction Endonucleases]
Ch. 9: Transcription in prokaryotes
Ch. 10: Transcription in eukaryotes [Ch. 25: Analysis of gene expression]
Ch. 11: Regulation of RNA level
Ch. 12: RNA processing
Ch. 7, 8: Protein synthesis (Translation)
Ch. 24, 26: Genomics, Proteomics
Presentation: Group Oral
Text Book

0123785944).

Inc.,
Publication.

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫感測器
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Sensors
任課教師  Instructor ：劉耕⾕
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
中文名稱  Course title: ⽣醫感測器
英文名稱  Course English title: Biomedical Sensors
課程簡述  (Brief course description): This course will provide students with the
basic introduction of physical, chemical, and biological sensors. The purpose of
this course is to introduce the basic design and working principles of various
biomedical sensors that are currently used in biomedical research and the
healthcare industry. Recent advances and trends of biosensing technologies and
future biosensing platforms will also be discussed.
課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will provide students with the basic introduction of physical,
chemical, and biological sensors. The purpose of this course is to introduce the
basic design and working principles of various biomedical sensors that are
currently used in biomedical research and the healthcare industry. Recent advances
and trends of biosensing technologies and future biosensing platforms will also be
discussed.
指定⽤書  (Textbook): None
參考書籍  (References):
1. Florinel-Gabriel Banica, “Chemical Sensors and Biosensors: Fundamentals and
Applications”, 2012, John Wiley & Sons, Ltd
2. Ronald Pethig, Stewart Smith, “Introductory Bioelectronics: For Engineers and
Physical Scientists”, 2013, John Wiley & Sons, Ltd
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and presentations.
教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Biosensors
2. Nucleotides, Nucleic Acids, DNA, and RNA
3. Protein Structures and Properties
4. Affinity-based Recognition
5. Materials and Methods in Sensor Manufacturing
6. Nanomaterial Applications in Chemical and Biological Sensors
7. Spectroscopic Techniques
8. Optical Biosensors: Principles and Applications
9. Electrochemical Biosensors: Principles and Applications
10. Electrical Biosensors: Principles and Applications
11. Gas Sensors: Principles and Applications
12. Medical Applications of Biosensors
成績考核 Evaluation:
Midterm 30 %
Final project and presentation 50 %
Participation 20 %
Note: This course does not involve the use of AI.

本課程實施 16 週課程 .
⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明 :
有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據本

⽤
⽣成式 AI 於課程產出
學⽣須於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議題
發
想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相關單

修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
The aims of this course is to introduce the technology platforms, methodologies,
and the design of organ on a chip and artificial organs. Knowledge of organ on a
chip design and application will be introduce including brain on a chip, lung on
a chip, and disease on a chip. Various engineering issues surrounding the design
of artificial organs including biopolymers and biocompatibility, stem cell
technology, biomimetic systems, design principles for tissue and blood contact,
and control of artificial organs are emphasized. Knowledge to the design of
artificial organs including circulatory support devices, drug delivery systems,
artificial kidney, and other bioartificial organs are included.

Lecture

L2. Cell source and stem cells technology I

L4. Biomimetic systems
L5. Design of microfluidic culture devices
L6. Application of organ on a chip
L7. Human Body-on-Chips and disease model
L8. Mid-term exam
L9. Introduction of bioartificial organ
L10. Whole-organ decellularization
L11. 3D organ bioprinting
L12. Organoid engineering
L13 Application of bioartificial organ
L14. Oral presentation
L15. Oral presentation
L16. Oral presentation

Class participation(10%) 、 Mid-term exam (30%) 、 Final presentation (40%) 、 Quiz
(20%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：穿戴式⽣醫電⼦裝置設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Design of Wearable Biomedical Electronic Device
任課教師  Instructor ：王廷瑋
上課時間  Time ： M2M3M4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 618 ／ 28
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course will provide students with introduction to wearable biomedical devices
and
its principle. The content includes abundant multidisciplinary technologies,
including
circuit and system-level design, physics, electromagnetism, semiconductor
process,
micro/nanotechnology, etc. The recent academic research and commercial biomedical
product will be presented and guide students to see the overview of current
wearable
biomedical devices. The main goal of this course is to help students thoroughly
understand wearable biomedical device products from initial unmet needs to
design, and
eventually fabrication technologies.
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and presentations.
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to wearable biomedical device development
2. Cardiac electrophysiology and ECG device
3. Hemodynamics and blood pressure device
4. Photoplethysmography device
5. Capacitive sensor, piezoelectric sensor, magneto-plethysmographic sensor, and
force-
sensitive sensor
6. Electromyography device
7. Electroencephalography device
8. Bio-impedance sensors (impedance plethysmography, electrical impedance
spectroscopy,
and electrical impedance tomography)
9. Capacitive coupling sensor
10. Transcranial magnetic stimulation
11. Self-power sensors
12. Bio-MEMS
四、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Participation (20%)
Class experiment (30%)
Final presentation (50%)
科號  Course Number ： 11210BMES544500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：醫學成像器材研發
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Development of Medical Imaging Instruments
任課教師  Instructor ：林曉均
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 419 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course describes with the design and development process of imaging
instruments as biomedical devices. The goals are: 1) to provide a complete
overview of the medical device life cycle; 2) to revise imaging principals for
each main Medical imaging modalities (CT, MRI, ultrasound, optical methods); 3)
to understand the role phantoms play in system characterization and image
quality
analysis, i.e. spatial resolution, contrast, FOV, homogeneity, temporal
resolution etc; 4) software analysis for each of these characteristics would be
discussed, and the various assessment metrics considered.
This course will be taught in English
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Alongside traditional lectures, there will be a substantial portion of the
course
dedicated to dialog. This shall be achieved by posing open questions to
students,
and encouraging discussions amongst the class.
References:
- “Biomedical devices: design, prototyping, and manufacturing” Özel, Tugrul et
al. John Wiley & Sons, 2016.
- “The phantoms of medical and health physics, Devices for Research and
Development” DeWerd, Larry Edited by Michael Kissick. Berlin: Springer, 2014.
- “Advanced biomedical image analysis” Haidekker, Mark. John Wiley & Sons, 2010.
- Hariri, Ali, Jorge Palma-Chavez, Keith A. Wear, T. Joshua Pfefer, Jesse V.
Jokerst, and William C. Vogt. "Polyacrylamide hydrogel phantoms for performance
evaluation of multispectral photoacoustic imaging systems." Photoacoustics 22
(2021): 100245.
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1: Imaging instruments as Medical Devices
Week 2: Medical Device Design Process overview
Week 3: Verification, Validation, and the V model
Week 4: GMP and QMS
Week 5: Phantoms as QA tools
Week 6: Imaging Principals - a review and role of phantoms
Week 7: Project presentation (Part 1)
Week 8: Midterm
Week 9: Tissue mimicking material
Week 10: Dosimeters, Computational Phantoms
Week 11: Image analysis - Visualization and quantification metrics I
Week 12: Image analysis - Visualization and quantification metrics II
Week 13: Users perspective - Ergonomics and other considerations
Week 14: Imaging Phantoms: Applications
Week 15: Project presentation (Part 2)
Week 16: Finals
四、成績考核 (Evaluation)
40% Class attendance and participation
10% Project presentation
50% Midterm and Finals

⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明  「有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出」
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據
本校公布之「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，以下說明
如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出
學⽣須於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議
題發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相
關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明
科號  Course Number ： 11210BMES545300學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 14
中文名稱  Course Title ：神經科學研究⽅法
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Neuroscience research methods
任課教師  Instructor ：朱麗安
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：醫環 418 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Neuroscience is a multidisciplinary research field. From the biological perspective, neuroscience involves
single neurons to a neuronal network (brain and central nerve system), and eventually this network conduct
animal behaviors. However, to reveal the mechanism of this sophisticated neuronal network, cutting edge
technologies such as automated behavior quantification software, super-resolution microscopy, AI image
analysis for circuit computation. In this class, we aim to study how to study a neuroscience question
systematically, and how these new technologies were brought into play to advance our understanding to the
neuroscience field.
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and reports.
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
（將原 18 週課程內的 1. Imaging 部分集中為⼀週上課，讓同學更能比較⼆種⼯具之差異 ; (2) 三週實驗
課程縮減為兩
週，課程內容不變但密集上課）
Week 1: Introduction of neuroscience research.
Week 2: Genetic tools for neuroscience research, part 1
Week 3: Genetic tools for neuroscience research part 2.
Week 4: Animal behavior assays.
Week 5: Electrophysiology
Week 6: Optical imaging for functional and structural imaging.
Week 7: Midterm
Week 8: Experiment (Animal behavior)
Week 9: Experiment (Functional and structural imaging)
Week 10-16: Case study (reports)
四、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Midterm: 50%
Case study report: 50%

科號  Course Number ： 11210BMES548500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：超⾳波與光學：⽣醫技術與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Ultrasound and Optics : Biomedical Imaging Techniques and
applications
任課教師  Instructor ：林曉均
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 419 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course will start with a revision on the motivations of biomedical imaging,
along with common techniques and challenges. Then, we will zoom in on ultrasound
imaging techniques: from acoustic wave propagation in tissue to the
understanding of transducers and image formation. As we explore system designs
and their applications, we will denote the characteristics and limitations of
the method. We will follow this by covering optical imaging. As we go from
fundamentals to systems and applications, and finally to challenges and outlook,
discussion will be steered towards its features complementary to those of
acoustic techniques. Finally, the last third section of the course will be on
the study of photoacoustic (optoacoustic) methods, where we combine optical
excitation and acoustic detection.
⼆、參考書籍  (References)
- Biomedical Optics: Principles and Imaging by Hsin-I Wu and Lihong V. Wang
- Photoacoustic Imaging and Spectroscopy by Lihong V. Wang
- Journal articles (Photoacoustics, Nature Photonics, Light: Science &
Applications, Theranostics...etc)
- Supplementary handouts
三、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
This course will be a combination of lectures and group discussions. Students
will be encouraged to deduct and reason for the purpose of developing critical
thinking as well as reinforce cognitive participation. Homework will be designed
to challenge the students’ literature search ability, along with analytical and
presentations skills.
四、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Course outline
1. Introduction: motivations, techniques, and challenges
2. Image characterization: common features
3. Ultrasound: intro and overview
4. Ultrasound: acoustic wave propagation
5. Ultrasound: transducers and image formation
6. Ultrasound: systems and applications
7. Optical Imaging: light propagation
8. Optical Imaging: methods and applications
9. Optical Imaging: summary
10. Photoacoustics: fundamentals
11. Photoacoustics: systems and applications
12. Photoacoustics: challenges and outlook
13. Summary
五、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Class participation (30%)
Assignment (40%)
Exam (30%)

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Mathematics I
任課教師  Instructor ：潘詠庭
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Engineering Mathematics (I) covers the basics of the mathematical tools essential
for defining and solving
problems encountered by chemical engineers. These problems include by are not
limited to transport of maters
and energy, thermodynamics and separation processes, chemical reaction
engineering, process control, and
process design.
We will start our course with the introduction of 1st-order ordinary differential
equations (ODE). Such
equations are commonly encountered in simple chemical kinetics or steady-state
heat and mass transfer
problems. We will cover several types of ODE starting from separable homogeneous
ODE to general 1st-order
ODE. We will also cover 2nd-order ODE, which serves as an important foundation for
dealing with partial
differential equations students will encounter in non-steady state transfer
problems. Finally, toward the end
of the semester, we will cover some concepts in linear algebra and systems of ODEs
that can be used to deal with kinetics of series chemical reactions.
Below are some remarks for the course:
1. The lecture will be offered in English.
2. Final grades will be evaluated based on homework assignments (10%) and three
exams (30% for 1st, and 30% for the 2nd, and 30% for the 3rd exam).
Detailed course syllabus will be provide in the first class of the semester.

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHE 241002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Physical Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：王潔
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 202 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
Physical Chemistry I is a class focusing on gaining understandings toward chemical thermodynamics topics
such as work, heat, internal energy, heat capacity, enthalpy, entropy, free energy, Helmholtz free energy, Gibbs
free energy, Maxwell relations, chemical potential…etc. In this class, we will focus on (but not limited to) the
following topics:
1. The properties of gases
2. The first law of thermodynamics
3. The second law of thermodynamics
4. Physical transformations of pure substances
5. Simple mixture
6. Phase diagrams
7. Chemical equilibrium
After this class, you should be able to use the methods of equilibrium thermodynamics to describe the
properties and processes of macroscopic systems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Physical Chemistry, Atkins 10th
三、參考書籍 (References)
Zemanksy, Mark, and Richard Dittman. Heat and Thermodynamics. 7th ed. McGraw-Hill Publishers.
Callen, Herbert B. Thermodynamics and an Introduction to Thermostatistics. Wiley.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chapter 1 to Chapter7
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Library Assignment 5%
Midterm I 30%
Midterm II 30%
Final 35%
七、  AI 使⽤規則：有條件開放
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據本
校公布之「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，說明如下
學⽣須於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議題
發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相關
單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
based on the principles of transparency and responsibility, this course encourages students to leverage AI to
collaborate and mutually learn to enhance the quality of homework and essays. In accordance with the
published Guidelines for Collaboration, Co-learning, and Cultivation of Artificial Intelligence Competencies at
National Tsing Hua University, this course adopts the following policy: Conditionally open
Students must briefly explain how generative AI was used for the inspiration of topic, sentence refinement, or
structural reference in the footnotes of the title page or after the reference in their assignments or reports. If
usage is discovered without proper disclosure, instructors, the institution, or relevant units have the right to
reevaluate the assignment or report or withhold scores. When the course materials or learning resources have
been derived from generative AI, the instructor will also indicate this in the slides or orally. Students are
presumed to consent to the above ethics statement by enrolling in this course.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
傳統能源之⻑期使⽤已造成許多環境災害，有限的化⽯燃料亦為將來世界的能源體系埋藏潛伏性的
危機，發展綠⾊
能源已成為各界關注的焦點。綠⾊能源可分為再⽣能源與儲能技術，其中太陽能是極重要的再⽣能
源，在各國政府
積極的投入下，致使全球太陽光電產業以平均 30% 成⻑幅度順勢⽽起，也帶動對太陽電池的⾼度需
求，台灣包括聯
電、奇美等⼤廠相繼規劃投入。能源與環境將會是未來數⼗年⼈類所將會遇到的重要問題，所以希
望藉由此課程增
進學⽣跨領域綠⾊科技能源之素養，推廣綠⾊能源科技之創意活動，結合全校資源與產業界培育具
備綠⾊能源應⽤
及創新能⼒⼈才，與推廣再⽣能源應⽤科技於各系所，進⽽提昇我國綠⾊能源科技產業⼈才競爭
⼒。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces the basic laws of thermodynamics and its applications in
chemical engineering. The course contents include: the first and second laws,
volumetric properties, heat effects, thermodynamic properties of fluids,
solution thermodynamics, phase equilibrium, production of power from heat and
applications.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Smith, Van Ness and Abbott, "Introduction to Chemical Engineering
Thermodynamics", 9th ed., McGraw-Hill, 2021.

Course description: Instrumental analysis is linked with many fields of
science and engineering. Due to the large number and diversity of instrumental
methods, beginners typically will need a large amount of work to collect the
necessary knowledge in order to understand of the fundamentals of the methods.
Instrumental Analysis is an integrated course of lectures and laboratories and
you will be exposed to a wide variety of analytical instrumentation and
techniques.
Required Text Book
Principles of Instrumental Analysis, 7th Ed., by Douglas A. Skoog et al.
Thomson Brooks/Cole, CA

Exam #2

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHE 412000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：材料科學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Materials Science
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信文
上課時間  Time ： T1T2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Materials science investigates the microstructure of materials and their
physical, chemical and mechanical properties. This course is divided into three
parts: (1) Microstructure of materials, atomic bonding and coordination, atomic
arrangement in crystals and crystal defects (especially the theory of vacancies
and dislocations). (2) Thermodynamics and kinetics of materials Science: phase
diagrams, solid diffusion and heat treatment, which are the basis for
controlling and changing the microstructure of materials. (3) Properties of
materials: discussing the physical, chemical, and mechanical properties of
metals, ceramics, composite materials, and semiconductors.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
”Foundations of Materials Science and Engineering”, 5th edition, by W. F. Smith
and J. Hashemi, McGraw Hill, 6th edition.
三、參考書籍 (References)

中文名稱  Course Title ：程序設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Process Design
任課教師  Instructor ：林育正
上課時間  Time ： F7F8F9 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  212 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to teach how to apply heat and material balance,
thermodynamics, process optimization, and unit operation method to design
chemical processes using process simulators. The students are expected to:
1. Understand the procedure for chemical process design and delivery
2. Apply basic knowledge of chemical engineering to design a chemical process
3. Calculate process economics and implement optimization
4. Gain open-ended problem-solving skill
5. Learn how to use chemical process simulators
6. Present the results through written reports and oral presentation
● 參考書籍 (References)
Warren D. Seider et al. Product and Process Design Principles: Synthesis,
Analysis and Design. Wiley 2016.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and group project assignment

based on the principles of transparency and responsibility, this course encourages
students to use AI to collaborate or learn from each other to improve the quality
of the output of this course. According to the "Guidelines for AI Collaboration,
Co-learning and Literacy Development in University Education Sites" published by
the University, this course is conditionally open, please indicate how to use
generative AI in assignments or reports, as explained below
Students can briefly explain how to use generative AI for topic ideation, sentence
retouching, or structural reference after footnotes or citations on the title page
in class assignments or reports. However, in the Personal Reflection Report and
Group Interview Assignments of this course, students are not allowed to use
generative AI tools to write assignments. If it is verified and used but not
indicated in the assignment or report, the teacher, school or relevant unit has
the right to re-grade the assignment or report or not score points.
If the teaching materials or learning materials of this course refer to self-
generated AI, the teacher will also annotate them on the slides or verbally.
Students taking this course are deemed to agree to the above ethical statement
when choosing the course.

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHE 501000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等化⼯熱⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Chem. Engineering Thermodynamics
任課教師  Instructor ：林昆翰
上課時間  Time ： R5R6R7 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
based on the foundation of classical thermodynamics, this course will introduce
the key concepts of statistical thermodynamics and show a few examples of its
applications. This includes the basic assumptions and how we could link the
microstates with the macrostates via ensemble theory. In addition, we will use
this tool to calculate thermodynamic variables (e.g. free energies) of simple
systems from their accessible quantum states.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Terrell L. Hill, An Introduction to Statistical Thermodynamics, Dover
Publications, 1986
Donald A. McQuarrie, Statistical Mechanics, 1st ed., University Science Books,
2000
三、參考書籍 (References)
Walter Greiner, Ludwig Neise, Horst Stöcker, Thermodynamics and Statistical
Mechanics, 1st ed., Springer, 2001
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
每週上課時數 3 ⼩時
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
- Brief review of classical thermodynamics
1. Fundamental laws and basic concepts
2. Thermodynamic variables and relations
- Quantum description of systems
1. Basic concepts and interpretation
2. Translation: particle in a box
3. Vibration: harmonic oscillator
4. Rotation: rigid rotor
- Statistical thermodynamics
1. Microstates and phase space
2. Ensemble theory and canonical ensemble
3. Grand canonical and microcanonical ensembles
4. Other ensembles and fluctuations
5. Ideal gas (monatomic, diatomic and polyatomic)
6. Monoatomic crystals
7. Classical statistical mechanics
8. Chemical Equilibrium
9. Molecular dynamics
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
5 Homework sets 30%
Midterm Exam 35%
Final Exam 35%

課程的內容
於⽣成式 AI 中尚有諸多錯誤，且容易影響學⽣對基礎核⼼知識之判讀。
根據本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取禁⽌使⽤，以下
為相關的監
管機制：
1. 修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧所產出的作業、報告或個⼈⼼得。
若經查核
發現，教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHE 507000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：化⼯原理⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chemical Engineering Principles (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡德豪
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  221 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is designed to provide basic understanding of transport phenomena
and unit operations for graduate students with a non-chemical engineering
undergraduate background. It is divided into two parts. The first part takes 9
weeks to cover physical properties (viscosity, conductivity, diffusivity) and
(momentum, energy, mass) transport mechanisms, and shell balance techniques
for solving physical quantity (velocity, temperature, concentration)
distributions in simple transport problems. The second part focuses on several
key unit operations such as fluid delivery, mixing, separation and heating and
drying that are critical for students to learn so that they can apply some
basic knowledge and skill in this area when they start to work in domestic
plants.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bird, R.B., W.E. Stewart, and E.N. Lightfoot, "Transport Phenomena," 2nd ed.,
Wiley (2002)
三、參考書籍 (References)
王茂齡 , “ 輸送現象 ” ⾼立圖書  (1993)
Middleman, S., “An Introduction to Fluid Mechanics” and “An Introduction to
Mass and Heat Transfer”, Wiley(1998)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
lectures
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Transport phenomena: 3 weeks for momentum transport, 3 weeks for energy
transport, and 3 weeks for mass transport
Unit operations: Fluid delivery (2 weeks), mixing(2 weeks), separation (2
weeks), heating and drying(2 weeks).
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Transport Phenomena:
1 Midterm Examination 45%
Weekly in-class practice 10%
Unit operations:
1. Final Examination 25%
2. Project & presentation 20%

and metabolic engineering will be discussed. Along with introduction of cell
metabolism, this course will focus on the application of various techniques
in the production of renewable chemical and fuel.

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHE 517000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等程序控制
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Process Control
任課教師  Instructor ：鄭⻄顯
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
由於化⼯程序常是多變數、非線性及具有時延性質，因此課程著重在上述問題的分析與控制系統的設
計，同時也考慮最佳控制。課程包括座標系統之轉換、狀態空間表⽰法、矩陣分析、狀態空間解析、
觀
察度、控制度、穩定分析、最佳控制及數值解題⽅法等。
This course extends chemical process control problem to the areas of multi-
variable, nonlinear and time-delay processes. We will focus the analyses of the
control problems of the above processes. Meanwhile, the design of advanced process
control systems will also take care. The details of the course will include
transformation of state space system, matrices expression of process models,
observability, controllability and stability analyses,…etc.. Optimal control and
numerical analysis will be studied to solve these problems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Seborg, D.E., Edgar T.F. and Mellichamp, D.A., Process Dynamics and Control, Wiley
& Sons, Inc., 2004.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Thomas M. Marlin, Process Control- Designing Processes and Control System for
Dynamic Performance, 2nd Edition, McGraw-Hill International Editions, 2000.
2. Ogunnaike, B.A and Ray, W.H., Process Dynamics, Modeling and Control, Oxford,
New York, 1994.
3. Luyben, W.L., Process Modeling, Simulation and Control for Chemical Engineers,
2nd Edition, McGraw-Hill International Editions, 1990.
4. Smith, C.A. and Corripio, Principles and Practice of Automatic Process Control,
2nd Edition, John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1997.
5. Patrick, D.R. and Fardo, S.W., Industrial Process Control Systems, Delmar
Publishers, Albony, New York, 1997.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂演講，習題 ( 含電腦模擬 )
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1-2週：複習 Process control
3-5週： Cascade, Feed forward , Selected Control.
6-8週： Multi-variable Control.
9-12週： Digital Computer Control
13-15週： Model Prediction control
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHE 522500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼩⾓度散射原理與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Principles and Applications of Small Angle Scattering
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信龍
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
This course will cover the principles and applications of small angle X-ray and
neutron scattering, which are important tools for exploring the nanostructures,
thermodynamics and dynamics of matters. The objective is to provide the
students a solid background on these techniques, which may be
helpful for their research in related subjects. The topics covered in this
course are outlined as follows.
1. Basics of X-ray and Neutron Scattering
2. Small Angle Scattering
2. Applications to Polymer Blends and Block Copolymers
4. Application to Amorphous Polymers
5. Study of Surfaces and Interfaces
6. Inelastic Scattering for Dynamics Studies
The materials taught in class will be based largely on the book of:
R. J. Roe, “Methods of X-ray and Neutron Scattering in Polymer Science”, Oxford
University Press (2000)
Two exams will be held and a final written report is required.

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHE 545600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 10
中文名稱  Course Title ：分⼦與材料模擬
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computational modeling of molecular and materials systems
任課教師  Instructor ：林昆翰
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  421 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the
theoretical and practical aspects of computational modeling in chemical and
materials systems. Through this course, students will develop proficiency in
computational thinking, which involves the analysis of characteristic scales (time
and length) relevant to the problems of interest, and the utilization of
associated computational tools.
This course is designed for students in chemical engineering. Therefore, the
course emphasizes a hands-on approach where students are requested to investigate
three classic types of systems in chemical engineering via computational
approaches:
1. Organic semiconductors (ab-initio gas-phase computations: MO, IE/EA,
vibrational spectroscopy, thermodynamic properties (harmonic approximation),
excited-state properties)
2. Surface catalytic reactions (ab-initio solid-state simulations: band structure,
work function, adsorption energy, volcano plot, activation energy barrier)
3. Predictions of thermodynamic properties (classical force-field molecular
dynamics simulations: vapor-liquid equilibrium, activity coefficient)
Overall, the course is designed to equip students with the necessary skills and
knowledge to apply computational techniques to real-world problems in the field of
chemical and materials systems.
This course is a bit demanding, and it is strongly recommended that the students
know some basic knowledge of:
1. Quantum chemistry/ quantum mechanics
2. Python
3. Thermodynamics and statistical thermodynamics
4. Solid-state physics
This course places a strong emphasis on pre-reading assigned materials and in-
class discussions. This component will account for 25% of the total grade.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No
三、參考書籍 (References)
Quantum chemistry and quantum mechanics:
1. Molecular Quantum Mechanics / Peter Atkins
2. Introduction to Quantum Mechanics / David J. Griffiths
Computational chemistry:
1. Essentials of Computational Chemistry: Theories and Models / Christopher J.
Cramer
2. Introduction to Computational Chemistry / Frank Jensen
Materials modeling
1. Introduction to Computational Materials Science: Fundamentals to Applications /
Richard LeSar
2. Materials Modelling Using Density Functional Theory: Properties and Predictions
/ Feliciano Giustino
Density functional theory(DFT/TD-DFT)
1. A Chemist's Guide to Density Functional Theory / Koch and Max C. Holthausen
2. Time-Dependent Density-Functional Theory: Concepts and Applications / Carsten
A. Ullrich
Molecular dynamics simulations (MD)
1. Understanding Molecular Simulation: From Algorithms to Applications / Berend
Smit and Daan Frenkel
2. Computer Simulation of Liquids / D. J. Tildesley and M.P. Allen
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures (2 courses) + hands-on session (1+ course)
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. (5 weeks) Organic semiconductors (ab-initio gas-phase computations: MO, IE/EA,
vibrational spectroscopy, thermodynamic properties (harmonic approximation),
excited-state properties)
2. (5 weeks) Surface catalytic reactions (ab-initio solid-state simulations: band
structure, work function, adsorption energy, volcano plot, activation energy
barrier)
3. (5 weeks) Predictions of thermodynamic properties (classical force-field
molecular dynamics simulations: vapor-liquid equilibrium, activity coefficient)
4. (3 weeks) Final presentation
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Pre-reading assigned materials and in-class performance 25%
5 Homework sets 50% (10% each)
Final Presentation 25%

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHE 554000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：微流體系統於化⼯之應⽤與實作
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Microfluidic System: Application and Implementation in Chemical
Engineering
任課教師  Instructor ：黃振煌
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course mainly combines three parts. First, students will understand the fundamental aspects of kinetics,
mass-transport, fluid physics, design principle, and the use of software that are relevant to microfluidic
systems. Second, course will provide an understanding of current challenges in Chemical Engineering field.
Finally, students in the course will work together in several groups to design and fabricate microfluidic
systems or devices that address challenges in Chemical Engineering, with an emphasis on students' inventive
contributions and creativity. Participants in this course benefit from enrollment of students with diverse
backgrounds and interests. For chemical engineers, suggested but not required courses are CHE 352 (Transport
Phenomena and Unit Operations), CHE 306 (Chemical Engineering Unit Operations), and CHE 415 (Process
Design). Students are encouraged to contact the instructor to discuss enrollment.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes are available during lecture.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.“Transport Phenomena in Microfluidic Systems” by P. K. Panigrahi, Wiley, 2015
2.“Micro- and nanoscale fluid mechanics : transport in microfluidic devices” by B. J, Kirby, 2010
3. “Unit Operations of Chemical Engineering” 7th edition by W. McCabe, J. Smith, P. Harriott, 2004
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture, experiment, and interaction with students
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
- Introduction of fluidic mechanics, heat transfer, mass transfer
- Current challenges in Chemical Engineering
- Design principles and software
- Fabrication methods
- Suggestion and discussion
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Mid-term Presentation I– Introduction and current challenges, 25%
Mid-term Presentation II–Ideas, innovation and design, 25%
Implementation– Fabrication and Test , 10%
Final Presentation –Results, Discussion and Conclusion, 40%

五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
上課共 18 周  (2020.09.14-2021.01.11; no holiday)
考試 : 1次  (final exam 2021.01.11 oral reporting)
課程⽬錄  (Course content)
1. Introduction,
2. Photochemistry
3. Device physics
4. Materials chemistry and physics
5. Emitting species and charge transport
6. Organic light emitting diode (OLED)
7. Polymer light emitting diode (PLED)
8. Organic field effect transistor (OFET, including small molecules and,
Polymers)
9. organic Solar Cell (including small molecules, polymers and quantum dots)
10. Organic Memory Device
11. e-Book
12. Touch panel display
11. Processing technology
12. Flexible electronics
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
全學期考試 1 次，各選課學⽣將依所指定的題⽬尋找資料，並準備書⾯報告 (power point 格式 ) 於
上課時作⼝頭闡述約 20 分鐘。
There is one examination at the end of the semester. Each student will be
assigned a topic for searching on recent progress in that topic; he/she will
then write up a report in power point format and give an oral presentation in
about 20 minutes.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course describes the basic concepts of chemistry: atoms/molecules,
chemical bondings, molecular structure, atomic/molecular orbitals, transition
metals, coordination chemistry, organic chemistry, biochemistry, and chemistry of
the nonmetals.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
N. J. Tro, Chemistry-A Molecular Approach, 5th ed.2021, Person.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Other textbooks including general chemistry, physical chemistry, inorganic
chemistry, organic chemistry and biochemistry.
1. Chemistry by Silberberg. 2. General Chemistry by Petrucci, Herring, Madura and
Bissonnette.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and rationalize the contents via power point
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
The general chemistry course will covers Chapters 2, 3, 4, 8, 9, 10, 21, 22, 23,
25 in this fall semester.

13. Electrolyte solutions
14. Cell potential, electrochemical reactions

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHEM293000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：應⽤數學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applied Mathematics
任課教師  Instructor ：周佳駿
上課時間  Time ： M1M2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：化⼆  223 ／ 109
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
No textbook is required for this course.
References:
1. Erich Steiner, The Chemistry Maths Book, 2nd edition, (2008).
2. Donald A. McQuarrie, Mathematics for Physical Chemistry, 1st edition, (2008).
3. Donald A. McQuarrie, Mathematical Methods for Scientists and Engineers, 1st edition, (2003).
4. Robert G. Mortimer, Mathematics for Physical Chemistry, 4th Edition, (2013).
Course objectives:
This course is an introduction to applied mathematics required by chemistry undergraduate students including
multivariable calculus, linear algebra, and ordinary differential equations. Examples will be drawn from a
variety of scientific and mathematical areas.
Course Outline: (topics to be covered and order of presentation subject to change)
1. Complex numbers
2. Differential and integral calculus in several variables
3. Linear algebra
‧ Determinants
‧ Vector spaces
‧ Matrices and linear transformations
‧ The matrix eigenvalue problem
4. Operators
5. Ordinary differential equations
‧ First-order differential equations
‧ Second-order differential equations: Constant coefficients
Course Grades:
Homework (10%)
3 Exams: Exam 1 (30%); Exam 2 (30%); Exam 3 (30%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：有機化學三
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Chemistry(III)
任課教師  Instructor ：陳建添
上課時間  Time ： T2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：化  121 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Textbook:
(1) Organic Chemistry Eight Edition by Paula Yurkanis Bruice
(2) Lehniger Principles of Biochemistry, Sixth Edition, by David L. Nelson and
Michael M. Cox; W. H. Freeman and Company; New York
Topics
1. Carbohydrates
2. Amino Acids, Peptides, and Proteins
3. Catalysis
4. Coenzymes: Compounds Derived from Vitamins
5. metabolic Pathways
6. Lipids
7. Nucleosides, nucleotides, and nucleic acid
8. Synthetic Polymers
9. Pericyclic reactions

2nd mid-term Dec. 5-8: 35%

The contents in handouts, exercises, and problems account for 90% of the questions
in the exams.

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHEM331000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 100
中文名稱  Course Title ：無機化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Inorganic Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃暄益
王育恒
上課時間  Time ： M1M2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：化  B07 ／ 105
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
Basic knowledge of inorganic chemistry will be taught in this course.
The content includes:
Topic 1: Introduction
Topic 2: Atomic Structure
Topic 3: Symmetry and Group Theory
Topic 4: Simple Bonding Theory
Topic 5: Molecular Orbitals
Topic 6: Acid-base and Donor-Acceptor Chemistry
Topic 7: Reduction and Oxidation
Topic 8: The Crystalline Solid State
Topic 9: Chemistry of the Main Group Elements
Topic 10: Coordination Chemistry I: Structures and Isomers
⼆、指定書籍  (Textbooks)
Inorganic Chemistry, 5th Ed.
Authors: Catherine E. Housecroft and Alan G. Sharpe
Publisher: Pearson Prentice Hall
三、參考書籍  (References)
Inorganic Chemistry, 5th ed.
Authors: Gary L. Miessler and Donald A. Tarr
Publiser: Pearson Prentice Hall
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures will be mainly presented by slides.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
The content includes: atomic structure, molecular symmetry, group theory, MO
theory, acid-base chemistry, solid state chemistry, reduction and oxidation,
chemistry of main group elements, organometallic complexes.
Special emphasis this time will include more presentation on the structural
characterization and properties of nanoscale inorganic materials.
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
期中考 : 上課內容與課本習題。  => 100 分  x 2 = 200
期末考 : 上課內容與課本習題。  => 100 分  x 2 = 200

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
藥物化學 (Medicinal Chemistry)
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
深入淺出介紹藥物化學 , 從介紹 protein structure.enzy.receptors.nucleic acid, ⼀直到藥物動⼒學 . 藥物最佳
化.最
後簡介藥物設計與開發及藥物傳遞 . 並且透過團隊分組⼝頭報告 , 針對不同的疾病藥物開發歷程 , 進⾏深
入了解

2. Protein structure and function

6. Nucleic acids: structure and function

8. Receptors as drug targets
9. Nucleic acids as drug targets
10. Miscellaneous drug targets
11. Pharmacokinetics and related topics
PART C Drug discovery, design, and development
12. Drug discovery: finding a lead
13. Drug design: optimizing target interactions
14. Drug design: optimizing access to the target
15. Getting the drug to market
PART E Selected topics in medicinal chemistry (group presentation)
19. Antibacterial agents
20. Antiviral agents
21. Anticancer agents
22. Cholinergics, anticholinergics, and anticholinesterases
25. Antiulcer agents

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHEM504700學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾦屬醫藥化學與⽣醫材料
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Metal Pharmaceutical Chemistry & Biomaterial
任課教師  Instructor ：魯才德
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：化  325 ／ 36
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本⾨課程旨在 (1) 回顧四⼤⽣物分⼦及基礎無機化學、 (2) ⾦屬酵素功能以及作⽤機制介紹、 (3) 臨床
使⽤⾦屬⽣物醫藥介紹、 (4) ⾦屬⽣物醫藥及⽣醫材料的設計與開發。於學期末則安排由學⽣挑選相
關主題，進⾏⼝頭報告。
This class aims to (1) review four kinds of biomolecules and basic inorganic
chemistry, (2) function and reaction mechanism of metalloenzymes, (3)
introduction of FDA-approved metallopharmaceutics, (4) design and development of
metal-based biomedicine and biomaterials. In the end of the semester, students
have to choose a topic and give an oral presentation relevant to the metal
pharmaceutical chemistry & biomaterial.
⼆、指定⽤書
上課講義
三、參考書籍
1. Principles of Bioinorganic Chemistry.
Stephen J. Lippard, Jeremy M. Berg.
ISBN: 0935702725
2. Biological Inorganic Chemistry
Ivano Bertini, Harry B. Gray, Edward I. Stiefel, Joan S. Valentine
ISBN:1891389432
四、教學⽅式
(1) 講授  Lecture
(2) ⼝頭報告  Oral presentation
(3) 課堂討論
五、教學進度
Week 1
課程簡介  Introduction
Week 2-3
基礎⽣物分⼦回顧與介紹  Review of biomolecules
Week 4
基礎化學與無機化學回顧與介紹  Review basic and inorganic chemistry
Week 5-8
含鐵、銅、鋅⾦屬酵素的發現、結構、功能
Discovery, structure, and function of Fe-containing metalloenzyme
Week 9-10
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物： cis-platin 抗癌藥物
metal complexes for biomedical application: anti-cancer drug cis-platin
Week 11-12
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物： Tc/Gd/Mn/Fe3O4 ⽣物影像顯影劑
metal complexes for biomedical application: contrast reagent for bioimaging
Week 13-15
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物：⼀氧化氮控制遞送及⽣醫應⽤
metal complexes for biomedical application: controlled delivery of nitric oxide
and biomedical application
Week 16-18
期末考及期末⼝頭報告  Final exam and oral presentation
六、成績考核
期末考  Final exam (50%)
期末報告  oral presentation (40%)
平時成績  Attendance (10%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：雷射化學及光譜
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Laser Chemistry and Spectroscopy
任課教師  Instructor ：鄭博元  Po-Yuan Cheng
上課時間  Time ： R5R6F5F6 上課教室  Room ：化  114 ／ 34
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
1. Laser Fundamentals
Brief Reviews
Basic principles
A simple model for Lasers
How do we achieve population inversion?
Kinetic model for a simple 4-level system
Laser Gain Profile
Time dependence and pulse pumping
Q-switching and Cavity dumping
Laser Amplifier
Laser modes
Laser Resonator
Properties of Laser Radiation
2. Types of Lasers
3. High resolution tunable lasers + instrumentation for frequency-resolved laser
spectroscopy
4. Nonlinear Optics
harmonic generation, optical parametric oscillation/amplification,
Stimulated Raman Scattering
5. Introduction to ultrafast lasers + instrumentation for time-resolved laser
spectroscopy
A.mode locking and ultrafast laser pulse generation
B.types of ultrafast lasers
C.ultrafast laser pulse measurements
D.time-domain spectroscopy and its application
6. Laser spectroscopy
A. Laser Absorption spectroscopy
B. Laser-induced fluorescence
C. Laser ionization spectroscopy
D. Laser Raman spctroscopy
E. Nonlinear spectroscopy
7. Chemical Application of lasers
Case studies

1985)

科號  Course Number ： 11210CHEM543000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 25
中文名稱  Course Title ：材料化學分析技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Analytical techniques for Materials Chemistry
任課教師  Instructor ：楊家銘
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：化  326 ／ 65
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
General course information:
Course title/number: Analytical techniques in materials chemistry / CHEM5430
Time: R2R3R4
Location: 化學館  326 教室
Credit: 3
Instructor information:
Name: 楊家銘（ Chia-Min Yang ）
Office: 化⼆館  225A 室
Ext: 31282
e-mail: cmyang@mx.nthu.edu.tw
Contents of the course:
1) Introduction to techniques for surface analysis
X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), Auger electron spectroscopy (AES), low energy electron diffraction
(LEED), scanning probe microscopy (SPM)
2) X-ray diffraction (XRD)
Principles of X-ray crystallography, powder X-ray diffraction
3) X-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS)
Principles of X-ray absorption spectroscopy, experimental methods and data analysis
4) Gas physisorption analysis
Fundamentals of physisorption, BET method, BJH method, t-plot analysis
5) Electron microscopies and related analytical techniques
Scanning electron microscopy (SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), energy-dispersive X-ray
spectrometry (EDS), electron energy-loss spectroscopy (EELS)
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Not available.
三、參考書籍 (References)
General
D. Brandon and W. D. Kaplan, "Microstructural Characterization of Materials", 2nd ed., Wiley, 2008.
Surface analysis
J. C. Vickerman and I. S. Gilmore (eds.), "Surface Analysis-The Principal Techniques", 2nd ed., Wiley, 2009 .
X-ray diffraction
1. J. P. Glusker and K. N. Trueblood, "Crystal Structure Analysis-A Primer", 3rd ed., Oxford University Press,
2010.
2. C. Giacovazzo, (ed.), "Fundamentals of Crystallography", Oxford University Press, 1992.
3. W. David et al. (eds.), "Structure Determination from Powder Diffraction Data", Oxford University Press,
2002.
X-ray absorption spectroscopy
1. B. K. Teo, "EXAFS: Basic Principles and Data Analysis", Springer-Verlag, 1986.
2. G. Bunker, “Introduction to XAFS: A Practical Guide to X-ray Absorption Fine Structure Spectroscopy”,
Cambridge University Press, 2010.
3. Y. Iwasawa et al. (eds.), “XAFS Techniques for Catalysts, Nanomaterials, and Surfaces”, Springer, 2017.
Gas physisorption
S. Lowell et al., “Characterization of Porous Solids and Powders: Surface Area, Pore Size and Density”,
Springer, 2004.
Electron microscopy
1. D. B. Williams and C. B. Carter, "Transmission Electron Microscopy – A Textbook for Materials Science",
2nd
ed., Springer, 2009.
2. C. B. Carter et al. (eds.), " Transmission Electron Microscopy: Diffraction, Imaging, and Spectrometry ",
Springer, 2016.
3. J. I. Goldstein et al., “Scanning Electron Microscopy and X-Ray Microanalysis”, 4th ed., Springer, 2017.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures (PowerPoint)
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to surface analysis, XPS, AES
2. LEED, SPM
3. Introduction to diffraction analysis
4. XRD
5. XAS
6. Gas physisorption
7. SEM, EDS
8. TEM, EELS
