科號  Course Number ： 11210CS 530600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 80
中文名稱  Course Title ：社群網路
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Social Networks
任課教師  Instructor ：李端興
上課時間  Time ： T5T6F5 上課教室  Room ：台達 108 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. Overview of the course
The past decade has seen a growing interest in the complex “connectedness” of
modern society. At the heart of this fascination is the idea of a network. How we make decisions to
adopt a new idea, to invest by buying/selling security stocks, or even to vote for a specific campaign
candidate is influenced by the people that we are linked with. How people behave
is affected by incentives and by their expectations about the
behaviors of the people with whom they are linked.
In this course the students will be exposed to an interdisciplinary body of
knowledge in sciences, engineering, social sciences, economics, business, political
science and medical health studies. The goal of this course is to show how
social network is applied to the study of economics, political science,
and medical health study.
2. Subjects covered in this course
Students will be taught the state-of-the-art research results on social
networks, including Diffusion of opinions, information, rumors and etc.
Application of social networks to the study of economics, markets, and stock
trading. Application of social networks to the study of voting, election and political behavior
3. Topics covered
Representing and measuring networks
Empirical background on social, economic networks and health
Strategic Network Formation
Diffusion through networks
Learning and networks
Decisions, behavior, and games on networks
Networked markets
Game-theoretic modeling of networks
Allocation rules and cooperative games
Voting and election
4. Textbook
David Easley and Jon Kleinberg, “Networks, Crowds, and Markets: Reasoning about a Highly Connected
World,” Cambridge University Press, 2010.
5. Reference books
Serge Galam, ``Sociophysics a Physicist’s Modeling of Psycho-political
Phenomena,” Springer, 2012.
Matthew O. Jackson, “Social and Economic Networks,” Princeton University Press, 2008.
Ahmad K. Naimzada, Silvana Stefani and Anna Torriero, “Networks, Topology and
Dynamics Theory and Applications to Economics and Social Systems,” Springer, 2009.
6. Grading Policy
Homework (30%)
Midterm exam (30%)
Final (30%)
Class participation (10%)
本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤

科號  Course Number ： 11210CS 531400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 110
中文名稱  Course Title ：隨機演算法
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Randomized Algorithms
任課教師  Instructor ：韓永楷
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3 上課教室  Room ：台達 108 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
title:  隨機演算法   (Randomized Algorithms)
課程⼤綱：  
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
    
The following is modified from Preface of our textbook:
Randomization and probabilistic techniques play an important role in modern
computer science, with applications ranging from combinatorial optimization
and machine learning to communication networks and secure protocols.  This
course intends to give an introduction to the probabilistic techniques and
paradigms used in the development of probabilistic algorithms and analyses. 
Only elementary background in discrete mathematics is required.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Book)  
    Probability and Computing:  Randomized Algorithms and 
    Probabilistic Analysis, by Michael Mitzenmacher and Eli Upfal 
三、參考書籍  (References)   
    1. Randomized Algorithms, by Rajeev Motwani and Prabhakar Raghavan
    2. The Probabilistic Method by Noga Alon and Joel Spencer 
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)  
    Lectures and Tutorials (Lectures in English)
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Basic Topics:  Events and Probability,
               Discrete Random Variables and Expectation,
               Moments and Deviations
Core Topics:   Chernoff Bounds, Random Graphs, 
               Markov Chain and Random Walks 
Advanced Topics:  Mixing, Balanced Allocations (if time is available)

    Total            100%

Formula 1:   ( Average of Best 2 Exams ) * 0.8 +  ( Remaining Exam ) * 0.2
Formula 2:   30% + ( Average of 3 Exams ) * 0.7

There are many discrete optimization problems that are NP-complete. That is, we
cannot
obtain
the optimal solution for these problems unless P=NP. In this class, we will study
how to
obtain a
near optimal solution for these problems.

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Theory of Computation
任課教師  Instructor ：⽯維寬
上課時間  Time ： M7M8R7R8 上課教室  Room ：資電  127 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨
課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧

⼀、課程說明  (Course
Description)
This course will
focus
on the
traditionally
central
areas of
the theory of
computation:
automata
and
computability.
1. The automata
theory
studies
the definitions and
properties of
models of
computation.
These
models
are used in several
applied areas
of computer
science. E.g.,
the
finite
automaton model is
used
in text
processing,
compilers, and
hardware design.
2. The
computability
theory
studies how to
classify
problems
that are
solvable by
computers and
problems that are
not
solvable.
The theory
arises from the
discovery
that certain basic
problems
cannot be solved
by computers.
(The
discovery
was made during the
first half of
the 20th
century, by
mathematicians
such as Godel,
Turing,
and
Church.)
In this course, we
will
introduce
some of the
fundamental
results
in each
of the above areas.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text
Book)
三、參考書籍
(References)
1. Computational
Complexity,
by Christos
Papadimitiou
2. Introduction
to
Automata
Theory, Languages,
and
Computation, by
John
Hopcroft,
Rajeev
Motwani, and Jeff
Ullman.
3 Introduction
to
the Theory
of Computation (2nd
Edition), by
Michael Sipser
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching
Method)
Lectures and discussion
五、教學進度
(Syllabus)
1. Automata Theory:
Regular
Languages,

Free Languages

Theory:
Turing Machines,
Decidability,
Reducibility

科號  Course Number ： 11210CS 543200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：進階  UNIX 程式設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced UNIX Programming
任課教師  Instructor ：徐正炘
上課時間  Time ： T6F7F8 上課教室  Room ：台達 104 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
We will train the students to be qualified UNIX-like system programmers, by getting to know the commands,
development and debugging environments, system calls, and popular libraries on UNIX systems. On top of
that, we will discuss more advanced C/UNIX topics such as process control, daemon, signals, and threads.
Code examples given in Richard Stevens’ classic UNIX programming textbook will be reviewed and
discussed in the class.  
Prerequisites: Introduction to Programming, Operating Systems
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
W. Richard Stevens and Stephen A. Rago, "Advanced Programming in the UNIX Environment," 3rd ed.,
Addison Wesley
三、參考書籍 (References)
None
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and discussions.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
We will spend 1 to 1.5 weeks on each of the following topics.
1. Fundamental tools and shell programming
2. Files and directories
3. File I/O and standard I/O
4. System data files and information
5. Process environment
6. Process control
7. Signals
8. Threads
9. Daemon processes
10. Advanced I/O
11. Inter-process communications
12. Network I/O
13. Terminals
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Midterm (20%)
Final (20%)
Programming assignments (60%): 10 times

科號  Course Number ： 11210CS 546000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：軟體專案管理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Software Project Management
任課教師  Instructor ：黃慶育
上課時間  Time ： M5M6R5 上課教室  Room ：台達 108 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
(1) This course provides an overview of the roles, responsibilities, and
management methods of the technology project manager. The course assumes no
prior
knowledge in management techniques and is intended to teach students how to
develop approaches and styles of management for software projects. The course
assumes a basic understanding of software analysis techniques. (2) Project
Management is presented from a practitioner s view. Special emphasis is placed
on
professional standards such as IEEE software engineering standards, etc.
Specific
topics include managing people, leadership, software development processes,
estimation, risk analysis, scheduling and tracking, leveraging measurements, and
project completion. In-class project meetings are held to reinforce people
management concepts. (3)We also give a step by step description of the
software
metrics. It will include introduction to foundations of measurement theory,
models of software engineering measurement, software products metrics, software
process metrics and measuring management.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
(1) Joel Henry, Software Project Management: A Real-World Guide to Success,
Addison Wesley, 2004.
(2) Norman Fenton & James Bieman, Software Metrics: A Rigorous and Practical
Approach, 3rd Edition, CRC Press, 2015
(3) Adolfo Villafiorita, Introduction to Software Project Management, Auerbach
Publications, 2014.
(4) Watts S. Humphrey, Introduction to the Team Software Process, Addison
Wesley,
1999.
三、參考書籍 (References)
(1) Pankaj Jalote, Software Project Management in Practice, Addison-Wesley,
2002.
(2) Daniel Galin, Software Quality Assurance: From Theory to Implementation,
Addison Wesley, 2004.
(3) Watts S. Humphrey, PSP : A Self-Improvement Process for Software Engineers,
Addison Wesley, 2005.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
以投影片配合⼝述說明⽅式為主

第１週 . Introduction to Software project management

第３週 . The basics of measurement
第４週 . A goal-based software measurement framework
第５週 . Software quality assurance (SQA)
第６週 . Measuring internal and external product attributes
第７週 . Business visit I ( 校外參訪 )
第８週 . Manage your people & implement your process
第９週 . Leverage your tools and form your vision
第１０週 . Midterm Exam.
第１１週 . Organize your resources & sketch your schedule
第１２週 . Write your plan, role out your roles, and schedule your schedule
第１３週 . Get your support and leave the starting line
第１４週 . Monitor your project and reschedule your schedule
第１５週 . Business visit II ( 校外參訪 )
第１６週 . Deliver Your System
第１７週 . Final project presentation (I)
第１８週 . Final project presentation (II)

科號  Course Number ： 11210CS 546200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：軟體可靠度與測試
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Software Reliability and Testing
任課教師  Instructor ：黃慶育
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：台達 102 ／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程⾸先介紹軟體可靠度⼯程技術，我們會詳細說明軟體可靠度量化理論、模型建構技術與設計⽅
法、軟體評估理論、軟體可靠度管理 ( 例如要如何描述軟體可靠度、如何測試、如何評估、如何預測、
如何設計、如何提升 ) 及軟體度量等。除此之外，本課程亦將會介紹如何來進⾏軟體測試。我們將詳細
說明軟體測試相關的基本概念、理論基礎、施⾏技術、管理流程和⽅法等。
本課程結合了軟體可靠度與軟體測試，學⽣將可掌握軟體測試的基本理論與施⾏⽅法，並學習到如何
將
軟體測試結果及軟體故障數據，運⽤軟體可靠度⼯程技術來予以解析及詮釋，使之⽤來預測與評估所
開
發出來的軟體產品的功能正確性及系統穩定性，進⽽了解軟體品質、改進軟體測試的⽅法與程序、以
及
加強軟體開發過程中相關資源的分配。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
(1) J. D. Musa, Software reliability engineering: more reliable software, faster
development and testing, 2nd edition, Authorhouse, 2004.
(2) Paul C. Jorgensen and Byron DeVries, Software Testing: A Craftsman's Approach,
5th Edition, Auerbach Publications, 2021.
三、參考書籍 (References)
(1) M. R. Lyu, Handbook of Software Reliability Engineering, McGraw Hill, 1996.
(2) H. Pham, Software reliability, Springer-Verlag, 2001.
(3) Testing computer software, Cem Kaner, Jack Falk,and Hung Quoc Nguyen, 2nd ed.,
John Wiley and Sons, 1999.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
以投影片配合⼝述並搭配⿊板圖例說明⽅式為主
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
依指定⽤書之內容每週 1~2 個章節 (Chapter) ，必要時酌量調整之：
Introduction to Software Reliability and Testing
Overview of Software Reliability Engineering
Defining Necessary Reliability
Software Reliability Growth Models
Software Fault Tolerance
Off-campus business visit (I) (optional)
Software Quality & Standards
Software Testing Definitions and Concepts
Functional Testing
Structural Testing
Off-campus business visit (II) (optional)
Testing Efficiency and Coverage Analysis
Fault Seeding Techniques and Questioning Skills
Operational Profiles
Preparing for Test and Executing Test
Applying Failure Data to Guide Decisions
Deploying Software Reliability Engineering
Off-campus business visit (III) (optional)
Software Reliability Tools & Best Practice SRE

期中考 (50%) ，期末報告 (50%)

蔡老師的特⾊
https://youtu.be/mJhNr8xUGAA
老師是神奇⽯頭湯的引導者，奇妙的激發每⼀個⼈的潛能 !
老師細⼼佈局，⽤⼀種介於推⼒跟拉⼒之間的⼒量，讓我們不⾃覺的突破⾃⼰
老師⼈好，在矽⾕創業成功。但是絕不教你投機。同學上課有提出投機的點⼦，都會被老師當場提醒
投機成
不了事。老師和藹，念過神學但上課絕不會提宗教，有讓⼈易於親近的牧師氣質。  　
蔡老師不像是⼀般教導專業知識的教授，反⽽更像我們的導師 (mentor) 。我們如同⽺群⼀般，容易埋
頭吃
草⽽迷失了⽅向，老師如同牧⽺⼈在我們偏差時拉我們回到正確的道路上。
老師常⼀針⾒⾎，可以⼀句話將我們所有⼈打醒。
⼈好，但課怎麼會很操？這是蔡老師 " 溫和但不苟且 " 的獨特風格 ...
課程特⾊
與創業要付出的成本相比，這⾨課絕對是零成本
課堂中講授⼀套非常有系統性的創業學習⽅法，包含創業過程中的各項要素。內容更是包含了⼯程師
平常接
觸不到的⾏銷與財務，團隊的風險控管等
這⾨課真正的精華與挑戰不是在於課堂上的學習，⽽是在  " 課外 ” 每個禮拜與老師的 15 分鐘  meeting, 個
⼈
作
業與團隊的討論
蔡老師所要傳授給我們的是⼀種  “ 計畫型創業 ” 訓練。因為創業影響的不只是你⾃⼰的時間與⽣活，必
須⼀
起考慮你的創業伙伴、員⼯。你的決定可能影響他們⼀輩⼦ !
High-Tech Entrepreneurship
Ren-Song Tsay, Ph.D.
National Tsing-Hua University
School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
Course Description:
This course offers an intensive one semester emulation of a hi-tech company
start-up process and hence it demands heavy self-motivated reading, research,
and
hands-on practice. Students are responsible for forming teams of four to five
people, although the teacher may facilitate the process. At least half of the
members must be of engineering majors and two must be from business or law or
other school. Teamwork is essential for successful course completion. Each team
will need a technical advisor, business advisor and mentor. Three hours of
lecture
each week will cover systematic business plan writing steps. Outside of class,
students are expected to spend at least 12 hours each week on reading, research,
group discussions, and meetings with advisors and mentors. In the final week, a
business plan presentation to invited venture capitalists will determine the
final
grade.
Course objective:
This course is designed to bridge the gap between the academic and real world.
Each team will create a solid business plan; receive critique from practiced
venture capitalists. Upon completion, the team should be able to start a company
if desires so. However, even if the plan is not realized, each student will
acquire equivalent start-up experience and will be well-equipped for future
success. .

Course Requirements:
1. To mimic the real business environment, each deadline is a hard
deadline. No late reports will be accepted.
2. At the second class meeting, students must submit a 4-page biography
and a 1-page resume introducing themselves.
3. Every other week, each student must submit a 5-page book report on
the required reading.
4. Every week, each team has to complete a section of the business
plan, as covered in class.
5. In the final week, each team will present a 20 minute complete
business plan.
Note: All students have the choice to write in either Chinese or English.
All reports should follow the standard essay writing style and be typed in
12 pt font and double-spaced.
Grading:
Individual reports 30%, Team business plan 20%, and VC presentation 50%.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程介紹基礎電腦視覺、動作分析、虛擬實境、資料視覺化等技術，並透過案例分析，探討現今運
⽤
相關多媒體資訊技術於運動情蒐與訓練之系統的優缺點，進⼀步帶領學⽣進⾏使⽤者研究，針對使⽤
者
需求設計創新運動科技系統之原型。
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂投影片講授、作業與期末報告
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1: Syllabus & Introduction to Multimedia Technology for Sports
Week 2~6: Sports Video Analysis
* Machine Learning Basics
* AI Basics
* Web and AI technology for efficient data labeling
* object Detection
* object Tracking
* Court Calibration/Tracking
* Pose Estimation/Tracking
* Action Recognition/Event Detection
* OCR
* Trajectory Generation
* Tactics Recognition
Week 7~8: Data Visualization
* 3D Pose/Trajectory Visualization
* Data Visualization Tools
Week 9~12: Sports Training in VR
* 360 video filming
* VR UI design
* Virtual Character Creation
* Motion Capture
* Transfer Mocap Data to Virtual Character
* Multi-platform VR
Week 13: Project Brainstorming based on Pilot User Study
Week 14~15: Project Prototyping
Week 16: Final Presentation

中文名稱  Course Title ：數位醫療資料科學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Data Science for Digital Health
任課教師  Instructor ：郭柏志
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：台達 102 ／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course focuses on the practical considerations involved in utilizing machine
learning in healthcare settings. The course emphasizes the importance of creating
robust, private, and fair models using real retrospective healthcare data.
Throughout the course, students will learn clinical data curation, data
visualization, model development, and model evaluation. Students will complete
three homework assignments and will finish with a project proposal and
presentation.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None
三、參考書籍 (References)
Critical Data, M.I.T., 2016. Secondary analysis of electronic health records (p.
427). Springer Nature.
Celi, L.A., Majumder, M.S., Ordóñez, P., Osorio, J.S., Paik, K.E. and Somai, M.,
2020. Leveraging data science for global health (p. 475). Springer Nature.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
This course provides hands-on experience in dataset creation and curation, machine
learning training, visualization, and deployment considerations that target
utility and clinical value. Additionally, students will partner with computer
scientists, social scientists, and clinicians to gain a better understanding of
the multidisciplinary nature of data science in healthcare.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction to Data science in Digital Health
Formulating the Clinical Question
Clinical Database
Project Proposal
Data Curation
Exploratory Data Analysis
Model Development
Model Validation and Sensitivity Analysis
Bias and Fairness
Project Presentation
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Assignment: 45%
Project: 55%

科號  Course Number ： 11210CS 560500學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼈⼯智慧倫理、法律與社會
英文名稱  Course English Title ： AI Ethics, Law and Society
任課教師  Instructor ：賴尚宏
郭昱廷
林勤富
李怡俐
上課時間  Time ： F3F4 上課教室  Room ：台達 108 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This AI Ethics, Law, and Society class aims to provide an introduction of
various topics of AI Ethics to help establish a foundation for the students to
better understand the importance, design/principles, technology,
policy/regulation/governance, implementation, and impact of all aspects of AI
ethics. We will discuss these topics from the perspectives of Privacy, Safety,
Fairness, Equality, Robustness, Accountability, Explanability, Human dignity,
Human rights, Democracy, etc. We will also introduce various use cases and
scenarios of challenges in AI ethics (e.g., surveillance, recruitment,
autonomous driving, finance, etc.).
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
Instead of textbooks, there will be pre-reading materials (research papers,
journal articles, blogs, etc.).
三、參考書籍  (References)

Huttenlocher, Little, Brown and Company, 2021
A Human’s Guide to Machine Intelligence: How Algorithms Are Shaping Our Lives
and How We Can Stay in Control, Kartik Hosanagar, Viking, 2019

University Press, 2020

Press, 2016

Press, 2021

Carol Ann Browne, Penguin Books, 2021

MIT Sloan Management Review, December 2018
What Do We Do About the Biases in AI?, by James Manyika et al., Harvard Business
Review, October 2019

Management Review, October 2020

Pagallo, Elgar, 2018.

commercial contexts).
Google AI Principles: https://ai.google/principles/

us/ai/responsible-ai?activetab=pivot1%3aprimaryr6

(Week 2) AI History and Technology Overview
(Week 3) AI Applications: Scenarios
(Week 4) AI Design Principles: Fairness and Robustness
(Week 5) AI Design Principles: Privacy and Explainability

(Week 10) Legal Regulation of AI Weapons
(Week 11) Unemployment in the AI Age: Legal Responsibility of Government and

(Week 12) AI Ethics in Law & Society: Autonomous Driving, Smart Healthcare
(Week 13) AI Ethics in Law & Society: Law Enforcement
(Week 14) AI for Good and Social Impacts

(Week 16) Term Project Presentations II

科號  Course Number ： 11210CS 565600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 75
中文名稱  Course Title ：深度學習
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Deep Learning
任課教師  Instructor ：吳尚鴻
上課時間  Time ： T7T8R7 上課教室  Room ：台達 107 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明  (Course Description)
This class introduces the concepts and techniques of deep learning. The
course consists of three parts. In the first part, we give a quick introduction of
classical machine learning and review some key concepts required to understand
deep learning. In the second part, we
discuss how deep learning differs from classical machine learning and
explain why it is effective in dealing with complex problems such as the image and
natural language processing. Various types of deep models will be covered. In the
third part, we introduce the deep reinforcement learning and its applications.
This course also gives coding labs. We will use Python 3 as the main
programming language throughout the course. Some machine learning libraries such
as Scikit-learn and TensorFlow will be explained and heavily used.
Students are required to have proper understanding of Calculus, Linear
Algebra, Probability Theory, and the Python programming language. Although it
would be helpful, knowledge about classical machine learning is NOT required.
IMPORTANT: Students will group (3~4 people a group). This class requires
**each group of students to prepare a GPU card** to perform the necessary
computing. You can follow this
link (http://timdettmers.com/2017/04/09/which-gpu-for-deep-learning/) to
decide which GPU card to go for. NO GPU CARD PROVIDED IN THE CLASS.
⼆、  指定⽤書  (Textbook)
Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville, Deep Learning, MIT Press,
2016, ISBN:
0387848576
四、  教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Video Lecture + Labs
五、  教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Fundamentals of Machine learning (5 weeks)
2. Neural Networks (NNs): Design
3. NN Optimization and Regularization
4. Computer Vision & Secialized Deep Models
5. Natural Language Processing & Secialized Deep Models
6. Unsupervised learning & Deep Generative Models
7. Deep reinforcement learning (2 weeks)
六、  成績考核  (Evaluation)
Quiz: 20%
Assignments: 40%
Competitions/projects: 40%

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is a course on algorithms for VLSI physical design automation. Topics
include partitioning, floorplanning, placement, routing, and other related
issues.

(c)Design styles

(a)Min-cut bipartitioning
(b)Performance driven clustering
(c)Cut size and performance driven
partitioning/clustering
(3)Floorplanning & Placement
(a)Floorplan representations
(b)Simulated annealing based methods
(c)Partitioning based methods
(d)Numerical methods
(4)Routing
(a)Maze routing
(b)Global routing
(c)Channel routing
(d)Clock tree routing
(e)Power/ground routing

科號  Course Number ： 11210CS 655000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：計算機視覺理論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computer Vision
任課教師  Instructor ：賴尚宏
上課時間  Time ： T7T8R7 上課教室  Room ：台達 108 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is to give an introductory background in computer vision for senior
undergraduate students and graduate students. It will cover the following main
topics: image formation, feature extraction, texture, multi-view geometry, camera
calibration, 3D geometry reconstruction, image motion analysis, image
segmentation, object detection, object recognition, deep learning and related
applications.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture slides distributed in class
三、參考書籍 (References)
R. Szeliski, Computer Vision: Algorithms and Applications, 2nd Ed., 2022.
(http://szeliski.org/Book/)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Oral presentation and class discussion
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Image Formation (1 week)
2. Image Features (1 week)
3. Camera Calibration (1 week)
4. Stereo Reconstruction (1 week)
5. Multi-view Reconstruction (1 week)
6. Image Alignment (1 week)
7. Motion and Tracking (1 week)
8. Image Segmentation (1 week)
9. object Recognition (1 week)
10. Deep Learning (2 weeks)
11. object Detection (1 week)
12. object Tracking/Action Recognition (1 week)
13. Face Recognition (1 week)
14. Final Project presentation (1 week)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Midterm exam. 25%
Final project. 25%
Homeworks 40%
Class Participation 5%
Class attendance 5%

科號  Course Number ： 11210CS 772000學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：資料庫系統專題⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Data Base Management Systems(II)
任課教師  Instructor ：陳宜欣
上課時間  Time ： W3W4 上課教室  Room ：台達 615 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
This course is designed for graduate students who are interested in knowing
state-
of-the arts and applications of the information technology. The objective
of
this
course is: 1) guide students to recognize the current state of the art of
information technology and emerging killing applications; 2) identify their
research topics; and 3) write a research proposal in the related fields.
Students
will learn how to find an interesting IT application problem by surveying a
specific application domain, understand the current information techniques
available to solve the problem, assess the applicability and weakness of the
current IT technology to the problem, narrow down specific aims as research
goal
for writing a research problem.

科號  Course Number ： 11210CSR 510100學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 100
中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體元件導讀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Semiconductor Device
任課教師  Instructor ：⽩⽥理⼀郎
上課時間  Time ： R7R8 上課教室  Room ：綜三  101 ／ 111
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明
The basic knowledge about the semiconductor physics will be given.
One is the basics of the solid state. Next is the introduction of quantum physics to
describes the quantum state of electrons. Third is the band theory of electrons in
the solid state. Through these explanations, the basic electrical characteristics
inside solid states can be understood. Forth is the covalent- bond of the outer-
electrons in the semiconductor. Fifth is the statistics of electron and hole in Si.
Sixth is the mobility of the electron and holes in Si. Seventh is the
characteristics of PN junction. Eighth is the electrical characteristics of the MOS-
capacitor and MOSFET in Si.
● 參考書籍
1.Physics and Technology of Semiconductor Devices. Author is Grove, A, S.
2.Solid State Physics. Author is N. Ashcroft, N. Mermin, Dan. We.
● 教學⽅式　 Normal face-to-face lecture
● 教學進度
Week Topics
1 Introduction of the lecture
2 Basics of solid state
3 Reciprocal lattice and Bragg reflection
4 Introduction of quantum theory 1
5 Introduction of quantum theory 2
6 Introduction of quantum theory 3
7 Band theory 1
8 Band theory 2
9 Covalent bond in semiconductor
10 Statistics of electron and hole in Si 1
11 Statistics of electron and hole in Si 2
12 Mobility of electron and hole
13 Generation and recombination
14 PN junction 1
15 PN junction 2
16 MOS capacitor
17 MOSFET 1
18 MOSFET 2
● 成績考核
80 points comes from the results of report and examination. 20 points comes from the
number of attendances.
科號  Course Number ： 11210CSR 510400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：寬能隙功率半導體元件與製程優化
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Manufacturing and Process Optimization of Wide Band Power
Devices
任課教師  Instructor ：王維⼀
上課時間  Time ： R5R6R7 上課教室  Room ：綜三 LRA ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Welcome to the world of Manufacturing and Process Optimization of Wide Band Power
Devices. This course briefly introduces concepts and principles of WBG devices
before focusing on the process related issues, such as epitaxy, process flow,
passivation schemes, Vt control and reliability suitable from the high-volume
manufacturing (HVM) perspectives. Selected key topics enabling high manufacturing in
terms of SPC(statistical process controls) and yields are also discussed.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None
三、參考書籍 (References)
Students are encouraged to check out the YT published by the course instructor below
(extensive references are included in those videos)
https://www.youtube.com/@user-oy4qs1xo5u/playlists
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Power point handouts (in pdf) are used in this class before distributed.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
- WBG power devices: the big pictures with FoM
- High Volume manufacturing (HVM) basics: Yield analysis, SPC (introduction of
statistics for HVM) and DOE
- SiC: device technology landscape, Epitaxy, PN vs Schottky diodes, PN/MPS/JBS,
Thermal runaway, MS contact,
Interface States and Passivation schemes, Minority carrier lifetime, BPD and SSF
reduction, metal and carbon cap
contacts, reliability issues
- GaN: Ga-polar and N-polar GaN Epitaxy, Intel/Raytheon GaN CMOS, Reliability, 2DEG,
Surface and Interface states,
pGaN and band engineering. Carbon acceptor deep traps
科號  Course Number ： 11210CSR 520100學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 120
中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體材料導讀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Semiconductor Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：廖建能
上課時間  Time ： T3T4 上課教室  Room ：材料 511 ／ 170
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
objective:
The purpose of this course is to provide students of engineering discipline an
overview of the basic properties, applications, and major types of semiconductors,
as well as characterization techniques employed in the analysis of semiconductor
materials.
Textbook:
1. W. F. Smith and J. Hashemi, "Foundations of Materials Science and Engineering",
6th Ed., McGraw-Hill, ISBN 978-1-260-09203-5
2. B. G. Yacobi, "Semiconductor Materials: An Introduction to Basic Principles",
2003 Kluwer Academic/Plenum Publishers, ISBN 0-306-47361-5
Teaching Method: Lecture
Evaluation: Homework (20%), Quiz (20%), Midterm (30%), Final (30%)
Outline
1. Basics of materials science (W1-W2)
- Mechanical properties of materials
- Electrical properties of materials
- Microstructures and phases

科號  Course Number ： 11210CSR 530100學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 90
中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體設計導讀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Semiconductor Design
任課教師  Instructor ：黃朝宗
劉靖家
黃稚存
上課時間  Time ： M7M8 上課教室  Room ：綜三  101 ／ 111
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. Course Description
The objective of this course is to provide students an overview of VLSI designs,
particularly about how we manage to integrate billions of transistors to perform
complex functions. This course focuses on three major topics: logic design,
electronic design automation, and computer architecture. Students will learn the
layered abstraction of design technology from the ground up, including
combinational/sequential circuits, gate-level design, physical layout, micro-
architecture, and processor cores.
2. Teaching method
In-class lectures.
3. Syllabus
This course is partitioned into three parts for a sixteen-week semester, and each
part will have its own exam for evaluation.
Part 1. Logic design and hardware description language (HDL)
CMOS logic gates, combinational logic, CMOS latches and flip-flops, sequential
blocks, and memory.
Part 2. Electronic design automation (EDA)
Cell-based design, timing and power analysis, clock tree and power grid, floorplan
and routing.
Part 3. Computer architecture
RISC-V instruction set architecture (ISA), single-cycle processor, pipelined
processor, and memory hierarchy.
4. Evaluation (TBD)
Part-1 Exam (33%)
Part-2 Exam (33%)
Part-3 Exam (34%)
5. Website
eeclass.nthu.edu.tw
6. Reference book (not required)
CMOS VLSI Design: A Circuits and Systems Perspective, 4th Edition, Neil Weste,
David Harris, Addison Wesley, 2010
Digital Design and Computer Architecture, RISC-V Edition, Sarah Harris, David
Harris, Morgan Kaufmann, July 2021
7. Usage of generative AI tools
If report writing is assigned, generative AI tools are conditionally allowed if
the student clearly states how the texts are generated.

A、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將以英文授課，主要介紹半導體製程 , 包括基本原理 , 製程技術全貌 , 及實際⼯業上應⽤ . 使研
究所學⽣在跨入業界或更深入研究前 , 對半導體製程技術 , 能⼀窺全貌 , 將來能學以致⽤。
(PS: 本 11210CSR 540100 半導體製程導讀 (Introduction to Semiconductor Process) 內容類
似原 93年之 [MS540400 半導體製程課程 ] 、  [MS437000 半導體製程課程 ] 、與  [MS4141000 半導體製
程課程 ],[MS540400 半導體製程課程 ] ，因此將申請抵免抵免 NDL 之「積體電路製程
技術訓練班 ] 。 )
This course will be offered in English and will introduce semiconductor
processing, including materials/devices basics, process technologies, and their
application in industry. The students can have a thorough overview on
semiconductor process technologies before going industry or for further indepth
studies.
PS: For the students who pass this course 11210CSR 540100 (Introduction to
Semiconductor Process), we will apply its waive to take the NDL's training
course of Integrated Circuit Processing Technology, which is required by NDL
before the usage of NDL facilities.

● 課程說明 (Course Description)
癌症是現代社會裡最致命的疾病，⼤部分的⼈碰到癌症時，總是聞之⾊變，將之視為絕症。但並不是
每
種癌症都這麼可怕，也有許多診斷與治療的⽅法，因此本課程希望能夠讓學⽣具備有更多與癌症相關
的
正確知識，同時，也可增進跨領域的交流，讓更多不同專⻑的學⽣投入癌症研究的相關新藥、診斷技
術、與醫材的開發。
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
本課程為⾃編講義
● 參考書籍 (References)
1. 癌症⼤祕密：醫師很想說、你很想問的 65 個問題　出版社：如何
2. 細胞反叛　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　出版社：天下文化
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
教學⽅式主要以課堂理論講述與影片分享為主，前半學期會與學⽣介紹癌症發⽣的原因與⽬前常⾒的
檢
測及治療⽅法。在前⼆節課理論介紹完後會請每位學⽣提出想問的問題，再由學⽣投票決定 18 個希望
被
回答的問題。問題會分配在第 9-16 週由同學分組回答，每週回答⼆題，同學報告之後再由老師補充相
關
資料。希望能藉由這種互動的⽅式，瞭解學⽣想知道的問題是什麼，同時也會開放課堂討論，達到教
學
相⻑的⽬的。
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Week 1 第⼀問：癌細胞是怎麼跑進⾝體裡的？
2. Week 2 第⼆問：癌症的轉移是怎麼發⽣的？
3. Week 3 第三問：健康檢查真的可以預防癌症嗎？
4. Week 4 第四問：什麼是化療？什麼是放射線療法 ?
5. Week 5 第五問：什麼是免疫療法？什麼是標耙治療？
6. Week 6 第六問：什麼是精準醫療？
7. Week 7 第七問：有可能靠改變飲食或腸道菌治療癌症嗎？
8. Week 8 第八問：期中考
9. Week 9-16 第九到⼗六問：第三周時請每個同學提出想問的問題⼀題，並開投票決定要回答
那些問題，由同學分組每週回答⼆題，並開放⼤家討論。

⼀、課程說明
對於醫科系的學⽣來說，瞭解「醫療與社會」的關係對於進入⽣醫領域⼯作是⼀種關鍵的知識裝備。
然⽽，要能掌握這兩者之間的關連，⼀則需要從社會學的觀點來認識它們之間的基本關係，⼆則需要
理解兩者⼀起發展的幾種新興趨勢，三則需要瞭解兩者之間的張⼒（例如：共⽣或制衡）。本課程正
是針對上述三個⽬標，分為三個模組：
1. 從社會學的觀點來認識「醫療與社會」，以「社會學的想像⼒」來理解社會的醫療化、醫
療的專業化，對於健康不平等之影響（第 2 ⾄ 5 週）。
2. 對比台灣在地的關鍵案例與歐美新興趨勢，作為討論近幾⼗年「醫療與社會」關係的重要
議題的基礎（第 6 ⾄ 10 週）。
3. 透過「醫療與社會」之間的張⼒，來認識其中的制衡或共存關係，並依此理解其中涉及哪
些重要社會制度（第 13 ⾄ 16 週）。
＊本課程為 16 週，另有四⼩時關於台灣 Covid-19 疫情的「⾃主學習」。

四、教學⽅式
本課程各週皆有指定閱讀，同學需先⾏閱讀，老師則會講解並引導討論。此外，本課程也有安排其他
形式的授課（指，紀錄片討論、邀請演講、醫學⼈文劇），同學則需在課後繳交反思⼼得。最後，本
課程要求學⽣以⼩組為單位，完成⼀份關於「醫療與社會」之報告，因此，安排期中提案與期末呈
現。

八、⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明：  「有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告」
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據
本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，請註
明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告，說明如下：
1.學⽣可於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI
進⾏議題發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。然⽽，在本課程的「個⼈⼼得」、「⼩組報告」
中，學⽣不得使⽤⽣成式 AI ⼯具撰寫作業。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或
相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
2.修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction of Internal Medicine

上課時間  Time ： R7R8 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆  109 ／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程內容
(⼀)「器官⽣理功能」：
簡介⾝體各⼤器官其正常⽣理功能，深入討論⼼臟、肝膽與腸胃系統、肺臟、腎臟、內分泌系統 ( 如甲
狀腺、胰臟、腎上腺等 ) 、⾎液、腦部與脊髓中樞神經系統、與周邊神經系統。
(⼆)「疾病」：
以上器官系統常⾒且重要疾病、臨床表徵、如何經由各種儀器或檢驗結果確定診斷
(三)「治療」：
台灣醫療，⼈才是最重要的資源，其他無論藥物、設備、醫材⼤多與先進國家同步。本課程其中⼀⼤
亮
點，在針對各種疾病，讓學⽣了解⽬前最常⾒與最新的治療⽅式。
評分標準
筆試：期中考與期末考，各佔 50% ，總和為期末總成績
學⽣使⽤ AI 的規則 : 本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤

⼀、課程說明
1.課程⽬標 :
(中文 )
(1) 以臨床⽅⾯⼀般常⾒的疾病及問題為出發點
(2) 使學⽣具備正確運動傷害防護及治療知識
(3) 透過醫學相關知識，來預防運動傷害及增加運動表現
(4) 運動處⽅設計及專業運動指導以符合各族群之需求，促進個⼈及其家⼈健康。
(英文 )
(1)Starting from the common diseases and problems in clinical practice
(2)Having students with correct sports injury protection and treatment knowledge
(3)Preventing sports injuries and increasing athletic performance through
medical knowledge
(4)Sports prescription design and professional sports guidance to meet the
needs
of various ethnic groups and promote the health of individuals and their
families.

基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據本
校
公布之「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，以下說明如何使

發
想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相關單
位
有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教
師
也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

科號  Course Number ： 11210DMS 390002學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 8
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：邱于芯
上課時間  Time ： R2 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆  213 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Requirement:
1.The presentation order will be decided in the first class.
2.Each student will select and present a peer-reviewed research paper (i.e.,
no Reviews/Perspectives), published in the last 4 years (2017~2021) by any of
the corresponding authors below:
David E. Clapham; Karl Deisseroth; Catherine Dulac; Ehud Isacoff; Akiko
Iwasaki; Lily Y. Jan; Thomas J. Jentsch; David Julius; Zachary A. Knight;
Ardem Patapoutian; Kodi Ravichandran; David M. Sabatini; Bernardo Sabatini;
Li-Huei Tsai.
Or, a peer-reviewed research paper, published within 2 years (2019-2021),
depicting roles of ion channels in non-excitable cells (i.e.g, not neurons nor
muscle cells) on journals with Impact Factor >10
(https://jcr.clarivate.com/).
Grading Criteria (pending to change):
1. Oral presentation (45%):
o Submit the paper of choice on time (5%)
o Post your paper of choice on time (5%)
o Submit the presentation slides on time (5%)
o Averaged score from the Presentation Evaluation Form (30%)
2. Participation (40%):
o Submit 2 questions to iLMS (22%)
o participate in Q&A (18%)
3. Attendance (15%): no skipping class more than 2 times without prior
notice or acceptable reasons. Student coming in 10 minutes after class start
is considered as skipping class.
4. Presentation in English: for those who choose to present the paper in
English, additional 5 bonus points will be added to the final score. Note, the
final score is capped at 100 pts.
5. 有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出。
Online Resources:
NCBI Pubmed ：  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/
Journal Citation Reports ： https://jcr.clarivate.com/
Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/
Faculty of 1000: https://f1000.com/prime/home
bioRxiv: https://www.biorxiv.org/
科號  Course Number ： 11210DMS 390003學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 8
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：林郁婷
上課時間  Time ： R2 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 218 ／ 15
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Requirements:
1. Course requirements will be presented in the first class, including paper
selection, presentation order, and grading criteria. Student presentations will be
started in the third class.
2. Presented papers will be assigned from neuroscience-related journals and
published in the last two years.
3. The presenter has to provide the paper to classmates and the teacher one week
before the presentation week. Each presentation should be finished in 30-35
minutes and the discussion will be in the next 10 minutes.
4. The host will be the previous presenter responsible for the brief
introduction at the beginning and the Q&A session after the presentation.
5. Students should read the paper before each class and participate in the Q&A
session. Each student should have at least three questions in the semester.
6. Grading: Oral presentation 70%; Q&A 20%; Attendance 10 %.

中文名稱  Course Title ：經濟思辨⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Reasoning in an Economic Way I
任課教師  Instructor ：劉瑞華
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：台積 203 ／ 72
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1.參考書籍
《經濟學，最強思考⼯具》，商業周刊出版， 2018 年。
《⼤偵探經濟學》，貓頭鷹出版， 2023 年。
《經濟學教我的思考武器：關於幸福與⾦錢的思考》，經濟新潮社出版， 2023 年。
2.教學⽅式：老師授課之外，同學需組成⼩組，進⾏討論並完成分組作業。
3.教學進度
⼀、準備展開經濟思辨
觀察、閱讀、思考、解釋
論述、分析、討論、印證
你注意過住家或學校附近開張或歇業的⽣意嗎？想過為什麼嗎？
⼆、經濟思辨的基礎
理性⾏為與合理現象：個體到總體，微觀到宏觀
⾏為的理性：⼀⼈、兩⼈、三⼈群體
你曾經翹課嗎？翹課時做了什麼？你會因為同班同學翹課⼈數多⽽翹課嗎？如果你不翹課，你贊成老
師上課點名嗎？
三、經濟思辨的起步
選擇與代價：機會成本。
選擇與限制：資源、技術與制度
你看⾒夜市裡兩間販賣類似食物的⼩店，⼀間需要⼈排隊等候，⼀間不必，你會選擇哪⼀家？如果兩
間都要等候，⼀間可以取號離開，⼀間必須現場排隊，你會選擇哪⼀間？
四、價格機能
需求與供給
價格變動
價格為什麼上漲？⼿機價格上漲和雞蛋價格上漲的原因⼀樣嗎？⼿機與雞蛋價格同時上漲的原因呢？
五、市場
競爭，壟斷與其他
市場的形成與變動
你通常會⽤上網購物⽅式買什麼東⻄？什麼東⻄你不會在網上購買？你會將修過課程的課本賣給別⼈
嗎？
六、市場失靈的問題
市場會出什麼問題？
處理市場問題的⽅式
如果政府經費⾜夠，你贊成在每個路段都裝監視照相設備取締交通違規嗎？你贊成在校園中設置付費
吸煙區嗎？如果所收費⽤會回饋為學⽣福利，你會改變意⾒嗎？
七、 (⾄學期末 ) 分組討論與作業題綱
- 五⼗年前台灣有許多⼈從事家庭代⼯，現在為何少⾒？
- 有哪些物品在你⼩時候是台灣製造 ( 國外進⼝ ) ，現在則是從國外進⼝ ( 台灣製造 ) ，你認為這種變化
的原因是什麼？
- 政府為什麼要補貼⼤學學費？
- 勞⼯為何⼀再要求提⾼最低⼯資率？
- 提⾼利率為何可以抑制通貨膨脹？
- 器官販賣應該 ( 適度 ) 合法化嗎？
- 戰爭為何發⽣？如何遏⽌戰爭？

個⼈作業 : 40%
上課臨時抽考 : 10%

Updated on 9/8/2023
# Attendance for the entire first class on 9/15 is mandatory; failure to do so may
hinder students' ability to request extra selections.
預計修習（含欲加簽）此課程同學須於第⼀次上課 (9/15) 全程出席，否則不予加簽。

1. This course's primary objective is to familiarize students with financial
reporting procedures and facilitate their comprehension of financial statements.
Additionally, it equips students for careers in related fields and lays the
groundwork for Intermediate Accounting, Cost Accounting, Management Accounting,
and Auditing.
2. Textbook
Principles of Financial Accounting IFRS by John J. Wild, Winston Kwok, and Ken
W. Shaw (ISBN: 9786269646876)
3. References
(1) Financial Accounting 3/e IFRS Edition by Earl K. Stice, James D. Stice, W.
Steve Albrecht, Monte R. Swain, Rong-Ruey Duh, and Audrey Wenhsin Hsu (ISBN:
9789814962582)
(2) Financial Accounting with International Financial Reporting Standards by Jerry
J. Weygandt, Paul D. Kimmel, and Donald E. Kieso (ISBN: 9781119504306)
(3) IFRS® Sustainability Disclosure Standard
4. Teaching Method
Lecture: 40%
Discussion: 50%
Presentation: 10%
5. Evaluation
Attendance
Exam
6. Course Schedule (3.4 hours per week)
(1) No class: 9/29, 12/8, 1/5
(2) Other than Exam: 15:30-18:30 + one 10-min break
(3) Exam (10/27, 12/1, 1/12): 15:30-18:20 + no break
7. Conditionally open; please provide details on the application of generative AI
in the course output.

中文名稱  Course Title ：會計學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Accounting (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：李怡嫺
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：台積 223 ／ 72
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
1.To introduce to the students the conceptual structure of accounting.
2.To provide an opportunity to apply theoretical solutions to practical
problems.
Since this course is offered to students with non-accounting major and that the
number of participants is expected to be manageable, the detailed contents of
the course may be adjusted and tailored, during the semester, to the needs of
the class and in accordance with the different backgrounds of the participants.
With over 15-year experience in the accounting profession, the instructor is
also prepared and keen to share, whenever appropriate, her experiences as a
accounting manager with certificate of CPA(Certified Public Accountant)in USA
and SAP Finance consultant ; particularly, the accounting's application in the
Accounting policies and procedures and accounting (ERP) system .
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Financial Accounting--IFRS edition
By Weygandt Kimmel Kieso
三、參考書籍 (References)
財務會計準則公報

Economics 216102
Statistics (I) Fall 2023
(Tentative, subject to change)
Course Outline
Instructor: Prof. Loretta Fung ( 馮炳萱 )
Office: 803 TSMC Building
E-mail: phfung@mx.nthu.edu.tw
Phone: 516-2165 or extension 62165
Office Hours: TBA
Class Meets: Mondays 10:10 to 13:10
Location: GenIV 224
Course Website: 國立清華⼤學  eLearn 數位學習平台  (elearn.nthu.edu.tw)
TA:
Course objectives:
This course is the first part of a two-semester sequence. The purpose of this sequence is introducing statistical
methods and applications for economics students. We will emphasize on statistical concepts and methods that
are commonly used in economics and business, and these materials will be presented with applications to data
analysis. In the fall semester, we will focus on probability, discrete and continuous probability distribution,
sampling and confidence interval estimation.
Textbook:
Anderson, D., D. Sweeney, T. Williams, J. Camm, J. Cochran, M. Fry, and J. Ohlmann (2019). Statistics for
Business and Economics. 14th edition. Cengage.
Evaluation:
The course grade is based on three elements: four assignments, a midterm exam, and a final exam.
Assignments: There will be four problem sets and they will be assigned after finishing major topics. You have
at least seven days to work on each assignment. The assignments will include both problem solving and
empirical exercises. Solution keys will be posted upon the submission deadline, so late submission is not
accepted. Empirical exercises require the use of excel.
Midterm Exam: The midterm will be held in class during the class hours. The exam is expected to take 110
minutes. There will be no make-up exams for the midterm. If you miss the midterm, you must give a valid
reason and proof, and the weight will be assigned to the final.
Final Exam: The final exam will be held during the class hours. It is comprehensive and it is expected to take
110 minutes. If you have to miss the final, you must give a valid reason and proof, and contact me to arrange a
make-up final exam.
The grades are assigned according to the following formula:
20% 4 Assignments
35% Midterm Exam
45% Final Exam
Reading List
1. Data and Statistics (Chapter 1)
2. Descriptive Statistics (Chapters 2 and 3)
3. Introduction to Probability (Chapter 4)
4. Discrete Probability Distributions (Chapter 5)
5. Continuous Probability Distributions (Chapter 6)
6. Sampling and Sampling Distributions (Chapter 7)
7. Interval Estimation (Chapter 8)
8. Hypothesis Tests (Chapter 9)
9. Inference about Means and Proportions with Two Populations (Chapter 10)
Notes: (1) the coverage of problem sets and exams are estimated and subject to change; and (2) chapters 9 and
10 will be covered if time permits.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)

的關鍵性資訊。本課程主要的⽬的，在循序漸進地介紹與討論各類成本計算的⽅法與成本管理的理
論，引導學⽣瞭解處於動態環境下的組織，如何運⽤成本會計的技術進⾏規劃、控制及做決策。

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
歷史經濟學是介紹歷史問題的經濟理論，這⾨課比通⻑經濟史課成還注重理論與⽅法，適合想要進⼀
步從經濟學瞭解歷史或從歷史瞭解經濟發展的同學選修，也是對有志學習經濟史的同學極有⽤的基礎
課程。歡迎對經濟學與歷史皆有興趣的同學選修。在近幾⼗年間，⻄⽅的經濟史學界發⽣了⾰命性的
變化，這項新經濟史的發展致⼒於將經濟分析與計量資料⽤在經濟史的研究之上 , 其結果不僅帶給經濟
史許多課題新的瞭解 , 也開拓了經濟史新的研究⽅法。新經濟史發展⾄今⼜⾯臨許多新的反省，我們將
從新經濟史的興起討論經濟史的研究⽅法，特別是近年來發展蓬勃的新制度學派，課程後半部將結合
重要之經濟史課題的討論。

(Cambridge University Press, 1973)

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Econometrics (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：馮炳萱
上課時間  Time ： WnW5W6 上課教室  Room ：台積 103 ／ 94
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Economics 303300
Econometrics (I)
Fall 2023
Course Outline
(tentative, subject to change)
Course objectives:
The purpose of this course is to provide an introduction to the application of statistical methods to analyze
economic relations. It is part of a two-semester sequence. In the fall semester, we will focus on basic
econometric theories including a review of probability and statistics, linear regression with one regressor,
linear regressions with multiple regressors and non-linear regressions. In the course, students will learn to
develop skills for estimating relationships as a means to testing economic theories. Students will learn to
identify testable predictions drawing from economic theories, data requirements for testing these predictions,
and carry out empirical tests for such predictions.
Textbook:
Wooldridge, Jeffery. Introductory Econometrics: A Modern Approach. 7th Edition. Cengage Learning ( 華泰文
化代理 )
Evaluation:
The course grade is based on three elements: four assignments, a midterm exam, and a final exam. You have at
least seven days to work on each assignment. The assignments will include both problem solving and
empirical exercise. Solution keys will be posted on the course website soon after the submission, so late
submission is not accepted. Empirical exercises require the use of excel for regression analysis. The midterm
will be held in class during class hour. There will be no make-up exams for the midterm. If you miss the
midterm, you must give a valid reason and proof, and the weight will be assigned to the final. The final exam
is comprehensive. If you miss the final, you must give a valid reason and proof and contact me to arrange a
make-up final exam. The grades are assigned according to the following formula:
20% 4 Assignments
35% Midterm Exam
45% Final Exam
Reading List
I. Regression Analysis
1. The Simple Regression Model (chapter 2)
(Problem Set 1)
2. Multiple Regression Analysis: Estimation (chapter 3)
(Problem Set 2)
3. Multiple Regression Analysis: Inferences (chapter 4)
4. Multiple Regression Analysis: Asymptotics (chapter 5)
(Midterm)
5. Multiple Regression: Further Issues (chapter 6)
6. (Problem Set 3)
7. Multiple Regression Analysis with Qualitative Information (chapter 7)
8. Heteroskedasticity (chapter 8)
(Problem set 4)
9. More Specification and Data Issues (chapter 9)
(Final Exam)

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將介紹總體經濟學的基本觀念與架構，包括衡量總產量與價格⽔準等的重要總體經濟變數、廠
商的投資與勞動
需求理論、家計單位的消費與勞動供給理論、以及商品、勞動與資產市場的均衡分析。最後，本課程
將利⽤上述市場
均衡的架構，分析⻑期經濟成⻑的關鍵因素。
This course introduces the structure of macro economy and major concept of macroeconomics: including the
variables measuring aggregate output and general price level, theories on consumption, investment, labor
demand/supply, and asset allocation. The course also introduce the concept of goods market, labor market
and asset market equilibrium. Finally, the course introduces important theories on economic growth.

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Intermediate Accounting I
任課教師  Instructor ：李怡嫺

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
1.To introduce to the students the conceptual structure of accounting. This
course is designed to develop an in-depth understanding of the concepts,
principles, and practices of financial accounting under IFRS.
The emphasis is on understanding and applying basic accounting principles
and other concepts that guide the reporting of the effect of transactions
and other economic events on the financial condition and operating results
of a business.
2.To provide an opportunity to apply theoretical solutions to practical
problems.
Since this course is offered to students with non-accounting major and that
the number of participants is expected to be manageable, the detailed
contents of the course may be adjusted and tailored, during the semester, to
the needs of the class and in accordance with the different backgrounds of
the participants.
With over 15-year experience in the accounting profession, the instructor is
also prepared and keen to share, whenever appropriate, her experiences as a
accounting manager with certificate of CPA(Certified Public Accountant)in
USA and SAP Finance consultant ; particularly, the accounting's application
in the Accounting policies and procedures and accounting system .

Intermeditate Accounting, IFRS Edition
By Donald E.Kieso/Jerry J. Weygandt/Terry D. Warfield

All students with a passion for contributing to the growth of humanity, a vision
to become a great leader for servicing people in any field, and a strong drive
to learn and to challenge themselves intellectually are highly encouraged to
participate in this course.
Through dynamic brain-power training, knowledge and intelligence building, case
study and international simulations, we will activate the creative genes in each
one of our students.
We will build their creative thinking, analytical reasoning, and problem solving
abilities. In the spirit of inspirational leadership, this course is carefully
designed to develop your creative marketing, managerial and organizational
skills in the process of entrepreneurial case study and simulations. Students
will be able to draw upon their cross-cultural understanding and practice how to
apply what you have learnt in your respective fields. The main topics to be
covered include cross-cultural business etiquettes, creative designing,
innovative marketing, cross-cultural communication, analytical planning, cross-
cultural negotiation, risk-taking, leadership, and entrepreneurship. We will
also be flexible to add different new topics of students’ interests in class
discussions and simulations.

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 202001學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 100
中文名稱  Course Title ：偏微分⽅程與複變函數
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Partial Differential Equations and Complex Variables
任課教師  Instructor ：呂忠津  Lu Chung-Chin
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R5R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This is a basic course on Fourier analysis, partial differential equations, and
complex variables and analysis. The aim of this course is for students to fully
understand the theory of Fourier analysis, to learn various approaches and
techniques, from basic to advanced, to solve partial differential equations, and
to discover the beauty of the theory of functions in one complex variable and the
power of applying this beautiful theory to solve various problems in mathematics,
science, and engineering. This course requires knowledge in multiple variables
calculus and ordinary differential equations such as MATH1020 and EE2010 or their
equivalents. It is required for students to read Chapter 6: Laplace Transforms
and Sections 13.1-13.2: Complex Numbers of the textbook by E. Kreyszig before
class begins. Quiz #1 on Laplace transforms and complex numbers will be held
during the 1st recitation class in 19:00-21:00 on Monday September 11th, 2023 in
Delta 216. This course adopts a 16-week semester so that it is an intense course.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Textbook)
1. E. Kreyszig, Advanced Engineering Mathematics, 10th edn. John Wiley and Sons,
Inc., 2011.
2. Instructor’s Lecturenotes.
三、參考書籍  (References)
References will be mentioned in the lectures when cited.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
1. This is an English–teaching course. In class, you are welcome to raise your
questions in any language. If you speak a language other than English, Taiwanese
or Mandarin, please have someone to translate it to any of the above three
languages.
2. We will basically follow the contents of the textbook from Fourier analysis in
Chapter 11, partial differential equations in Chapter 12 to complex analysis in
Chapters 13-17. Additional materials, including supplemental lemmas and theorems,
will be provided to facilitate and/or enrich the development of the theory.
3. Doing exercise problems is an essential part of learning any mathematical
subject, including this course. Recommended exercises will be assigned every week
for you to practice the basic concepts and results learned in the classroom and
to prepare the quiz which will be held during the recitation class every Monday
19:00 – 21:00 in Delta 216, except holidays and the week right after a midterm.
The 1st set of recommended exercises will be announced on NTHU eeclass course
website on September 6th, 2023. Students do not need to turn in any solutions of
the recommended exercises.
4. There will be a total of 15 quizzes. Only the 10 highest scored quizzes will
be counted to calculate the semester quiz average. You may be absent from at most
5 quizzes so that there will be no make-up quizzes. The 1st quiz will be held
during the 1st recitation class in 19:00-21:00 on Monday September 11th, 2023 in
Delta 216. The coverage of the 1st quiz is Chapter 6 on Laplace transforms and
Sections 13.1-13.2 on complex numbers of the textbook, which is required for you
to review and study before class begins.
5. It is essential that students attend lecture class each day and if you have to
miss a class, you should make every attempt to make up the work by watching the
recording uploaded to "CCLu Online Learning" on Youtube.
6. All exams (quizzes, midterms, and the final) are closed book exams. You are
allowed to bring in one A4 sheet of paper for each midterm exam and two A4 sheets
of papers for the final exam, filled with hand-written or typed notes. You may
write whatever you wish on both sides of the paper.
7. The final exam is cumulative and will cover everything taught in the whole
semester.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. The first half of the semester will cover Fourier analysis and partial
differential equations (PDEs), including Fourier series and periodic functions,
Sturm-Liouville problems and generalized Fourier series, Fourier integral and
Fourier transform, Fourier cosine and sine transforms, separating variables for
PDEs, wave equation, heat equation, Laplace’s equation in rectangular, polar,
cylindrical, and spherical coordinates..
2. The second half of the semester will cover complex variables and analysis,
including complex differentiation and analytic functions, complex integration,
power and Laurent series, residue integration, and conformal mapping.
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
There are weekly quizzes (30%), first midterm (20%), second midterm (20%) and one
final (30%). Alphabetical grade will be given as your final grade. The time
schedule is as follows:
(1) Recommended exercises will be announced on NTHU eeclass course website, which
are for students to prepare the quizzes to be held during the recitation class
every Monday 19:00 – 21:00 in Delta 216, except. The 1st set of recommended
exercises will be announced on September 6th, 2023 before class begins. Students
do not need to turn in any solutions of the recommended exercises. Quiz problems
will be based on the recommended exercises. There will be 15 quizzes and only
the
highest-scored 10 quizzes will be counted into the final score. No makeup quiz
can be requested.
(2) Midterm I – 12:40 pm – 3:10 pm, October 19, 2023, Thursday.
Coverage: Sections 11.1 – 12.4 of the textbook.
(3) Midterm II –12:40 pm – 3:10 pm, November 23, 2023, Thursday.
Coverage: Sections 12.5 – 14.4 of the textbook.
(4) Final –12:40 pm – 3:10 pm, December 28, 2023, Thursday.
Coverage: Chapters 11-17 of the textbook.
七、使⽤⽣成式 AI 之倫理聲明 (Ethics Statement on Generative Artificial Intelligence)
After careful consideration, the instructor of this course deems it inappropriate
to use generative artificial intelligence in this class. This is because the
content within generative AI contains numerous errors and may adversely affect
students' understanding of foundational knowledge. In accordance with the
published Guidelines for Collaboration, Co-learning, and Cultivation of
Artificial Intelligence Competencies in University Education, this course adopts
the following policy : Prohibited use
Students enrolled in this course should be aware that they may not submit
assignments, reports, or personal reflections generated using artificial
intelligence. If such usage is discovered, instructors, the institution, or
relevant units have the right to reevaluate the assignment or report or withhold
scores. Students enrolled in this course agree to the above ethics statement if
registering for the class.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is intended for EE students at the junior level who have already
taken the courses in basic circuit theory and micrelectronics. Students will
get hands-on experiences through experiments to complement the learning of
microelectronics and circuit theories. Op-amps, passive elements (e.g. R, L,
and C), and transistors will be used extensively to implement various circuits.

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 225500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 80
中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronics
任課教師  Instructor ：徐碩鴻  Hsu Shuo Hung
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is an introductory course of microelectronics. We will focus
on the fundamental knowledge of microelectronic circuits and emphasize the
design-oriented approach. This course introduces the most important concepts
for design of analog circuits such as characteristics of semiconductors,
operating principles of diodes and transistors, and various amplifier
configurations for both BJTs and MOSFETS. The frequency response,
differential
pairs, multi-stage amplifiers are also included. By developing solid
understanding of basic knowledge, learning microelectronics could be
enjoyable.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Behzad Razavi, “Fundamentals of Microelectronics,” 2nd edition, Wiley, 2013
三、參考書籍 (References)
A. Sedra and K. Smith, "Microelectronic circuits," 6th edition, Oxford
university press, 2011
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Power point handouts are used in this class together with a tablet computer
for equation derivation and additional materials. The course materials are
also recorded by the software "powercam" and uploaded in the iLMS system for
easy access and review. The iLMS system also provides an effective platform
for the interaction among the teacher, TAs, and students. A quiz is held on
a
bi-weekly basis to help the students following the course schedule. The
homework is also assigned bi-weekly to let the students practice for
comprehensive understanding. The students also have the opportunity to use
the
CAD tool (SPICE) for circuit
simulation and design to verify the materials learned in the class.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to microelectronics (ch. 1)
- Examples of electronic systems
- Basic circuit theorems
2. Basic physics of semiconductors and diodes (ch. 2 and ch. 3)
- Semiconductor material properties
- PN junction and diodes
- Diode circuits and applications
3. Basic physics of transistors and their equivalent circuit models
(ch. 4 and ch. 6)
- Basic structures and characteristics of MOSFETs and BJTs
- Equivalent circuit model of MOSFETs and BJTs
- Large-signal and small-signal operation
4. Single-stage (multi-stage) amplifiers and frequency response
(ch. 5, ch. 7, ch. 9, and ch. 11)
- Operating point analysis and design
- MOSFET and BJT amplifier topologies (CS, CG, CD, and cascode)
- Transfer function and Bode's plot
- Frequency response of different amplifiers
5. Differential amplifiers (ch. 9 and ch. 10)
- Basic MOS and BJT differential pairs
- Large-signal and small-signal analysis
- Current mirror and active load
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework: 25%
Quiz: 25%
Midterm: 25%
Final: 25%
七、可連結之網⾴位址
https://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw/
科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 231002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：計算機程式設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Programming
任課教師  Instructor ：張彌彰  CHANG MI CHANG
上課時間  Time ： M1M2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：資電  206 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The main objective of this introductory course is to help students develop
programming skills to solve problems. As computers are becoming more powerful
and ubiquitous, proper use of computers can increase productivity significantly.
Thus, the ability to write efficient programs to solve problems improves one’s
core competence and can be an important differentiator for one’s career. Among
today’s popular programming languages, C is found to have the biggest impacts.
Many modern computer languages borrowed heavily from C. Thus, proficiency in C
language would pave ways to good programming in other languages. In this course,
we will devote most of the time in C programming. object-oriented programming
and classes, however, will also be briefly introduced.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
C Programming: A Modern Approach, 2nd Edition by K. N. King
三、參考書籍 (References)
The C Programming Language, 2nd edition, by B.W. Kernighan and D.M. Ritchie
The C++ Programming Language: Special Edition by Bjarne Stroustrup
Starting Out with C++ Early objects, 6th Edition, by Tony Gaddis, Judy
Walters, Godfrey Muganda, Addison Wesley.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and in-class practice
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction
Input/output
Variables and data types
expressions and operators
Conditional statements
Iteration statements
Functions
Arrays and pointers
Standard libraries
Classes and object-oriented programming

Final exam: 20%

● 課程說明 (Course Description)/● 教學進度 (Syllabus):
1. Introduction: a short history of optics
2. Waves: the wave equation and phase velocity
3. Maxwell’s equations, the wave equation, and plane waves
4. Blackbody radiation
5. The electromagnetic spectrum
6. Lasers
7. Absorption and the refractive index: theory
8. Absorption consequences
9. Refractive index consequences
10. Superposition: standing waves, beats, and group velocity
11. Fresnel’s equations of reflection and refraction
12. Polarization I: polarized light; birefringence; polarizers
13. Polarization II: wave plates and unpolarized light
14. Optical activity and Jones vectors and matrices
15. Geometrical optics I: ray matrices and ray tracing
16. Geometrical optics II: applications and aberrations
17. Fourier series and the Fourier transform
18. Fourier transform examples, theorems, concepts
19. Convolution and correlation
20. Small beams and short pulses
21. Interferometers
22. Interference and coherence
23. Light scattering; reflection; refraction; coherence; light bulbs
24. Diffraction and the Fourier transform
25. Diffraction gratings; lenses as Fourier transformers
Other topics (if we have time):
26. Nonlinear optics and holography
27. Ultrafast optics
28. Ultrafast Optics Research Lab tour

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 323002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 50
中文名稱  Course Title ：積體電路設計導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Integrated Circuit Design
任課教師  Instructor ：黃敬源
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 215 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
The course is designed to provide the fundamental theories & techniques of digital
VLSI design in CMOS technology and carry out a digital VLSI deign. In this course,
we will study the fundamental knowledge of designing digital VLSI systems include
the operating mode of a MOSFET transistor and basics of MOSFET modeling, the
description of CMOS fabrication and design rules, the analysis of static and
dynamic behaviors of CMOS logic gates, the design of combinational logic and the
system-level circuits, the optimization concepts of circuit and layout designs.
Laboratory and project works will be utilized on industrial standard tools.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
CMOS VLSI Design, a circuits and system perspective, Heil Weste and David Harris,
published by Pearson, 4th edition, March 2010.
● 參考書籍 (References)
後補
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures offered in English
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction
2. MOS Transistor Theory
3. CMOS Fabrication, Layout and Modelling
4. CMOS Inverter
5. Delay and Transient Response
6. Power and Interconnect
7. Design Margin and Reliability
8. Combinational Circuit Design
9. Sequential Circuit Design
10. Datapath Subsystems
Lab:
1. Cadence Setup and Schematic Entry
2. Schematic Entry and Circuit Simulation
3. Hierarchical Schematic Design

6. Post-Layout Simulation
Final Project: Logic circuit design (Simulation and optimization)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is a fundamental course for analysis and design analog integrated
circuits.
It covers quantitative analyses, design considerations and system
applications
from circuit and physical viewpoints. Most material is for CMOS technology.
BJT
may be introduced briefly if needed.
Topics for this course includes
- Modern VLSI technologies, device operations and models.
- Elementary gain stages.
- Current sources.
- Frequency responses.
- Feedback, stability and compensation.
- Operational amplifiers.
- Bandgap references. (optional)
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Behzad Razavi, Fundamental of Microelectronics, John Wiley & Sons Inc.,
2009.
Behzad Razavi, Design of Analog CMOS Integrated Circuits, McGraw-Hill, 2016.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Paul R. Gray, Paul J. Hurst, Stephen H. Lewis, and Robert G. Meyer,
Analysis and Design of Analog Integrated Circuits,
5th Edition, John Wiley & Sons Inc., 2009.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture : 3 hours
Outside Reading : 3 hours
7 homework
1 term project
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
-Basic physics of MOS transistors and their equivalent circuit models (ch.
6)
-Elementary gain stages (ch. 7, ch. 9, and ch. 10)
-Frequency responses (ch. 11)
-Operational amplifier basics (ch. 8)
-Feedback, stability and compensation (ch. 12)
-Operational amplifiers (ch.9, Design of analog CMOS ICs)
-Bandgap references (ch.12, Design of analog CMOS ICs)
-Noise (ch.7, Design of analog CMOS ICs) (if time permits)

中文名稱  Course Title ：計算機結構
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computer Architecture
任課教師  Instructor ：呂仁碩

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will discuss the basic architecture, organization, and design of a
modern computer system. The
contents cover instruction sets, computer arithmetic, processor core and
pipelining, caches, virtual
memories, and parallel processors. Students are assumed to have taken courses on
logic design and
programming in C/C++.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
David A. Patterson & John. L. Hennessy, Computer Organization and Design RISC-V
Edition -- The
Hardware/Software Interface", 1st Ed., 2017, Morgan Kaufmann Publishers.
三、參考書籍 (References)
William Stallings, "Computer Organization and architecture -- Designing for
performance", 9th Ed., 2013, Pearson
Behrooz Parhami, "Computer Architecture", 2005, Oxford University Press
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
3-hour lecture per week.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
The lectures will be offered by two professors:
Part I: The Core Concepts on Computer Abstractions and Technology
(a)Basic introduction
(b)Instructions: Language of the Machine
(c)Arithmetic for Computers
Part II: Computer organization and design
(a)Basic processor design: Datapath and Control
(b)Enhancing Performance with Pipelining
(c)Large and Fast: Exploiting Memory Hierarchy
(d)Multi-cores and Multiprocessors*

由於此實驗課由數位老師及各⾃的助教帶領⼤家作實驗，以下為課程進⾏⽅式與要求：
A. 對老師與助教的要求
* 上課前⼀週透過 EECLASS 發佈講義與建議預習資料。
* Lecture (1 hr/week, approximately) 以介紹⼯具與經驗分享 (e.g., 可能遭遇的困難 )
* 每次實驗前準備好  check list ，供考核學⽣ demo 使⽤。
B. 學⽣的義務與權利：
* ⼀⼈⼀組，每次每個⼈需 demo 才可離開。
* 若下課或甚⾄當天晚上 (19:00 以前）仍無法順利  demo ，則建議帶回家做，⾄遲下⼀週下課
(18:30)前補  demo ；請注意這是  hard deadline.
* 實驗結報每個⼈都要交， deadline: 隔週週⼀早上 8am 。
* 期末專題可依題⽬喜好分組。
C. 成績考核：
* Unit 1, 2, 3 各 25% ，期末專題  25%.
* 各單元內部， demo 通過後，以報告成績計算；若 demo 未通過，以零分計算

⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明  「有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出」
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據
本校公布之「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，以下說明
如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出
學⽣須於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議
題發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或
相
關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electric Machinery
任課教師  Instructor ：張淵智

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：

三、教學進度  (Syllabus) ：
1. 機電能量轉換及機電整合簡介  (Introduction to electro-mechanical energy conversion
principle and mechatronics) 。 (5%)
2. 電⼒系統概要：發電、輸配電、電⼒系統暫態、⽤電安全、備⽤電源、特殊設備電源系統、電⼒品
質等  (Introductory power system: generation, transmission and distribution,
electric transients, electric safety, power quality, standby power and some
special electric power systems) 。 (5%)
3. 電⼒電⼦概要：功率半導體概要、電源供應器概要、⾺達驅動器概要等 (Introductory power
electronics: power semiconductor devices, switching power supplies, motor
drives)。 (5%)
4. 電動機械  (Electric machinery) (85%) ：
(1) 磁路分析、永久磁鐵磁路分析  (Magnetic circuit analysis, permanent-magnet
magnetic circuit analysis) 。
(2) 變壓器  (Transformers) 。
(3) 步進⾺達之結構、驅動及應⽤  (Stepping motors: Structures, driving control
and applications) 。
(4) 直流⾺達及發電機  (DC motors and generators) 。
(5) 同步⾺達及發電機  (Synchronous motors and generators) 。
(6) 感應⾺達及發電機  (Induction motors and generators) 。
(7) 直流無刷⾺達及其於週邊設備之應⽤  (Brushless DC motors and their
applications) 。
(8) 開關磁阻式⾺達及其他特殊⾺達  (Switched-reluctance machines and other
special machines) 。
(9) ⾺達之 SoC 固態速度控制實作實驗  ( 步進⾺達及直流⾺達 ) (Solid-state stepping
motor driving control experiment, solid-state DC motor speed control
experiment (optional)) 。

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 410000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 22
中文名稱  Course Title ：量⼦資訊導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Quantum Information
任課教師  Instructor ：呂忠津  Lu Chung-Chin
上課時間  Time ： T7T8R7 上課教室  Room ：台達 212 ／ 22
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is an introductory course to quantum information. With a highly
interdisciplinary nature of this course, background materials in quantum
mechanics, mathematical tools, computer science, and electrical engineering will
be introduced. Topics include quantum entanglement, quantum computation, and
quantum communications. The most important requirement for students taking this
course is a certain level of mathematical maturity and the curiosity to learn
about quantum information.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecturenotes and reading assignment.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. D.A.B. Miller, Quantum Mechanics for Scientists and Engineers. New York:
Cambridge University Press, 2008.
2. J.S. Townsend, A Modern Approach tp Quantum Mechanics, 2nd edn. Mill
Valley, CA: University Science Books, 2012.
3. R. Shankar, Principles of Quantum Mechanics, 2nd edn. New York: Plenum
Press, 1994.
4. W. Rudin, Real and Complex Analysis, 3rd edn. Boston, MA: McGraw-Hill,
1986.
5. W. Rudin, Functional Analysis, 2nd edn. Boston, MA: McGraw-Hill, 1991.
6. M.A. Nielsen and I.L. Chuang, Quantum Computation and Quantum
Information. New York: Cambridge University Press, 2000.
7. M.M. Wilde, Quantum Information Theory. New York: Cambridge University
Press, 2013.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
A brief of mathematical materials needed to describe the basic principles of
quantum mechanics and the related concepts in quantum information will be given
first. After presenting the postulates of quantum mechanics, several examples of
quantum systems will be illustrated. Quantum entanglement will then be
discussed, which has been highly exploited in quantum information processing,
including quantum computation and quantum communications. We will introduce how
to build quantum circuits and by which how to run quantum algorithms with
killing applications. In quantum communications, we will focus on quantum
cryptography.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Mathematical preliminaries
2. Postulates of quantum mechanics
3. Examples of quantum systems
4. Quantum entanglement
5. Quantum computation
6. Quantum communications
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
There are homework assignments (40%), a midterm exam (30%), and a final exam or
project (30%).
七、使⽤⽣成式 AI 之倫理聲明 (Ethics Statement on Generative Artificial Intelligence)
After careful consideration, the instructor of this course deems it
inappropriate to use generative artificial intelligence in this class. This is
because the content within generative AI contains numerous errors and may
adversely affect students' understanding of foundational knowledge. In
accordance with the published Guidelines for Collaboration, Co-learning, and
Cultivation of Artificial Intelligence Competencies in University Education,
this course adopts the following policy : Prohibited use
Students enrolled in this course should be aware that they may not submit
assignments, reports, or personal reflections generated using artificial
intelligence. If such usage is discovered, instructors, the institution, or
relevant units have the right to reevaluate the assignment or report or withhold
scores. Students enrolled in this course agree to the above ethics statement if
registering for the class.

Course objectives:
學習如何將頭腦裡的想法與紙上的演算法，實際以數位電路設計的⽅式實現於晶片上。

四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程依數位電路設計的 cell-based design flow 分為三單元： Verilog 硬體描述語⾔、邏輯
合成、⾃動佈局繞線。除了講堂上的授課以外，每週皆有上機實驗課程，另有五次數位電路設計作
業(例如先前有 RSA 加解碼器、 QR code 編解碼器、 ResNet 卷積網路等 ) 與期末專題。本課程強調紮實
的Verilog 語⾔撰寫以及 CAD ⼯具的操作，以實際體驗與了解數位電路設計的趣味與精髓。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Part I – Verilog HDL: 四週
Part II – Logic synthesis: 四週
Part III – Placement & Routing: 三週
Final Project: 六週

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 432001學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：固態電⼦實驗 -- 半導體製程與實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Solid-State Electronics Laboratory-Semiconductor Processing
任課教師  Instructor ：邱博文
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The silicon integrated circuit is surely one of the wonders of our age. The
ability to fabricate tens of millions of individual components on a chip with an
area of a few centimeter square has enabled the information age. This course
attempts to describe not only the manufacturing practice associated with the
technologies used in silicon chip fabrication, but also the underlying scientific
basis for those technologies. This course will show the students how silicon
field-effect transistors are made using the knowledge learned in the ULSI
technologies.
However, due to the limited implementation hours, students can only fabricate
p-type or n-type MOSFET with characteristics measured and simulated.
⼆、參考書籍 (References)
1. J. D. Plummer, M. M. Deal, and P. B. Griffin, Silicon VLSI Technology,
Prentice
Hall, 2000.
2. Michael Quirk and Julian Serda, Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology,
Prentice
Hall, 2001.
3. Robert Doering and Yoshio Nishi, Handbook of Semiconductor Manufacturing
Technology,
CRC Press 2008.
三、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. In Chinese
2. The TA will give the students a mini instruction of the fabrication process
and principles.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. MOS structure and MOS process flow
2. RCA clean and Wet oxidation for MOS
3. Optical lithography-1 + Wet etching for MOS
4. TCAD simulation Ⅰ (Process)
5. TCAD simulation Ⅱ (Device)
6. Exam of TCAD simulation
7. RTA for MOS
8. Wet etching
9. Optical lithography-2 + Wet etching for MOS
10. metallization for MOS via E-gun
11. Optical lithography-3 + Wet etching for MOS
12. Backside metallization
13. Measurement of MOS
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. Pre-assessment: those who cannot pass the assessment will fail in the final
score.
2. Simulation test (40%)
3. Measurement report (60%)
科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 464000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：通訊系統⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Communication Systems (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：吳仁銘  Wu Jen-Ming
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：台達 208 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is a core course for students who would like to understand or enter the
field of digital communications engineering. As analog communication has been covered in the course
"Communication System I", "Communication System II" introduces Digital Communication. This course
covers Digital Transmissions,
Spread-Spectrum Modulation, Multiuser Communications and Information Theory.
This course is designed in parallel with "Communication System I". For
students taking this course, the background of "Communication System I" is
preferred.
For the practicing engineer in the communications industry and those who
(such as the senior/beginning graduate student) plan to have communications
as major area,this course is necessary to build solid background on digital
communications. For those who are to engage in signal processing and IC design
for communications, this is also a course worth taking.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
(Please not for the new text book.)
1. Simon Haykin, Digital Communication Systems: A Modern Introduction, 1st Edition, Wiley & Sons, 2014.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Simon Haykin, Communications Systems, 4th Ed. J. Wiley, 2001
2. Rodger E. Ziemer and Roger L. Peterson, Introduction to Digital
Communication, 5nd Edition, Prentice-Hall, 2001.
3. John B. Anderson, Digital Transmission Engineering, Prentice Hall, 1999.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Fourier analysis of Signals and Systems (Chap 2)
2. Probability Theory and Stochastic Process (Chap 3 & 4)
3. Signaling over AWGN Channels (Chap 7)
- Signal-Space Analysis (Chap 7.1 - 7.3)
- Coherent Digital Modulation and Optimal Detection(Chap 7.4-7.9)
- Non-coherent Digital Modulation and Optimal Detection(Chap 7.10-7.14)
4. Information Theory (Chap 5)
5. Signaling Over Band-limited Channels (Chap 8)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework: 20%,
Midterm 1: 25%,
Midterm 2: 25%
Final : 30%.

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 465000學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 15
中文名稱  Course Title ：通訊系統實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Communications System Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：劉光浩
上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：台達 202 ／ 32
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程著重於通訊系統的實作能⼒，將複雜的通訊系統模組化，透過撰寫程式實現個別模組的功能，
最終完成通訊系統雛形，並實際收發訊號以驗證各模組的正確性。每周課程時間包括原理與實作講
解，並搭配動⼿實作，實作採⽤軟體定義無線電硬體設備搭配圖像化程式語⾔ Labview ，硬體與軟體
操作⽅式會在前兩堂課⽰範說明，每堂課也會給予實作指引，學期末則有專題訓練，將各實作單元串
接成的通訊系統，並以此為基礎嘗試更具挑戰的通訊演算法。本課程建議兩⼈⼀組使⽤⼀套設備，開
學第⼀堂課簡介後，教學團隊會協助進⾏分組，同學也可事先找好實驗夥伴。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Handouts and Notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
Handouts and Notes
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
One hour of weekly lecture plus 2~3 hours of weekly experiment
Lecture Session: W7 15:30 PM – 16:20 PM,
Lab Session: W8W9 16:30 PM – 18:20 PM,
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Lab0: 課程內容與軟體無線電平台介紹
Lab1: 無線通訊實驗入⾨與弦波傳輸與 RF 訊號接收
Lab2: 數位調變與解調
Lab3: 數位濾波器
Lab4: 取樣時間同步與封包偵測
Lab5: 通道估計與補償
Lab6: 頻率偏移偵測與補償
Lab7: 正交分頻多⼯調變與解調
Lab8: 無線遙控器實作
Lab9: 期末專題訓練
One Final Term Project
