科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 521600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 135
中文名稱  Course Title ：時序電路設計及應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Timing Circuit Designs and Their Applications
任課教師  Instructor ：黃錫瑜
上課時間  Time ： T1T2R2 上課教室  Room ：台達 215 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
* 課程說明  (General Description)
晶片內部的執⾏有⼀定的時序，就像⼈的脈搏⼀樣。因此，每⼀個晶片內部都常有時序相關的
控制電路，譬如鎖向迴路  (Phase-Locked Loop) 、鎖延遲迴路  (Delay-Locked Loop) 、
時間量化器  (Time-to-Digital Converter) 、數位轉時間之轉換器  (Digital-to-Time
Converter) 等，這些電路在晶片設計、設計⾃動化與測試等領域都有廣泛的應⽤
(如全晶片⾼速時脈之產⽣與控制，異質整合晶片時脈訊號同步、
電路速度測試與分級、連接線速度量測與監控、晶片線上健康狀況監控等 ) 。
過去⼗幾年，有許多全數位化的時序相關電路之設計理念的發展，因此希望透過此⾨課程，提供有志
於
電路設計領域發展的同學相關的紮實的訓練並建立相關的研發能⼒。
* 先修課程  (Prerequisites)
- 邏輯設計 (Verilog 硬體描述語⾔ ), 積體電路設計導論。
另外，作業及期末計畫需要跑電路模擬、合成、與⾃動產⽣佈局圖的軟體，
並進⾏電路特性與效能之歸納和比較。
* 主要參考書  (Textbook): 無，以論文研討為主。
* 教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
- 以使⽤  PowerPoint 投影片為主的課堂討論
(Lecturing using PowerPoint Slides) 。
* 教學進度 (Syllabus)
(Part I: Fundamentals)
1. Introduction
2. Review of Cell-based Design Flow
3. Delay-Locked Loop (including Ping-Pong DLL?)
4. Phase-Locked Loop
5. Time-to-Digital Converter
6. Digital-to-Time Converter
(Part II: Applications)
7. Performance Monitoring for DLL and PLL
8. Duty-Cycle Monitoring and Correction (DCC)
9. Fault Tolerant Delay-Locked Loop
10. Built-In Speed Grading
11. Delay Testing of Die-to-Die Interconnects in 3D ICs
12. Built-In Self-Repair for Interconnects in 3D ICs
13. Delay Monitoring of Die-to-Die Interconnects in 3D ICs
* 成績考核 (Evaluation)
- 臨時課程⼩考  5% ，實作型作業  30% ，期中考 30% ，期末考 35% 。
* AI原則 : 若作業或期末計畫使⽤到⽣成式 AI 的輔助，請於報告中註明⽣成式 AI 的使⽤⽅式。
科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 522000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：內嵌式記憶體電路設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Embedded Memory Circuit Design
任課教師  Instructor ：張孟凡
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：台達 211 ／ 51
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 (Course Description)：
This course introduces general knowledge of various on-chip memories to
students who are interesting in circuit design, system-level designs, design for
manufacturing (DFM) or process integrations.
Current embedded memories (ROM, SRAM, CAM, ROM, OTP/MTP, and FLASH) and
next-generation memories will be introduced. This course will study the devices
and circuit of memory bitcell, memory structures, sense amplifiers, high-voltage
circuits, and other digital and analog peripheral circuits. This course also will
cover the basic concept of computing-in-memory for AI chips. The system-level
applications, techniques of low-power and low-voltage designs, and design-for-
manufacturing (DFM) issues for embedded memories are also included.
Students who are interesting in transistor-level circuit designs, SoC designs,
semiconductor devices, or process integrations are welcome to take this course.
課程內容：
1. Overview of embedded memories
2. SRAM (SP, DP, RF, CAM)
3. Advanced SRAM
4. DRAM
5. ROM, OTP and MTP
6. FLASH (NOR & NAND)
7. Emerging memories (MRAM, PCM, ReRAM ..)
8. Design for manufacturing/yield of memory
9. Low-power and low-voltage memories
10. Computing-in-memory for AI
指定⽤書 (Text Books): TBD
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method):
1. Lectures
2. Labs. (in-class)
成績考核 (Evaluation):
1. Exam.
2. Multiple Homework
3. Term-Project
先修科⽬ ( 必備知識 )
1. VLSI
2. Electronics
3. Logic Designs
4. Familiar with HSPICE simulation
5. Familiar with IC schematic and Layout tools (very important)
科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 523000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 100
中文名稱  Course Title ：類比電路設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Analog Circuit Design
任課教師  Instructor ：黃柏鈞  Po-Chiun Huang
上課時間  Time ： M5M6R7 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This is an extended course for analysis and design analog integrated
circuits. It covers quantitative analyses, design considerations
and system applications from circuit and physical viewpoints. All material
is for CMOS technology.
Topics for this course includes
- Modern VLSI technologies, device operations and models.
- Elementary gain stages.
- Current sources.
- Frequency responses.
- Feedback, stability and compensation.
- Differential CMOS Operational amplifiers.
Remarks: 在您修課前 , 請先評估
1. 本課程會保留較多時間 , ⽤於後段較困難的 amp 設計及模擬討論 .
2. 本系⼤學部 EE3235 類比電路分析與設計⼀為基礎課程 , 建議無基礎同學 , 優先考慮⼤學部課程 .
3. 本課程將⼤量使⽤ HSPICE 為作業模擬之⽤ , 課堂上將無額外時間進⾏軟體教學 .
4. 各類需求 , 包含博⼠班資格考 , 及各類學程必修等 , 將不被接受成為調分的理由 .

2nd edition, McGraw-Hill, 2017.
Paul R. Gray, Paul J. Hurst, Stephen H. Lewis, and Robert G. Meyer,
Analysis and Design of Analog Integrated Circuits,
5th Edition, John Wiley & Sons Inc., 2009.
三、參考書籍  (References)
Behzad Razavi, Microelectronics, 2nd edition, John Wiley & Sons
Inc., 2014.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
- CMOS device operations and models.
- Elementary gain stages.
- Current sources.
- Frequency responses.
- Operational amplifier basic.
- Feedback, stability and compensation.
- Common mode feedback.
- Differential op-amp designs.

中文名稱  Course Title ：超⼤型積體電路設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： VLSI Design
任課教師  Instructor ：謝志成
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course
Description)
This course provides the
fundamental knowledge of
designing Very Large-Scale
Integrated circuits (VLSI). It
begins with a review of the IC
fabrication
process and the CMOS transistor
theory. Then, the layout rules
and design
techniques for a variety of CMOS
logic circuits such as inverters,
logic
gates, flip-flops, and arithmetic
circuits using different design
styles (e.g.,
static logic, steering logic, and
dynamic logic) are discussed. For
system-level
design, low-power techniques,
semiconductor memories, and IO
plan will be
discussed in detail.

Neil H. E. Weste and David
Harris, CMOS VLSI Design: A
Circuits and Systems
Perspective, 4th Ed., Addison
Wesley, 2010.

1. Jan M. Rabaey, Digital
Integrated Circuits, 2nd Ed.,
Prentice Hall, 2003
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture by LCD Porjection

Week 1-2 : Introduction
Week 3 : CMOS
Processing Technology
Week 4 : MOS
Transistor Theory
Week 5-7 : Circuit
Characterization and Performance
Estimation
Week 8-9 : Combinational
Circuit Design
Week 10-11 : Sequential
Circuit Design
Week 12-13 : Design
Methodology and Tools
Week 14-15 : Datapath
Subsystem
Week 16 : Array
Subsystem
Week 17 : Special-
Purpose Subsystem

The course contains
.
Lectures on Design
1. Introduction to HLS and tools
2. VLSI Circuit Basics
3. Logic Design
4. Structure Design with HLS and Verilog
5. HLS pipeline, dataflow, datatype
6. Verification
7. Introduction to FPGA and its architecture
8. SOC module level specification & Design

Design Flow
1. Tools – Tcl, Perl, Makefile
2. Simulator - Verilog, Coverage, assertion
3. Synthesis
4. Timing analysis
5. Verification Methodology
Laboratories
1. Vitis/Vivado Tool Installation
2. Lab#1 - FIR Filter (AXI master, AXI Stream)
3. Caravel SOC Simulation Environment
4. HLS - Design Analysis & Optimization
5. HLS/Verilog Lab
6. Caravel SOC FPGA Implementation
7. User IP Integration with Caravel SOC
8. Final Project
Upon completion of the course, students will be able
1. Learn Verilog and HLS Design Implementation on FPGA and ASIC
2. Implement an IP and Integrate it into a SOC design
3. Realize the SOC design and emulate it in FPGA
4. Labs based on CaravelFPGA

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 571000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 50

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
1. Power System Development & Application, and Basic Principles

3. Power System Network Representation – Loads and Transformers (Single-Phase &

5. Power System Network Representation – Shunt Capacitance of Transmission
Lines

Stabilizer, Speed-Governor-Turbine System)

10. Power System improvement for Steady-State Operation, Steady-State Stability
& Transient Stability

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 581000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 50
中文名稱  Course Title ：固態電機控制
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Solid-State Electric Machine Control
任課教師  Instructor ：廖聰明
上課時間  Time ： M5T5T6 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
固態電機控制  (Solid-State Electric Machine Control)
A. 課程概述與⽬標：
This course introduces the theories and operation affairs of static and dynamic
characteristics of various electric machines. In addition, some power converters
are also introduced. The theoretic backgrounds established from this course will
be helpful for performing the research in the fields of motor drive, power
electronics and control engineering.
B. 先修科⽬或先備能⼒：學⽣須具備  “ 電動機械 ” 課程之基本能⼒
C. 教科書
1. R. Krishnan, Electric Motor Drives Modeling, Analysis and Control, Prentice
Hall, New Jersey, 2001.
2. Handouts.
D. 課程綱要  (Course contents)
1. Introduction to electric machine control and mechatronics: (1) Electric
machines; (2) Mechanical system; (3) Power electronics; (4) Control system; (5)
Applied electronics.
2. Overview of sensors and transducers: (1) Specifications; (2) Some commonly
used sensors in motor drives; (3) Commonly used signal conditioning circuits.
3. Overview of magnetic circuits and electromechanical energy conversion: (1)
Magnetic equivalent circuits; (2) Energy conversion process; (3) Mechanical
force and torque in the electromagnetic system.
4. Structures, operation principles, comparative characteristics of commonly
used electric machines: (1) Machine structures. (2) The commonly used
converters; (3) Voltage and torque equations; (4) Control approaches; (5) Key
issues for enhancing the driving performance of commonly used electric machines.
5. Power electronic converters for motor drives: (1) Overview of power
semiconductor devices; (2) Introduction to harmonic analysis and modulation
techniques for inverters; (3) PWM inverters for AC motor drives; (4) Some
matching issues between motor, converter and mechanical load.
6. Modeling and control of motor drive: (1) Dynamic modeling of motor drives;
(2) Practical controllers for motor drives; (3) Controller realization.
7. Key issues of commonly used motor drives: (1) Stepping motors: Structures,
driving control and applications; (2) Switched-reluctance machines and other
special machines; (3) DC motors; (4) Induction motor drives and vector control;
(5) Synchronous motors, permanent magnet synchronous motors and brushless DC
motors control; (6) Linear motor drives; (7) Voice coil motor drives.
8. Future trend and application of commonly used motor drives: (1) Choice of
motor drives; (2) Application for motor drives.
E. 參考書籍 (References):
[1] M. Jacob, Power electronics: Principles and applications, Delmar Thomson
Learning, 2002.
[2] G. K. Dubey, Power semiconductor controlled drives, Alpha Science, UK, 2001.
[3] N. Mohan et al., Power electronics: Converters, Applications and Design, 3rd
Ed., John Wiley& Sons, Inc., 2003.
[4] B. K. Bose, Modern Power Electronics and AC Drives, Prentice Hall, New
Jersey, 2002.
[5] B. K. Bose, Power Electronics and Motor Drives: Advances and Trends,
Academic Press, 2006.
[6] P. C. Krause, O. Wasynczuk, and S. D. Sudhoff, Analysis of electric
machinery and drive systems, 3rd ed., New York: Wiley-IEEE, 2013.
F. 教學⽅式  (Teaching Method): ⾯授 . (Lecture)
G. 成績考核 (Evaluation): 作業 , 期中考 , 期末考 .
H. 可連結之網⾴位址 : 系建個⼈網址 : http://www.ee.nthu.edu.tw/cmliaw/

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 626500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫光聲原理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Principles of Biomedical Ultrasound and Photoacoustics
任課教師  Instructor ：李夢麟
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W2 上課教室  Room ：台達 202 ／ 32
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Instructor: Meng-Lin Li ( 李夢麟 )
Course description:
Introduce basic principles of biomedical ultrasound imaging systems
including conventional ultrasound and an emerging and promising ultrasound-
mediated biophotonic imaging modality - photoacoustic imaging. Collateral
comparisons between these two imaging modalities (ultrasound versus optics)
are included for each lecture topic. System design considerations, related
signal processing and recent progress will be discussed. Fundamentals in
tissue optics will be also introduced.
Undergraduate students who have taken “Signals and Systems”, “Communication
Systems (I)”, or "Introduction to DSP" are also welcome.
Prerequisites:
Signals and Systems (at least knowledge of Fourier transform and sampling),
or
consent of instructor
Tentative topics:
1. Overview of Biomedical Ultrasonic Imaging
2. Acoustic Wave Propagation
3. Scattering, Attenuation and Speckle – Ultrasound versus Optics
4. Tutorial on Photoacoustic Imaging
5. Diffraction and Beam Formation Using Arrays
6. Real-Time Image Formation
7. Color and Spectral Doppler
8. Emerging Technologies and Trends
Textbook:
Class notes.
Related materials and papers will be distributed when appropriate.
Class notes and related materials can be downloaded from
http://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw
Lecture method:
Flipped classroom
(Powerpoint lecture slides + Asynchrounous on-line lectures + In class Q&A)
References:
1. Lecture notes of Prof. Pai-Chi Li, National Taiwan University
2. Thomas L. Szabo, “Diagnostic Ultrasound Imaging: Inside Out,”
Elsevier Academic Press, 2004.
3. Lihong V. Wang, and H.-I. Wu, “Biomedical Optics: Principles and
Imaging,” Wiley-Interscience, 2007.
4. Richard S. C. Cobbold, “Foundations of Biomedical Ultrasound,”
Oxford University Press, 2007.
5. J. W. Goodman, “Introduction to Fourier Optics,” MaGraw-Hill, 1968.
6. J. A. Jensen, “Estimation of Blood Velocity Using Ultrasound,”
Cambridge University Press, 1996.
7. K. K. Shung, M. B. Smith, and B. Tsui, “Principles of Medical
Imaging,” Academic Press, 1992.
Grading:
50% Computer homework (MATLAB)
30% Quizzes and midterm exam
20% Final report/presentation
Grading for late homework:
final score = (original score)*0.9^((delivery date – due date)/2)
(Note that these weights are approximate; we reserve the right to change
them later.)

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 641300學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 32
中文名稱  Course Title ：系統⽣物學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Systems Biology
任課教師  Instructor ：陳博現
上課時間  Time ： W3W4R2 上課教室  Room ：台達 202 ／ 32
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Systems biology is a discipline that integrates biochemistry, cell biology,
computer science, and systems engineering to provide a holistic view on
biological functions and structures. The genomic revolution of high-
throughput techniques has opened up systematic investigations and
engineering designs for various life forms. System biology entails synthetic
biology and creates many emerging applications in energy, pharmaceuticals,
bio-materials, foods, ecosystem protection, etc. through engineering
principles. This course will discuss the system-level models of various
basic biological process, analysis of experimental and literature data, and
deduce interesting theoretical insight.
Students will need basic understanding of linear algebra, probability, and
control theory. No prerequisite of biology courses is essential to take this
course.
課程內容
1.Introduction (Cell Biology)
2.Modeling of Biochemical Systems (Basic Mathematics and Control Theory)
3.Specific Biochemical Systems
4.Model Fitting
5.Analysis of High-throughput Data
6.Gene expression Models
7.Stochastic Systems and Variability (Statistics and Stochastic Processes)
8.Network Structures, Dynamics, and Function
9.Optimality and Evolution
10.Experimental Techniques in Molecular Biology
11.Databases
12.Modeling Tools
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
教科書  : Lecture Notes ( ⾃編講義 )
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.Systems Biology : A Textbook
Edda Klipp, Wolfram Liebermeister, Christoph Wierling, Axel Kowald, Hans
Lehrach, Ralf Herwig, August 2009, Wiley
2. Systems Biology and Synthetic Biology
Pengcheng Fu, Sven Panke, April 2009, Wiley
3.An Introduction to Systems Biology : Design Principles of Biological
Circuits
Uri Alon, July 2006, Chapman and Hall/CRC
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
投影片教學
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
⼀星期⼀單元為原則

期中考及期末考  50% , 作業  50%

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 645500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等計算機結構
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Computer Architecture
任課教師  Instructor ：劉靖家
黃稚存
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W2 上課教室  Room ：台達 209 ／ 53
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
We will discuss several advanced concepts of computer architecture for modern machines. The focus will be
on both single-thread and multi-core performance. The parallelism of instruction execution, data/vector, and
threads are examined in details. The concepts will be reinforced through simulation assignments. Students
will perform hands-on simulation and analysis of several architecture techniques. It is recommended that
students have taken undergraduate computer architecture course.
⼆、教科書  (Textbooks)
“Computer Architecture --- A Quantitative Approach” by John Hennessy and David Patterson, 6th Edition,
2017, Morgan Kaufmann
三、參考書籍  (References)
* Synthesis Lectures on Computer Architecture, Springer
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Weeks Subject
1 Introduction
2 Cache
3 DRAM organization
4 Cache coherence
5 Memory consistency
6 Network on Chip
7 Instruction level parallelism (ILP) and static scheduling
8 Dynamic scheduling/Midterm Exam
9 Hardware speculation
10 Branch prediction
11 Vector machine
12 Vector machine
13 SIMD
14 GPU
15 Domain-specific architectures
16 Final Exam
架構模擬器實驗平台將另提供線上講義和操作文件，以補充 17/18 週內容和進度。
We will provide lectures and related lab notes of GEM5 simulator for students to complete the 17th and 18th
week workload.

科號  Course Number ： 11210EE 664100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：數位聲訊分析與合成
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Analysis and synthesis of digital audio signals
任課教師  Instructor ：劉奕汶
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 209 ／ 53
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. 課程說明 (course description)：
To introduce application of signal processing methods in music, language, and
other sounds in daily life, including two major parts: sound analysis and sound
synthesis. After taking this course, students should be familiar with the core
techniques and background knowledge in this field. Also, current research topics
will be selectively covered. Final projects are required and students are
encouraged to be creative. Prerequisite: Signals and Systems, Linear Algebra, or
consent by the instructor. Undergraduates in junior or senior years are also
welcome to take this course.

2. Textbook: None.
3. References:
I plan to focus on speech and human voice. Below is a good reference I've found,
L. R. Rabiner and R. W. Schafer, "Introduction to digital speech processing,"
Foundations and Trends in Signal Processing, Vol. 1, Nos. 1–2 (2007) 1–194.
You may find its PDF online.
https://www.nowpublishers.com/article/Details/SIG-001
Otherwise, lecture notes and papers for group discussion will be handed out
throughout the semester.
4. Teaching methods: a mixture of lectures and student-reporting. We embrace a
problem-based learning paradigm. Followings are the course objectives -- we want
students to cultivate these abilities:
(1) to write an algorithm and implement signal processing methods from their
mathematical descriptions (a set of equations).
(2) to analyse human voice signals, modify parametric representations, and
resynthesize to create special effects.
(3) to relate voice processing methods to underlying assumptions about human voice
perception and production
(4) to choose appropriate performance evaluation methods for quality of
synthesized voice, including subjective and objective ones.
5. Syllabus (Tentative):
For your reference, in Spring 2021, we covered the following topics
-- Basic Fourier transform and digital filtering
-- Linear prediction voice processing
-- sinusoidal modeling-based voice processing
-- sine + noise decomposition and audio data compression
-- vocoders

科號  Course Number ： 11210EECS101001學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 135
中文名稱  Course Title ：邏輯設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Logic Design
任課教師  Instructor ：黃錫瑜
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R5R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course covers the fundamental issues of designing a digital system. We will
begin by introducing number systems, Boolean algebra, and logic gates. After that,
we will discuss the minimization techniques of Boolean functions using Karnaugh
Map as well as algorithmic procedures. In the second half, we will focus on the
design techniques for combinational, sequential, and memory circuits. Finally, we
will introduce the more modern design concepts using Register-Transfer-Level (RTL)
descriptions. Upon the completion, the students will know how to realize a
given digital system, e.g., the arithmetic logic unit (ALU) of a CPU or into a
logic
circuit.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
M. Mano and M. Ciletti, “Digital Design,” 4th edition or later, Pearson / Prentice
Hall, 2019.
三、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures in ENGLISH using PPT slides
四、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1) Binary systems
2) Boolean algebra and logic gates
3) Gate-level minimization
4) Combinational logic
5) Synchronous sequential logic
6) Registers & counters
7) Memory & programmable logic
8) Register transfer level Design Method
五、成績考核  (Evaluation)
In-Classroom Quizzes 10%, Homeworks 30%, Midterm Exams 30%, Final Exam 30%
六、 AI Poly:
AI is allowed for this class. If (generative) AI is used in the homework, please
indicate how it is used.
科號  Course Number ： 11210EECS101002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：邏輯設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Logic Design
任課教師  Instructor ：⾺席彬  MA HSI PIN
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R5R6 上課教室  Room ：旺宏懷樸／ 170
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces the basic theory of digital logic design and the implementation of logic circuit. In the
beginning, binary number systems, simple boolean algebra, and switching functions are presented. The
optimization method for combinational logic, which is the most important portion of the digital logic design,
will
be presented in detail in this section. Then, basic storage registers such as D-latch, D-flip-flop etc will be
introduced in the section of the synchronous sequential logic, which will form a foundation for useful control
technique - finite-state machine. After that combination logic and sequential circuits are combined to support
number control in the digital system. The design for the registers and counters are taught in different types.
Memory is the very traditional digital element in the IC circuit, and the basic operations of read, write, and
error
protection will be demonstrated. In the same section, the programmable devices FPGA will be introduced.
Finally, the basic description of digital logic, Register Transfer Level, will be introduced.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
M. Morris R. Mano and Michael D. Ciletti, Digital Design: With an Introduction to the Verilog HDL, VHDL,
and
SystemVerilog (6th Edition), Pearson International Edition.
三、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lecture
四、教學進度  (Syllabus)
(1)Digital systems and information
(2)Combinational logic circuits
(3)Combinational logic design
(4)Arithmetic functions
(5)Sequential circuits
(6)Registers and register transfers
(7)Memory basics
五、成績考核  (Evaluation)
Quiz 25%, Midterm Exams x2 50%, Final Exam 25%

Course Description
This course introduces fundamental programming concepts in the Python language and related environment.
Fundamental concepts include overview of computer systems, Python environment setup, Python language
overview, command line interface, numbers, string formatting, sequences, dictionaries and sets, control flow,
exception, file, function, recursion, object orientation, inheritance, polymorphism, and modules. The
programming environment will be primarily text-based in Unix environment, although graphical user
interface
(IDLE) and web-based (Jupyter) will also be demonstrated.
Restrictions:
- EECS1210 and CS1358 may not both be taken for credit, because they are the same. Also, if you have taken
CS1355 (C programming), you will be blocked from registering for this course. If you are interested in
learning
just Python and you already have background in programming, you are encouraged to take the MOOC version
for free as a student in the Taiwan university system. The lectures and materials are the same, and we have
also set up a new online judge for programming practice. For Fall semester, NTHU students may fill out this
GoogleForm https://forms.gle/kmnNC7dNqiThR8wM8 to register a GAPP email address (non-NTHU students
please use your university account rather than personal Gmail), and our staff will create the account when the
course opens for the Fall semester.

GAPP 帳號，其
他非清⼤同學請使⽤學校帳號。到時秋季班課程開放時，我們會幫有填表的同學註冊。

- 2 hours of recorded lecture (Mandarin with English captions) quiz every other week.
Syllabus
Week 1 - introduction, environment setup
Week 2 - tour of Python
Week 3 - basic types, command-line application
Week 4 - command-line application (cont'd), strings
Week 5 - collections: sequence (list, tuple), set, dict
Week 6 - control constructs: if, while, for
Week 7 - exceptions, files
Week 8 - functions
Week 9 - recursion, functional programming
Week 10 - object-oriented programming part 1: class, method
Week 11 - object-oriented programming part 2: inheritance, operator overloading
Week 12 - generators, iterators
Week 13 - standard library part 1: data types, itertools
Week 14 - standard library part 2: regular expressions, Tkinter

30% - assignments

40% - final exam

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Signals and Systems

上課時間  Time ： W5W6R8R9 上課教室  Room ：台達 215 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Goal and Overview:
This course introduces basic mathematical tools to analyze continuous/discrete-time
signals and linear time-invariant systems that may be encountered in many
disciplines of electrical engineering, such as signal processing, communications,
circuit design, and control. In this course, we will cover topics such as
convolution, filtering, sampling, Fourier series, Fourier transform, Laplace
transform, and the z-transform. In essence, students will learn how to view and
process signals in both time and frequency domains.
Related Topics: Calculus, Linear Algebra.
Textbook Book:
Alan V. Oppenheim and Alan S. Willsky, with S. Hamid Nawab, Signals and
Systems, 2nd Ed., Pearson Education Limited, 2014 (or Prentice-Hall, 1997)
References: (not required)
1. Matthew N. O. Sadiku and Warsame H. Ali, Signals and Systems: A Primer with
MATLAB®, CRC Press, 2016
2. Simon Haykin and Barry Van Veen, Signals and Systems, 2nd Ed., John Wiley & Sons,
Inc., 2003
Syllabus:
1. Introduction to Signals and Systems
2. Linear Time-Invariant Systems
3. Fourier Series Representation of Periodic Signals
4. The Continuous-Time Fourier Transform
5. The Discrete-Time Fourier Transform
6. Time and Frequency Characterization of Signals and Systems
7. Sampling
8. The Laplace Transform
9. The z-Transform
Evaluation: Homework 30%; Midterm 35%; Finals 35%
Course Website: https://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw/

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Ordinary Differential Equations class is to teach how to solve differential
equations, which are models in many engineering problems. This post-calculus
mathematics is needed and used by today's scientists and engineers. It will cover
the following topics:
1. First order differential equations
2. Second order differential equations
3. Laplace transform
4. Series solutions for differential equations
5. Systems of differential equations
6. Fourier series
本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤

Brooks/Cole.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to introduce the design principles of computer networks and train students to implement
networked applications. We will discuss computer networks and the Internet, application layer protocols,
transport layer protocols, network layer protocols, and data link layer protocols.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach, by James F. Kurose and Keith W. Ross, 8th Edition, Pearson.
三、參考書籍 (References)
None.

1. Computer Networks and the Internet
2. Application layer
3. Transport layer
4. The Network layer: Data Plane
5. The Network layer: Control Plane
6. The link layer and Local Area Networks

中文名稱  Course Title ：全球經濟
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Globalizing Economy
任課教師  Instructor ：黃朝熙

上課時間  Time ： RaRb 上課教室  Room ：台積 905 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
General Information
Instructors.
劉瑞華， rhliu@mx.nthu.edu.tw, Tel: 03-5742731
張寶塔， btchang@mx.nthu.edu.tw, Tel: 03-5742734
黃朝熙， ghuang@mx.nthu.edu.tw, Tel: 03-5742735
Office Hours. by appointment. (Email is the best way to reach us.)
About the Course
Course objective: This course is intended to have students understand
the current important issues about global economy. The regular lectures are
organized under the framework of Trade and Development, with topics cover
theory, history, institution, and policy. In addition, two selective
lectures will explore recent hot issues of globalization – cultural
diversity and creative industries, and new challenge of central banking.
These lectures are given by the professors from the Economics Department.
There are also two lectures which are delivered by guest speakers to cover
the contemporary policy issues,
Students are required to do assignments and engage in class discussion, and
finish a final team report. Through these requirements, you should apply the
knowledge form this course to your work or career plan, and also be .more
influential in public issue. The last two weeks are reserved for students to
present the team projects and review what you have learned.
Course Material. There is no textbook. We will announce references and a
reading list one or two weeks before each lecture. Lecture notes and/or
handouts for class discussions will be distributed to you in each class.
Grading.
The final grade will be determined by the attendance, the class discussion,
assignments and team project report with presentation. Weights for grading
are based on the three items: 30% for the attendance and discussion, 40%
for the assignments, and 30% for the final report.

科號  Course Number ： 11210EMBA508400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 50
中文名稱  Course Title ：創新與創業
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Innovation and Entrepreneurship
任課教師  Instructor ：張元杰
陳信宏
上課時間  Time ： S2S3S4 上課教室  Room ：台積 224 ／ 124
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
National Tsing Hua University
Institute of Technology Management ／ MBA
Course Syllabus: Innovation and Entrepreneurship ( 創新與創業 )
授課教師／ Instructors
張元杰  Dr. Yuan-Chieh Chang (yucchang@mx.nthu.edu.tw)
陳信宏  Dr. Shin-Horng Chen (shchen@mail.cier.edu.tw)
A. 課程介紹／ Course Description:
1.介紹創業管理的基礎知識與技能，使學⽣能瞭解創業精神與經濟發展、企業管理之間的關係
及
實務創業家所關⼼主要問題。
2.開拓學⽣的視野，瞭解專業經理⼈除了要為股東善盡效率管理⼈之責任外，發揮創業精神才
是
創造企業成⻑及獲得超額利潤的來源。有助於培養 MBA 學⽣以創新思維，處理既有企業的新事業
發展管理、創投事業經營與⾃⾏創業的能⼒。
3.使學⽣瞭解新創事業的特性與其所⾯臨的相關管理問題，如分析創業商機、撰寫創業計畫
書、
籌募資⾦、管理成⻑與經營團隊管理。
The objective of this course is to provide the student with an
understanding of the problems and challenges facing an entrepreneur in the
process of creating a business. The course will use the development of a
business plan as the focal point. Groups of students will develop a business
plan piece by piece. Each group will make 2 case presentations and write a
business plan during the semester.
Therefore the focus of this course is the planning and development of new
ventures for the growth and profits of new or existing enterprises. The
students will gain a firm understanding and the competence in the area of
entrepreneurship. The business plan projects are required, which will
further elaborate on particular aspects of the course according to the
student’s own objectives and background. The business plan projects also
help to consolidate theories and best practices from the western countries
to the context of Taiwan’s industries. Interactive learning is emphasized
throughout the course. Student’s participation in class, including
discussion, homework, and project presentation is a critical and integral
part of the course.
B. Textbooks:
Timmons, J.A. and Spinelli, S. (2009) New Venture Creation: Entrepreneurship
for the 21st Century, 8th Ed., McGraw-Hill. ( 華泰代理 )
C. References:
1.Dollinger, M. J. (1999) Entrepreneurship: Strategies and Resources, NJ:
Prentice-Hall.
3.Holt, D. H. (1992) Entrepreneurship: New Venture Creation, NJ: Prentice-
Hall.
D. Evaluation:
1.Participation 30%
2.Homework 30%
3.Final report 40%
E. Teaching Approach:
1.Lecture 50%
2.Case Study 30%
3.Presentation 20%
F. Course Schedule:
1.創新管理思潮與開放式創新
2.創新規劃與預測
3.創新組織與團隊
4.新產品開發與評價
5.服務創新
6.產業創新議題：電動⾞、⾏動通訊

科號  Course Number ： 11210EMBA508900學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 50
中文名稱  Course Title ：服務科學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Service Science
任課教師  Instructor ：王俊程
上課時間  Time ： S5S6S7 上課教室  Room ：台積 224 ／ 124
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
國立清華⼤學科技管理學院
MBA558901
服務科學
(Introduction to Service Science)
課程⼤綱
授課教師：王俊程教授
課程簡介：
眾所週知，世界已經邁向了服務經濟的時代。「服務」存在⼈類社會遠在所謂的「服務業」的產業分
類。但究竟
「服務」是什麼？⽽當 IBM 於 2004 年倡導所謂的「服務科學」，或者後來加上⼯程與管理，統稱「服
務科學⼯程
與管理」 (Service Science, Management, and Engineering, SSME) 。近年來，在原有的 SSME
外加
上Design ，成為現在⼀般談及服務科學時，以 SSMED 來描述它。究竟其內涵與實質內容為何？究竟服
務科學的
範圍與議題為何？服務科學與現有的學術與實務領域有何關聯？如何將服務科學的理論應⽤於實務
上？實務上的
議題與需求如何來成為服務科學的研究內容與貢獻？本課程的課程內容規劃即在滿⾜⼤家對服務科學
的好奇⼼。
同時也希望學⽣能勇敢地探索此⼀新的領域，成為服務科學發展學術與實務社群的⽣⼒軍。
本課程的⽬標簡述如下：
1. 學⽣能完整定義服務科學的內涵與範疇。
2. 學⽣能應⽤服務體驗設計，進⾏服務設計。
3. 學⽣能分析與規劃服務價值網絡以提供服務價值。
4. 學⽣能針對不同的產業提出創新的服務模式。
5. 學⽣能指出重要的服務科學相關的重要議題，進⾏研究。
本課程的內容與教學具有以下的特⾊：
1. 理論與實務並重；
2. 講授與個案教學相輔相成；
3. 實作專案，內化知識與能⼒。
課程模組與主題：
⼀、服務科學簡介
1. What is service science?
2. Service science, the revolution vs. the evolution?
3. Service economy, where does the service value come from?
4. Service innovation, what can be counted as service innovation?
⼆、服務體驗設計
1. How do you know potential customers’ needs?
2. Methods for service design and engineering
3. New service development (NSD)
4. New service development project management.
三、服務價值網絡
1. How to articulate segmented business processes as a value added service
network?
2. How to add service value to products?
四、資訊科技與服務科學
1. IT service
2. Service-oriented Architecture (SOA)
3. Cloud computing and service
四、服務科學與服務開放創新
1. Service open innovation
2. Service experimentation
3. Service quality
4. Service globalization
評分要點：課程參與： 60% 作業： 40%

[1]台灣服務科學學會，服務科學：服務系統觀與價值共創論，前程文化出版， 2015 。
[2]池熙璿（譯），服務主導邏輯，中國⽣產⼒中⼼出版， 2016 。 (Lusch, R. F. & Vargo, S.I.,
Service-Dominant Logic: Premises, Perspectives, Possibilities, Cambridge
University Press, 2012) 。

COURSE DEscriptION
The goal of this course is to introduce the fundamental principles of corporate finance to students. An
emphasis will be placed upon on (1) Introduction to Corporate Finance and Financial Statement Analysis, (2)
Value and Capital Budgeting, (3) Risk and Return Analysis, (4) Capital Structure and Dividend Decision, and
(5) Other related Financial Topics.

⼀ 智慧城市概念、技術及應⽤、智慧科技發展對城市治理的影響

● 課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將以智慧城市論壇的架構，以課程解說、實際案例研討及標竿案例學習參訪等⽅式，讓學⽣完
整了解智慧城市的內涵及相關城市運作實際狀況。學⽣完成課程後，將獲得智慧城市評估⽅法、各部
⾨如何利⽤感測器等蒐集資料、進⾏數據分析及如何利⽤⼤數據統計或⼈⼯智慧進⾏決策，進⽽使得
城市治理更智慧化。課程於每個單元解說⼀個程度後，會請學⽣餐與討論分享，由於學⽣為在職⽣，
且多數從事科技產業，藉由同學的討論，將可使學⽣更能夠進入課程情境。
本課程將安排於星期⽇全天上課，隔週上課為原則。將視課程專業領域，約 8 個專題 (18 ⼩時 ) ，邀請
學界、產業、政府部⾨專業⼈⼠，講授特定智慧城市治理專案。課程將安排兩次全天的參訪，包括國
科會新創基地 Taiwan Tech Arena(TTA) 、台北捷運公司、防災科技中⼼及國科會未來科技展，讓學
⽣親⾃體會政府部⾨在推展智慧科技的進程。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Description: Introduction to crystal structures and electronic properties
of crystals, suitable for beginning graduate students of engineering.
Preliminary requirement: modern physics.
Textbook: C. Kittel, "Introduction to solid state physics", 8th ed.
Reference: Ashcroft and Mermim, "Solid state physics".
Syllabus:
1. crystal structures
2. reciprocal lattices
3. crystal vibrations from atomic viewpoint
4. elastics
5. free electron model
6. energy band structures
7. semiconductor crystals
Evaluation:
1. homework
2. midterm test
3. final test
Teaching method: lectures.
科號  Course Number ： 11210ENE 522000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 15
中文名稱  Course Title ：數位積體電路
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Digital Integrated Circuits
任課教師  Instructor ：張彌彰  CHANG MI CHANG
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 211 ／ 51
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will cover the fundamentals of digital circuits in the state-of-the-art CMOS technologies. Special
attention will be devoted to the impact of scaling, nano-CMOS effects, interconnect, signal integrity, power
consumption, and timing.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
"Digital Integrated Circuits: A Design Perspective", by Jan Rabaey, Anantha Chandrakasan, and Borivoje
Nikolic
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and discussions.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
o. Introduction
o. Devices
o. Manufacturing Process
o. Inverters
o. Interconnect
o. Logic Gates
o. Sequential Circuits
o. Design Methodology
o. Timing Issues
o. Interconnect Revisit
o. Arithmetic Building Blocks
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homeworks: 50%, Midterms: 20%, Final: 30%
七、可連結之網⾴位址
To be provided later.
科號  Course Number ： 11210ENE 527000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 50
中文名稱  Course Title ：互補式⾦氧半影像感測器
英文名稱  Course English Title ： CMOS Image Sensor
任課教師  Instructor ：⾦雅琴  Ya-Chin King
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：台達 209 ／ 53
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
CMOS Imagers has become one of the key technologies for the realization of
digital imaging systems. The development of CMOS imagers required the
fundamental
knowledge of photodetector, pixel circuit and optical and digital systems. ENE
students
who wish to conduct studied in related field can gain fundamental training in
understanding the design and analysis of an image sensor, data path in digital
camera and pixel design in advance CIS technologies.
三、參考書籍 (References)
"CMOS IMAGERS: from phototransduction to image processing", O. Yadid-Pecht

Instructor: Dr. Chao-Hui Yeh

A. Course Description: Introduction of Detailed investigation of
the basic principles of 'unit' processes used in the fabrication of solid-state
devices and integrated circuits for silicon based electronics and beyond.
Emphasis is placed on the fundamental aspects of lithography, film deposition, wet
etching, anisotropic dry etching, crystal growth, ion implantation, and chemical
vapor deposition of metals and insulators.
B. Text Books:
1. Silicon VLSI Technology, Fundamentals, Practice and Modeling, J. D. Plummer,
M.D. Deal, and P.B. Griffin, Prentice-Hall, 2000, ISBN: 0-13-085037-3.
C. Reference book:
1. Fundamentals of Semiconductor Fabrication, G. S. May, S. M. Sze, Wiley, 2003
ISBN: 978-0-471-23279-7
2. Semiconductor Devices: Physics and Technology 3/E, S. M. Sze, M.-K. Lee,
Wiley, 2012
3. Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology, M. Quirk and J. Serda, Prentice Hall,
2001.
4. Semiconductor Physics & Devices Basic Principles 4/E(IE), D. A. Neamen,
McGrawHill
2012, ISBN ： 978-0-071-08902-9

科號  Course Number ： 11210ENE 533000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 80
中文名稱  Course Title ：積體電路元件
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor Devices for Integrated Circuits
任課教師  Instructor ：黃智⽅
上課時間  Time ： W5W6F5 上課教室  Room ：資電  206 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to provide entry level graduate students with basic knowledge
and training in the field of semiconductor devices that are mostly used in
integrated circuits. The course content covers basic semiconductor physics, PN
junctions, Bipolar Junction Transistors, and metal-Oxide-Semiconductor Field
Effect Transistors, and some advanced devices. The students will learn physics,
design principles, and circuit models of these devices.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
● 參考書籍 (References)
D. Neamen, Semiconductor Physics and Devices: Basic Principles (4th Edition),
McGraw-Hill, 2012.
R. Pierret, Advanced Semiconductor Fundamentals (2nd Edition), Pearson, 2002.
C. Hu, Modern Semiconductor Devices for Integrated Circuits, Pearson, 2010.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂講授或是遠端教學 ( 視疫情狀況⽽定 )
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction / Crystal Structure of Solids
2. Quantum Mechanics / Schrodinger Equation
3. Energy Bands / Energy Bands in 3D Crystals
4. Density of States / Fermi-Dirac Statistics
5. Doping / Equilibrium Statistics / Carrier Conc.
6. Non-Equilibrium Statistics: Recombination-Generation
7. Carrier Transport / Semiconductor Equations
8. PN Junction Electrostatics / I-V Characteristics
9. PN Junctions – non-ideal / AC Resp. / Trans
10. metal-Semiconductor Junctions
11. Bipolar Transistors I
12. Bipolar Transistors II
13. MOS Electrostatics
14. MOSFETS: Ideal
15. MOSFETS: Advanced/Nonideal
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
3 Exams 100%

科號  Course Number ： 11210ENE 540000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：微機電系統設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Micro Electro Mechanical Systems (MEMS) Design
任課教師  Instructor ：盧向成
上課時間  Time ： W3W4R3 上課教室  Room ：台達 208 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
MEMS (Microelectromechanical systems) technology allows for the miniaturization
of bio-electro-mechanical devices and systems, enabling the integration of
various components onto a single chip. This results in numerous benefits,
including increased functionality, reduced size and cost, improved performance,
and higher reliability. MEMS technology finds applications in a wide range of
industries, including automotive, aerospace, biomedical, consumer electronics,
telecommunications, and more.
To enhance interdisciplinary learning in this field, this course will cover a
wide range of topics, including microfabrication, micromechanical and
biochemical sensors, actuation mechanisms, static and dynamic mechanical
analysis, noise analysis, sensor readout design, MEMS control, and MEMS system-
level design methodology.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Gregory T.A. Kovacs, Micromachined transducers sourcebook, The McGraw-Hill,
Inc., 1998.
2. Stephen D. Senturia, Microsystem design, Kluwer Academic Publishers, 2001.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint presentation and blackboard
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
(1) Introduction
(2) Microfabrication
(3) Integrated Processes
(4) Sensing circuits
(5) Micromachanical Sensors
(6) Bio- and Chemical Sensors
(7) Electrostatic Actuation
(8) Mechanics of Material
(9) Mechanical Vibration
(10) Thermomechanical and Electronics Noises in Sensors
(11) Computer-Aided Design for MEMS
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework + Paper study + Lab (20%)
Final exam (30%)
Project I: accelerometers (25%)
Project II: topic of student's own choice (25%)
Students are required to choose a research topic as the final project. In the
oral presentation and the written report, please clearly address your motivation
and why the topic is chosen. Students are expected to conduct an extensive
literature survey and realize the design, analysis, fabrication, performance,
and important characteristics of related works in the field.

必須研讀內容後以⾃⼰的⽅式寫出⾃⼰的報告。

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Organic Semiconductor
任課教師  Instructor ：洪勝富
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程講述有機半導體相關特性、物理、元件、以及應⽤。主要課程⽬的有三 : ⼀是了解相關有機
半導體與相關元件之基本物理特性，理解這些特性之物理來源，以及如何由所量測特性反推結構 /
元件內之物理過程；⼆是理解相關應⽤之⽬前現狀，三是提供相關應⽤所需之相關知識，例如
OLED應⽤中之視感度、 CIE 特性等。主要課程內容包括有機半導體之特性、以及它們在發光元件、
電⼦元件、太陽電池等、及⽣化感測等相關之⽤途。本課程之⽬的希望提供電機系電⼦所等相關背
景同學在有機半導體研究領域的基本知識。本課程將主要強調共軛⾼分⼦相關有機半導體。
修習完本課程後  可以對有機半導體光電元件之基本原理、基本製程、發展現狀以及發
展⽅向等有⼀⼤要的了解。對於⽬前有機顯⽰器、可撓式電⼦元件、有機相關太陽電池、有機感測
器等，可有⼀基本的了解。
修習本課程應先具備有基本半導體元件的基本知識，  以及以及基本量⼦物理 ( ⼀維位能井之能階 )
的概念。共軛 pi 電⼦系統的簡單計算⽅式會於課程中講述。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books) 與參考資料
本課程將主要以講義為主，並輔以相關期刊論文。

1. 有機半導體之種類、特性、與電⼦結構簡介

3. 有機半導體之發光特性
4. 有機半導體發光⼆極體結構與特性
5. 有機半導体電⼦元件
6. 有機半導體於太陽電池⽅⾯之應⽤
7. 有機半導體相關製程
8. 有機半導體發展之相關展望

科號  Course Number ： 11210ENE 552000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：太陽電池
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Solar Cells
任課教師  Instructor ：洪勝富
上課時間  Time ： M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：台達 208 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程的⽬的在提供學⽣了解太陽電池的基本原理、設計太陽電池最佳化之半定量評估，並對⽬前
新穎太陽電池之發展最⼀簡介。本課程之先修科⽬為固態電⼦元件或者相關半導體元件課程。修過
本課程可對於⽬前太陽電池的現狀、與新穎太陽電池之發展有⼀清楚的了解。本課程預達成三個⽬
標:1.了解各物理參數對於太陽電池元件特性的影響； 2. 了解如何由量測來評估 / 分析影響太陽電
池特性的主要參數，及如何改進； 3. 各種太陽電池的基本了解與未來發展趨勢。
我希望這是⼀個具有研究性質導向的研究所課程，除了習題外，上課同學必須餐與課程做期中與期
末報告，針對欲深入探討的特定課題尋找相關 paper ，對論文內容做出消化，做⼗分⾄⼗五鐘報
告。期中為該課題原理之初步報告，期末則進⼀步報告相關的應⽤或文獻上研究成果。
另外，⼤部分習題都需使⽤⼀些計算軟體，我希望來修課的同學⾄少要能使⽤ ( 或者盡快具備使⽤
能⼒ )Matlab, Mathematica, 或者 Maple 等軟體，或能⾃⾏寫相關計算程式亦可。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
無 以課程講義為主

1. Markvart and Castaaner, Solar cells :materials, manufacture and operation,
Elsevier, 2005.
2. Nelson, The Physics of Solar Cells, Imperial College Press, 2003.

科號  Course Number ： 11210ENE 553000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 22
中文名稱  Course Title ：兆赫波科技
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Terahertz Science and Technology
任課教師  Instructor ：楊尚樺
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3 上課教室  Room ：台達 212 ／ 22
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This course provides graduate students with an overview of the unique properties
of terahertz waves and potential applications as well as the state of the current
terahertz systems and their major technological challenges. The topics covered in
this course include: terahertz sources, terahertz detectors, terahertz electronic
components, sensing with terahertz radiation, and terahertz applications
(biology, medicine, space sciences, pharmaceutical industry, security and
communications).
References:
"Sensing with Terahertz Radiation", Daniel Mittleman, ed. (Springer, 2004)
"Terahertz Spectroscopy: Principles and Applications" (Optical Science and
Engineering Series), Susan L. Dexheimer, ed. (CRC Press, Taylor and Francis
group,
2007)
"Terahertz Sensing Technology: Emerging Scientific Applications & Novel Device
Concepts" (Selected Topics in Electronics and Systems, Vol. 32), Dwight L.
Woolard,
William R. Loerop, Michael Shur (Eds), (World Scientific, 2003)
“Millimeter and Submillimeter Wave Spectroscopy of Solids” (Topics in Applied
Physics) by George Gruner (Editor), (Springer, Topics in Appl. Phys, vol.74,
1998)
“Infrared and millimeter waves" Kenneth J. Button (editor) (New York: Academic
Press,
1979)
Syllabus:
Week 1: Introduction to Terahertz Technology
Week 2: THz TDS/FDS System
Week 3: THz Sources (I)
Week 4: THz Sources (II)
Week 5: THz Detectors (I)
Week 6: THz Detectors (II)
Week 7: THz Waveguides
Week 8: THz Modulators
Week 9: Midterm
Week 10: THz Spectroscopy Systems
Week 11: THz Imaging Systems
Week 12: THz Communication Systems
Week 13: Oral Presentation
Week 14: THz lab (I)
Week 15: THz lab (II)
Week 16: THz lab (III)
Week 17: THz lab (IV)
Week 18: Final Project
Evaluation:
1. Participation: 40%
2. Midterm: 20%
3. Oral Presentation: 10%
4. Final Project: 30%
科號  Course Number ： 11210ENE 590200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 100
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼈⼯神經網路特論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics on Artificial Neural Network
任課教師  Instructor ：楊雅棠
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  503 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
本課程旨在給學⽣對於⼈⼯神經網路的理論基礎和應⽤已經在軟硬體上的實現有概略的介紹，可以視
為machine
learning 的進階課程，它將討論典型的主題，包括從統計學習理論 (statistical learning theory) 的觀點，嚴
謹的討論學
習的統計基礎，例如神經網絡的訓練 (training) 和測試 (testing) 、 VC 維度 (VC dimension) 和模型複雜性
(model
complexity) 、正則化 (regularization) 作為過度擬合 (overfitting) 的補救措施。此外，我們還想介紹許多特
定的神經網
絡模型，其中⼀些植根於統計物理學，⼀些植根於⽣物學。例如  Hopfield 模型、玻爾茲曼機
(Boltzmann machine) 、
脈衝神經網絡 (spiking neural network) 和⾃組織 (self-organization mapping); 會以 Aurelien Geron 的著作，
Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow, 作為給學⽣實際寫 code 的實例。以
及讓
學⽣了解如何⽤ keras 等軟體實⾏ deep neural network ，也會有⼤量 deep learning 的實例。
課程內容：
1.Introduction
2. Learning process
3. The perceptron
4. Least-mean square algorithm
5. Multilayer perceptron
6. Deep neural network and its software implementation
7. Convolutional neural network;
8.Recurrent networks
9. Neurodynamics and Spiking neural network
10. Neural network rooted in statistical physics
11. Implementation in circuits and hardware
擬⽤教科書或參考書：
教科書：  Aurelien Geron, Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow, 2nd
Edition,
OReilly, 2019.
參考書：
1. Ian Goodfellow and Yoshua Bengio and Aaron Courville, Deep learning, MIT Press.
2. John A. Herz, Introduction to the theory of neural computation (Santa Fe Institute Series)
3. Yaser Abu-Monstafa Learning from data, AML book.
4. Simon Haykin, Neural network and learning machines 3rd edition

This course gives a general introduction to memory types, operation principles,
basic cell structure, process and fabrication issues, basic sense amplifiers,

technologies.

科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 202002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 120
中文名稱  Course Title ：程式語⾔
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Programming Languages
任課教師  Instructor ：許榮鈞
上課時間  Time ： M7M8R5R6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程名稱：程式語⾔（ Programming Languages ）
⼆、授課教師：⼯科系 / 核⼯所  許榮鈞（ rjsheu@mx.nthu.edu.tw ）
三、教學⽅式： 3 學分 ( 每週上課三⼩時 )
四、課程說明：
如何充分利⽤並發揮電腦的功能？你應該了解電腦架構與運作基礎，學習透過數學與邏輯思考設計解
題步驟，再利⽤程式語⾔ ( 控制電腦執⾏的語法 ) 來實現你的想法 ! 這也是本課程的設計⽬的，學習利⽤
程式語⾔來協助你解決問題，特別是⼀些重複性⾼或牽涉複雜計算的⼯作。我們可以利⽤程式語⾔來
控制電腦的運作，達到⾃動化的處理以⼤幅增進⼯作效率。了解電腦⼯作的原理與如何建立演算法 / 解
題⽅案 (Algorithm) 是程式設計最重要的核⼼。本課程主要以 C 語⾔為例介紹程式設計的基本概念，包
括：變數、運算⼦、流程控制、函數、陣列、指標、字串、結構、輸入 / 輸出與檔案處理。上課內容同
時搭配介紹 Python 直譯式程式語⾔，因其簡潔易學特性作為 C 語⾔學習的比較，課堂上所有案例都有 C
與Python 程式碼可供學⽣對照學習。另外，許多⼯程領域的科學計算主要還是以 FORTRAN 語⾔為主，
期末我們也會提及 FORTRAN 與其它語⾔的比較。若有時間也將簡介⼀些進階的資料結構概念，以利
同學未來持續深入程式設計的領域。
課程內容章節如下：
1. Introduction to Computers, the Internet, and the Web
2. Introduction to C Programming
3. Structured Program Development in C
4. C Program Control
5. C Functions
6. C Arrays
7. Python Basics and Data Structures
8. C Pointers
9. C Characters and Strings
10. C Structures and Enumerations
11. C File Processing
12. Fortran, C/C++, and Python for Scientific Computing
五、指定⽤書  (Textbook)
1. P.J. Deitel & H. M Deitel, “C How to Program”, 6th/7th/8th Edition, Prentice Hall (2009/2012/2016)
2. A.B. Downey, “Think Python: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist”, 2nd Edition, O'Reilly Media
(2015)

科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 203001學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程數學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Mathematics I
任課教師  Instructor ：林明緯
上課時間  Time ： T1T2F1F2 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  503 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
This is a mandatory mathematics course for students of the second year of study in
the ESS department. The topics of this course include:
(1) Ordinary differential equations: 1st order ODEs, 2nd order ODEs, higher order
ODEs, and systems of ODEs.
(2) Special functions and power series method.
(3) Laplace transform.
* 課程預備知識 : 需已修習過微積分
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
D. G. Zill, W. S. Wright, and J. J. Ding, Engineering Mathematics,Metric Edition,
Cengage learning, Taipei, Taiwan (2019)
三、參考書籍 (References)
Michael D. Greenberg, "Advanced Engineering Mathematics" 2nd ed.,
(1998 by Prentice-Hall International, 2006 by Pearson Education)
Zill & Wright, "Advanced Engineering Mathematics", 6th Ed., Jones & Bartlett
(2017)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
3 hours lecture per week 。
上課時間 : 每週⼆及週五上午  8:30-9:50 ( 課程中間不下課休息 )
Office Hours,
Thursday, 17:00 - 18:00 pm
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Part 1. Introduction to Differential Equations
Week 1: Definitions and Terminology and Initial-Value Problems
Part 2. First-Order Differential Equations
Week 2, 3: Separable Equations, Linear Equations, Exact Equations, Solutions by
Substitution
(Bernoulli equation, Riccati equation), and an Introduction to Numerical Method
Part 3. Higher-Order Differential Equations
Week 4, 5: Theory of Linear Equations, Reduction of Order, and Homogeneous Linear
Equations with constant coefficients.
Week 6, 7: Undetermined Coefficients, Variation of Parameters, Cauchy-Euler
Equations, and Nonlinear equation.
Week 8, 9: Linear Models of Initial-Value and Boundary-Value problems, and Solving
System of Linear Equations.
Part 4. Series Solutions of Linear Differential Equations
Week 10, 11: Power Series Solutions and the Method of Frobenius
Week 12: Bessel Functions and Legendre Functions
Part 5. The Laplace Transform
Week 13, 14: Definition of Laplace transform, The Inverse Transform and Transform
of Linear Equations, Translation Theorems, Derivative of Transforms, Transform
Integral
Week 15: Transform of a periodic Function, and System of Linear Differential
Equations.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Attendance Quiz (10%)
Homeworks (10%)
First Midterm Exam (25%)
Second Midterm Exam (27%)
Final Exam (28%)
科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 203002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程數學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Mathematics I
任課教師  Instructor ：蕭百沂
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  501 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is a mandatory mathematics course for students in the second year of
ESS department. The topics of this course include:
1) Ordinary Differential Equations: 1st order ODEs, 2nd order ODEs, higher
order ODEs, systems of ODEs
2) Special functions and power series method
3) Laplace Transform
* 課程預備知識 : 需已修習過微積分
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Zill/Wright/Ding, Engineering Mathematics, Metric Edition, Cengage, Taipei,
Taiwan (2019)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Erwin Kreyszig, "Advanced Engineering Mathematics", 10th Ed, Wiley (2011)
2. Michael D. Greenberg, "Advanced Engineering Mathematics" 2nd ed., (1998 by
Prentice-Hall International, 2006 by Pearson Education)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
板書上課， 150 mins lecture per week 。
上課時間 : 每週⼀  10:10~11:30, 每週三  8:40~9:50 ( 課程中間不下課休息 )
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1: Introduction to Differential Equation, definition of basic
terminology
Week 2,3: Linear ODE (homogeneous, non-homogeneous): Euler's integrating
factor method, Lagrange's variations of parameter method, Bernoulli
equation, Riccati equation, d'Alembert-Lagrange equation, Separable
equation, exact equation and integrating factors.
Week 4,5,6: Linear ODE of 2nd order or higher, linear independent/dependent,
Wronskian, basis set of solution of DE, existence and uniqueness for
Initial-Value Problem, homogeneous equation with constant coefficients
(characteristic equation, distinct roots, repeated roots ), harmonic
oscillator (free oscillation)
around Week 7: 第⼀次期中考
Week 8,9,10: Linear nonhomogeneous equation with constant coefficients
(method of undetermined coefficients, method of inverse operators), Forced
harmonic oscillator, system of linear ODE with constant coefficients, Linear
ODE with variable coefficients (Cauch-Euler equation, Method of reduction of
order, Method of variation of parameters)
Week 11,12: power series method, Method of Frobenius
around Week 13: 第⼆次期中考
Week 14,15: Legendre equation, Gamma function, Bessel equation, modified
Bessel equation, exponential integral, equations reducible to Bessel
equations
Week 16,17: Laplace transform, inverse Laplace transform, special functions,
application to the solution of ODE.
Week 18: Final exam

1st Midterm exam (25%)
2nd Midterm exam (25%)
Final exam (25%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：電路學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electric Circuits
任課教師  Instructor ：吳順吉
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is an introductory course in circuit analysis for undergraduate students.
The purpose is to give the students an understanding of various analytical
techniques for describing the behaviors of circuits. Topics to be covered
include Basic Laws, Methods of Analysis, Circuit Theorems, Operational
Amplifiers, Capacitors and Inductors, First/Second-Order Circuit, Steady-State
Sinusoidal Analysis, Frequency Response, and Two-Port Networks.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Introduction to Electric Circuits, Richard C. Dorf and James A. Svoboda, 9th
ed., 2014, John Wiley & Sons.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Fundamentals of Electric Circuits, C. K. Alexander and M. N. O. Sadiku, 5th
ed., 2013, McGraw-HILL.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂板書授課，每周上課  150 分鐘。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Basic Laws,
2. Methods of Analysis,
3. Circuit Theorems,
4. Operational Amplifiers,
5. Capacitors and Inductors,
6. First-Order Circuit,
7. Second-Order Circuit,
8. Steady-State Sinusoidal Analysis,
9.Frequency Response, and
10. Two-Port Networks.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)- 以上課說明為準
1. Homework 10%
2. Two midterm exams 30% + 30%
3. Final exam 30%
No make-up exam!

科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 223000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 120
中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronics I
任課教師  Instructor ：巫勇賢
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
本課程有條件開放使⽤⽣成式 AI 軟體協助作業　請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The objective of this course is to develop in the students the ability to
analyze and design electronic circuits, both analog and digital, discrete and
integrated.
The following is the outline of this course:
1. Introduction to the basic concepts of electronics. Signals, their frequency
spectra, and their analog and digital forms are presented. Amplifiers are
introduced as circuit building blocks and their various types and models are
studied.
2. Introduction to operational amplifiers. Their terminal characteristics,
simple
applications, and limitations are presented.
3. Study of PN junction diode terminal characteristics. Its hierarchy of
models
and basic circuit applications are discussed.
4. Operation principle of MOS field-effect transistor (MOSFET). Study of the
device structure and its physical operation are included. In addition, its
applications are demonstrated through some circuit examples.
5. Operation principle of bipolar junction transistor (BJT). Device physics
will be described and circuit models for transistor operation in different
modes will be developed and utilized in the analysis and design of circuit.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Sedra/Smith, "Microelectronic Circuits", Oxfrod, 7/8th Ed.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Neaman,"Electronic Circuit Analysis And Design,"Irwin.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint files from the course website.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to electronics: 1 week
2. Operational Amplifier: 3 weeks
3. Diodes and related circuits: 3 weeks.
4. BJT Transisotrs: 4 weeks.
5. MOs Transistors: 5 weeks.

科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 234000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：電磁學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electromagnetism II
任課教師  Instructor ：柳克強
上課時間  Time ： M5M6R1R2 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  502 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is the part II of the course on introduction of fundamental
electromangetics, both physics and engineering applications. Here we will
continue our discussions on the following topics:
1. Time-varying electromagnetic fields
2. Electromagnetic plane waves
3. Guided electromagnetic waves, waveguides and transmission lines
4. Electromagnetic radiations and antennas
Students will also learn how to use simulation software such as ANSYS MAXWELL/HFSS,
etc and perform numberical simulation study of electromagnetic structures/devices.
Students will conduct a project study based on numberical simulation analysis. A
project study based on multi-physics analysis is highly recommended.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. David Griffth, Introduction to Electrodynamics
2. Lecture Notes (can be downloaded from NTHU e-learning system)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. N. N. Rao, Elements of Engineering Electromagnetics, 6ed.
2. David K. Chang, Field and Wave Electromagnetics, 2nd ed.
3. William H. Hayt, Jr. and John A. Buck, Engineering Electromagnetics, 7th
ed.
4. John D. Kraus and Daniel A. Fleisch, Electromagnetics with Applications,
5th ed.
5. David M. Pozar, Microwave Engineering, 4th ed.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and discussions
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
0. Review of vector calculus, electrostatics and magnetostatics
1. Electrodynamics (Griffth, Chapter 7)
2. Conservation Laws (Griffth, Chapter 8)
3. Electromagnetic Waves (Griffth, Chapter 9)
4. Potentials and Waves (Griffth, Chapter 10)
5. Radiation (Griffth, Chapter 11)
6. Transmission lines,waveguides & antennas
(David K. Chang, Field and Wave Electromagnetics, 2nd ed.)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Conservation of energy; definitions of heat and work for a macroscopic system;
system states; first law analysis for closed systems; first law control volume
analysis; second law; properties and behavior of pure substances; application
to thermodynamic systems operating in a steady state and transient processes;
typical power producing cycles and refrigerators.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Thermodynamics: An Engineering Approach by Cengel and Boles 9th Ed
● 參考書籍 (References)
Fundamentals of Thermodynamics by Borgnakke and Sonntag, Wiley 10th Ed
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Three hours of lecture (English) per week
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction and basic concepts (Week #1,2)
Properties of pure substances (Week #3,4)
First law: energy analysis of closed systems (Week #5,6)
Midterm Exam (Week #7)
First law: energy analysis of open systems (Week #8,9)
Second law (Week #10,11)
Midterm Exam (Week #12)
Entropy (Week #13-15)
Refrigeration and Brayton cycles (Week #16,17)
Final Exam (Week #18)
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Quizzes: 10%
Midterm exam #1: 30%
Midterm exam #2: 30%
Final exam: 30%
● 可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Personal Website)
eeclass.nthu.edu.tw

課程說明 (Course Description)
熱⼒學為探討能量的入⾨科⽬，探討熱與功之間的轉換 . 本科⽬的重點在於介紹能量的觀念 , 說明熱⼒
學第零 ,
第⼀ ,第⼆ , 第三定律與其應⽤ ; 如何決定物質的狀態 (state) 以及所具有的能量 , ⽤於熱⼒學第⼀與第⼆定
律的分析 ; 以及推導 Thermodynamic Relations, 以及如何利⽤  Thermodynamic Relation 決定物質的
Property.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程為偏重應⽤的⼀⾨課，課程中會介紹包含電⼦學、機率與統計、系統動態、
與⼒學及熱傳等各⽅⾯的基本觀念。修課同學若沒有⾜夠的相關基礎，通常就得靠
課後⾃修才能跟上進度，另外若實驗相關經驗不⾜也可能造成理解上的障礙。因此
建議同學們於三、四年級已具備⼀定基礎後再修習本課程，以避免內容太多無法消
化或觀念抽象無法產⽣共鳴等困擾。本課程另提供實驗課程，歡迎修課同學選修。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
J.P. Holman, "Experimental Methods for Engineers", McGraw-Hill
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂講解
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
本課程在前八週將由李志浩老師介紹以下內容
Chap. 1: Introduction
Chap. 2: Basic Concepts
Chap. 3: Analysis of Experimental Data
Chap. 4: Sensing Devices
Chap. 12: Radiation Measurement
Chap. 14 signal process
Chap. 15 Report writing
本課程在後八週將由蘇育全老師介紹以下內容
Chap. 5: Displacement and Area Measurements
Chap. 6: Pressure Measurement
Chap. 7: Flow Measurement
Chap. 8: Temperature Measurement
Chap. 10: Strain Measurement

分別為 16%, 14%, 35%, 35%

清⼤ eeclass 數位學習平台
科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 328000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 80
中文名稱  Course Title ：訊號與系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Signals and Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：吳順吉
上課時間  Time ： T7T8R7R8 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces basic concepts in signals and systems and their
associated mathematical and computational tools. Its purpose is to provide a
common background for subsequent courses in electrical engineering:
communications, control, electronic circuits, filter design, and digital
signal processing. Topics to be covered include Linear Time-Invariant Systems,
Fourier Series Representation of Periodic Signals, The Continuous-Time Fourier
Transform, The Discrete-Time Fourier Transform, Time and Frequency
Characterization of Signals and Systems, Sampling, The Laplace Transform and
The Z-transform.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
A. V. Oppenheim and A. S. Willsky, "Signals and Systems," 2nd ed., Prentice-
Hall, 1997.
三、參考書籍 (References)
K. Gopalan, "Introduction to Signal and System Analysis", Cengage Learning
2009.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂板書授課，每周上課  150 分鐘。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Linear Time-Invariant Systems,
2. Fourier Series Representation of Periodic Signals,
3. The Continuous-Time Fourier Transform,
4. The Discrete-Time Fourier Transform,
5. Time and Frequency Characterization of Signals and Systems,
6. Sampling,
7. The Laplace Transform, and
8. The Z-transform.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)- 以上課說明為準
1. Homework & Computer Assignments 20%
2. Midterm exam 40%
3. Final exam 40%
No make-up exam!

科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 351000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理冶⾦⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Physical Metallurgy I
任課教師  Instructor ：朱鵬維
上課時間  Time ： M5M6F5F6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  501 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This is the first course of a two-semester sequence treating metallurgical
phenomena and their utilization in engineering materials and processes. The
contents in the first semester are mainly focused on the fundamentals of
materials
science including (1) crystal structure, (2) defects in crystals, (3) diffusion
in substitutional and interstitial solid solutions, (4) phase and phase
diagrams, and (5) plastic deformation.
● 建議先修課程 (Prerequisite Courses)
Introduction to Materials Science I, Thermodynamics of Materials

● ⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明：「有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出」
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據
本校公布之「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，以下說明
如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出：
若於課堂作業或報告中使⽤⽣成式 AI ，學⽣須於課堂作業或報告中的「註腳」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣
成式 AI進⾏議題發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，
教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 401100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：輻射安全
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Radiation Safety
任課教師  Instructor ：陳芳馨
許榮鈞
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  502 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
第⼀部份  輻射安全簡介 (Part 1: Introduction of Radiation Safety)
1. 輻射基本認識 (Basic understanding of radiation)
2. 輻射與物質作⽤ (Radiation interactions with matter)
3. 輻射度量簡介 (Introduction of radiation measurement)
4. 輻射遷移計算簡介 (Introduction of radiation transport)
第⼆部份  輻射防護 (Part 2: Radiation Protection)
1. 輻射劑量單位 (Radiation units)
2. 輻射⽣物效應 (The biological effects of radiation)
3. 天然與⼈造輻射源 (Natural and man-made radiation sources)
4. 輻射防護標準 (Standard of radiation protection)
5. 輻射劑量的計算 (Computations of exposure and dose)
6. 體內劑量估算 (Evaluation of internal dose)
第三部份  輻射屏蔽 (Part 3: Radiation Shielding)
1. 加⾺射線屏蔽 (Gamma-ray shielding)
2. 中⼦輻射屏蔽 (Neutron shielding)
3. 核反應器屏蔽 (Nuclear reactor shielding)
4. X光機屏蔽 (Shielding for X-ray machines)
5. 加速器屏蔽 (Shielding for accelerators)
第四部份  其它輻射安全議題 (Part 4: Supplementary Topics)
⼆、指定⽤書 (Textbooks)
1. John R. Lamarsh, "Introduction to Nuclear Engineering," 3rd Edition, Prentice Hall, New Jersey, 2001.
(Chapters 9 and 10)
2. James E. Turner, "Atoms, Radiation and Radiation Protection," 3rd Edition, Wiley-VCH, Weinheim, 2007.
(Chapters 5, 6, 8, 12, 13, 14, 15 and 16)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. G.F. Knoll, "Radiation Detection and Measurement, 3rd Edition", John Wiley & Sons, New York, 2000.
2. J.K. Shultis and R.E. Faw, "Radiation Shielding", Prentice Hall, Upper Saddle River, NJ, 1996.
3. ICRP 60, "1990 Recommendations of the International Commission on Radiological Protection", ICRP
Publication 60, Ann. ICRP 21 (1-3), 1991.
4. ICRP 103, "The 2007 Recommendations of the International Commission on Radiological Protection",
ICRP Publication 103, Ann. ICRP 37 (2-4), 2007.
5. NCRP 144, "Radiation Protection for Particle Accelerator Facilities," 2003.
6. NCRP 147, "Structural Shielding Design for Medical X-Ray Imaging Facilities," 2004.
7. NCRP 151, "Structure Shielding Design and Evaluation for Megavoltage X- and Gamma-Ray Radiotherapy
Facilities," 2005.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂上課，每星期三⼩時 (3-hour lecture per week)
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
如課程說明所⽰
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
期中考： 35% ＋  期末考： 35% ＋  作業： 20% ＋  出席 & ⼩考： 10%
Midterm(35%) + Final(35%) + Homework(20%) + Attendance&Quiz(10%)
加分題：讀書⼼得報告 (max +10%)

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程涵蓋腐蝕⼯程中有關腐蝕的類型、基本電化學原理與電極電位、腐蝕動⼒學、
鈍化現象、腐蝕量測技術、陰極防蝕、被覆與抑制劑防蝕、環境與防蝕、材料選擇與
設計等主題，⾃淺⽽深提供學⽣腐與腐蝕防制⼯程技術的基礎知識、進階理論與應⽤
領域，使學⽣具備完整的腐蝕⼯程知識，並能於未來的進修或⼯作中加以應⽤。

Inc., New York, 1971.

科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 452000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 50
中文名稱  Course Title ：薄膜⼯程導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Thin Film Engineering
任課教師  Instructor ：黃嘉宏
上課時間  Time ： T5T6F5F6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  406 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course firstly introduces vacuum technology and kinetics of surface
processes. The major content includes the vapor deposition processes, PVD and
CVD, and film formation and structure. The methods of characterization of thin
film will be briefly introduced. To take this course, students are required to
have some background on Materials Science (ESS2500 Introduction to Materials
Science or ESS 3510 and 3520 Physical metallurgy I,II) and on Thermodynamics of
Materials (ESS2510 or equivalent).
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Materials Science of Thin Films, Milton Ohring, Second Edition, Academic Press,
2002. Chapters 2-5, 6-7 and 9-10. You can use the third edition of this book,
but not necessary.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.Thin-Film Deposition- Principles and Practice
Donald L. Smith, McGraw-Hill, Inc. 1995.
2.Physical Vapor Deposition of Thin Films
John E. Mahan, John Wiley & Sons, Inc. 2000.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and Discussion
Lecture Notes will be handed out in the beginning of the semester. Homework
problems and announcement will be emailed into student personal email account.
Please check your email account constantly.Class reocrding will be available in
teaching Google drive.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Vacuum Science and Technology
2. Adsorption/Desorption of Molecules on Surface
3. Physical Vapor Deposition
4. Chemical Vapor Deposition
5. Film Formation and Structure
6. Characterization of Thin Films (brief introduction)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
There will be one midterm exams (35%) and one comprehensive final exam (45%).
Problem set will be given constantly (20%).

科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 461000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：真空技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Vacuum Technology and Surface Analysis
任課教師  Instructor ：林郁洧
上課時間  Time ： RaRbRc 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程⼤綱
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程主要探討真空技術的理論及真空元組件等，內容包括真空技術的基礎理論、各式真空幫
浦的介紹、各類真空元件及材料、真空系統的設計組裝、真空測漏，以及真空度量與檢校。真空技
術是現代科技的基⽯，從⺠⽣相關的食品包裝、眼鏡鍍膜、電視映像管，到⾼科技產業中的光電元
件與半導體製程、尖端的材料分析儀器，甚⾄龐⼤的同步輻射加速器，真空技術都扮演著重要的核
⼼⾓⾊。沒有真空技術就無法享受⾼品質的現代⽣活，也不⾜以從事⾼科技的研究。真空技術的進
步，不僅可精進儀器設備的性能，並能提升各種產業製程效能及產率，進⽽實現許多技術的創新。
因此，真空技術可說是未來科技產業及科學研究發展的重要基礎。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
真空技術與應⽤  --- 基礎篇  (Vacuum Technology & Application)
國家實驗研究院儀器科技研究中⼼出版
⼆、  參考書籍 (References)
[1] Vacuum Technology, L.G. Carpenter, ed. 1983, A Hilger
[2] Vacuum Technology, 2nd, rev. ed. A. Roth 1982, Elserier.
[3] 蘇清森，真空技術，東華書局。
[4] 呂登復，實⽤真空技術，國興出版社。
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
投影片教學、隨堂筆記
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
第⼀週  真空概論
第⼆週  氣體分⼦動⼒論
第三週  氣流與氣導
第四週  氣流與氣導
第五週  氣體的吸附和放出
第六週  氣體的吸附和放出
第七週  真空度量
第八週  真空度量
第九週  真空標準與校正
1st Mid-term Exam
第⼗週  真空幫浦
第⼗⼀週  真空幫浦
第⼗⼆週  真空流量計
第⼗三週  真空材料、元件與封合
第⼗四週  真空材料、元件與封合
第⼗五週  真空系統設計與裝配
第⼗六週  真空系統設計與裝配
第⼗七週  真空測試與測漏
第⼗八週  真空技術應⽤簡介
Final Exam
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework 20%
1st Mid-term Exam 30%
Final Exam 50%

科號  Course Number ： 11210ESS 500000學分  Credit ： 0 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：專題演講
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Colloquium
任課教師  Instructor ：陳馨怡
朱鵬維
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. 計分⽅式：
本學期演講共 12 次，⼼得報告繳交 12 次則於期末可獲得基本成績 A 。
【加分⽅式】每次與講者互動提問加總成績⼀級分，累計最⾼⾄ A+ 。
【⼼得報告繳交】
內容要求：每次⼼得報告⾄少 100 個字以上且與該次演講內容相符。若未達 100 字簡略的⼼得報告或
⼼得內容與該次演講內容不相符則扣總成績⼀級分，並須於助教通知後在截⽌期限內補交⼼得單否則
當週視為缺交⼼得單。
準時繳交⼼得單：最晚需於演講完隔⽇週四中午 12 點前上傳 PDF 電⼦檔⾄ eeclass
遲交⼼得單：
(1) 可遲交時間：演講隔⽇週四中午 12 點後⾄隔週四中午 12 點前，如 10/5 週三演講必須於 10/13 週
四中午 12 點前交⼼得單，否則即視為缺交⼼得單並不再接受該次⼼得單。
(2) 扣分機制：每次遲交將於期末每次扣⼀級分。如此在繳交 12 次⼼得報告⽽期末成績為基本分 A 的
情況下，遲交⾄第 5 次即可讓期末成績低於 B- ，請同學注意。 e. g., 12 reports → A – 4 late
reports → B- + 5 questions → A+
缺交⼼得單：
(1) 超過可遲交時間，即演講完隔週四中午 12 點後仍未繳交⼼得單則視為缺交⼼得單。
(2) 扣分機制：每次扣五級分，如此在期末成績為基本分 A 的情況下，缺交 1 次即可讓期末成績低於
B-，若無因提問加分將於期末不及格，請同學注意。
【不及格情況】
⼀次只能交⼀份⼼得報告，不可代交。如發現代寫⼼得情形，雙⽅學期成績零分，並送學務處以考試
作弊處置，沒有補救⽅法。
2. 請假規則：
每個專題演講皆會錄影並應需求在 eeclass 開放給同學觀看。
無法參加專題演講的同學可在提交假單後，使⽤ eeclass 平台於⼀週內觀看演講並於該演講後隔週四
中午 12點前繳交⼼得單⾄ eeclass ，若超過期限未繳交⼼得單則視為缺交⼼得單，每次扣五級分。
如2/23週三演講必須於 3/3 週四中午 12 點前交⼼得單否則視為缺交
請假單請⾃⾏在 eeclass 下載，填寫後給指導老師簽名確認⽽後寄交助教。分為：
(1) 單次「專題演講請假單」
適⽤事假、病假等。每次請假申請須於該次演講結束後隔⽇週四中午 12 點前提交，否則視為遲交⼼
得單每次扣期末成績⼀級分。單⼀學期⾄多可申請三次請假，之後若無正當理由每個超過次數扣期末
成績⼀級分。
(2)「⻑期無法實際出席專題演講申請單」
適⽤於預期單⼀學期將超過三次以上無法實際出席專題演講之學⽣，僅適⽤在職⽣、駐校外單位執⾏
研究之學⽣、因疫情無法入境之學⽣等。校內學⽣不適⽤。此申請單須於開學後兩周內提出申請，逾
期不受理。
3. Contact TAs for questions:
如有其他問題請聯絡助教：  ( 請依實際選課系所來連絡所屬助教 )
4. 以上內容若與實際上課公告不同，請以上課第⼀週公告之規則為依據。
5. ⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明：禁⽌使⽤
本課程授課教師認為不宜於此⾨課程當中使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧於課堂學習當中。本課程的⼼得單需由
同學親⾃撰寫。
根據本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取禁⽌使⽤，以
下為相關的監管機制：
修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧所產出的作業、報告或個⼈⼼得。若
經查核發現，教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
1. Grading Guide ：
There are 12 colloquium talks this semester. You need to submit 12 qualified
reports to get a basic final grade of A.
【 Bonus points 】 can be acquired through your on-site questions or critical
comments to the speaker → asking one question to the speaker deserves one bonus
grad point and can be accumulated up to A+.
【The submission of report form 】
Requirement: Each report needs to contain more than 100 words and be closely
related to the talk. A short or sketchy (<100 words) report or the content in
the reports is irrelevant to the talk, is regarded as a disqualified one, and
will result in a deduction in the final grade by one grade point. The student
should also resubmit a qualified report after receiving the notice from the TA
before the deadline; otherwise, the report is considered as a missed one that
causes a loss of five grade points at the end of the semester.
On-time submission: After the talk, the associated report form should be
uploaded to the eeclass platform (PDF file only) before noon (12 pm) of the next
day (Thursday). Any report submitted after the deadline is considered as a late
report.
Late report submission:
(1) Time for late submission: Starts from 12 pm of the next day after the talk
to the noon (12 pm) of next Thursday. e.g., for a talk on 10/5 (Wed), the report
submitted before the noon (12 pm) on 10/13 (next Thursday) is considered as a
late report.
(2) Deduction of grades: Late submission of the report causes a deduction in the
final grade by one grade point and so on. Therefore, (assuming you are in the
case of submitting 12 qualified reports and got the basic final grade of A),
five late report submissions can result in a final grade below B- without helps
from the bonus points. Please be aware to submit on time. e. g., 12 reports → A
– 4 late reports → B- + 5 questions → A+
Missed report:
(1) Report after the period of time defined for late submission will not be
accepted, e. g., for a talk on 10/5 (Wed), a missed report is defined as the
absence of report after the noon (12 pm) on 10/18 (next Thursday)
(2) Deduction of grades: a missing report causes the deduction by five grade
points in the final grade and so on. Therefore, one missed report can result in
a final grade below B- without helps from the bonus points.
【Fail condition 】
Each person can only submit one report at a time, and you cannot help other
students to submit their reports. If we found out there are cases of plagiarism,
the semester scores of both parties would be zero, and they will be sent to the
school affairs office to deal with the act of cheating in the exam, and there is
no remedy.
2. Leave Rules:
Every colloquium talk will be recorded and will be available on eeclass when
requested. Students who cannot attend the colloquium can submit their leave
form, then watch the video on eeclass, and submit the report form (PDF file
only) to eeclass before noon (12 pm) of next Thursday after the talk.
e.g., for a talk on 10/5 (Wed), the report with a leave request should be
submitted before the noon (12 pm) on 10/18; otherwise, a missed report causes
the deduction by five grade points in the final grade and so on. The leave form
can be downloaded from the eeclass platform. Please fill in the info and get it
signed by your advisor before you email it to the TA. There are two types of
leave forms:
(1) For single use: Leave Form
Applicable to personal leave, sick leave, etc. Each leave application form
should be handed to TA before noon (12 pm) of next day after the talk, or else
the report will be considered as a late submission. A maximum of three leave
applications are allowed for one semester. If your applications exceeded the
allowed chances without appropriate reason, each exceeded leave application will
result in a deduction in the final grade by one grade point.
(2) For long term use: Leave Form
Applicable to students who can’t attend the colloquium more than three times.
E.g. on-job students, students who are doing research outside the university for
a long-term period, students who cannot enter the country due to the pandemic,
etc. Students staying at NTHU cannot apply. This application form must be
submitted within two weeks after the start of the semester. Late application
will not be accepted.
3. Contact TAs for questions
If you have any other questions, please contact the TAs. (Please refer to your
enrolled department for the corresponding TAs.)
4. If there is any disagreement between this syllabus and the class
announcements, pleases refer to the rules announced in the class first week of
the semester.
5. Rules about generative AI: forbidden
Generative AI cannot be used in this course. The report form should be written
by the students without the aid of outside sources.
According to the rules announced by NTHU, generative AI is forbidden in this
course and is subjected to the following rules:
Students enrolled in the course cannot use generative AI to write the report
form. If any violation is identified, the report form will be rejected. Students
who enrolled in this course automatically agree these rules.

任課教師  Instructor ：陳馨怡

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This lecture is mainly designed for senior graduates who have their research
materials for practice writing and presentation
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
PPT, discussion, practice in class

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程⼤綱  Detailed Course Syllabus
● 課程說明 (Silicon Processing Technology for Microelectronics)
11009 微電⼦⼯程 (ULSI Technology) 課程
The advances in ultra-large-scale-integration (ULSI) technology based on
aggressive scaling of CMOS devices provide enormous opportunities for high-
performance communication, and computing systems. This course is designed to
provide the current status of advanced ULSI technology process and CMOS
integration projecting a road map for nanoelectronic devices for the current and
next generation. 先修課程 : 無
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1.教師⾃編的微電⼦⼯程  (ULSI Technology 500 pages) (Handout of related ULSI
Nanoelectronic devices SCI journal and conference papers)
2. Hong Xiao( 蕭宏 ) 原著「 Introduction to Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology 」
(第⼆版 )
● 參考書籍 (References)
1. 相關半導體製程與整合之教科書
2. IEEE, IEDM, VLSI, SCI journal papers
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
投影片教學  90%, 版書  10%
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chapter1: Unit Process Module ( 半導體單元製程 )
Chapter2: ULSI Process Integration ( 半導體製程整合 )
Chapter3: Semiconductor Device Material Analysis ( 半導體元件材料分析 )
Chapter4: ULSI Advanced Process ( 半導體先進製程 )
Chapter5: FinFET Process Integration for N14 ( 鰭式電晶體製程 )
Chapter6: N5/N3/N2/N1 technology research and development (N5 到 N1 製程研究與發展 )

中文名稱  Course Title ：計算熱流學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computational Fluid Dynamics and Heat Transfer
任課教師  Instructor ：林洸銓
上課時間  Time ： T8T9Ta 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  502 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces students to foundational as well as working knowledge
of Computational Fluid Dynamics and Heat Transfer. Topics include: finite
difference operators; Taylor and Fourier analysis; 1D & 2D boundary value
problems; simple iterative methods; advanced iterative methods; time
integration methods; matrix stability analysis and modified PDEs; non-linear
hyperbolic PDEs; upwind schemes for conservation laws; finite volume schemes.
The hands-on experience is offered in aspects of real-world problems that are
solved computationally by ANSYS FLUENT.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes will be offered.
● 參考書籍 (References)
An Introduction to Computational Fluid Dynamics: The Finite Volume Method, 2nd
edition, by H. Versteeg and W. Malalasekera, Pearson, 2007.
An Introduction to ANSYS Fluent 2020, John Matsson, SDC, 2020
An Introduction to Computational Fluid Mechanics by Example, by Sedat Biringen
and Chuen-Yen Chow, John Wiley & Sons, Inc, 2011
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures offered in English
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
The weekly breakdown of lectures is based on the topics described in the
course
descriptions.
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework assignments 35%
Midterm exam 30%
Final 35%
