中文名稱  Course Title ：運動管理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Fundamental of Sport Management
任課教師  Instructor ：黃煜
上課時間  Time ： T5T6 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ A409 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程⽬標：
(1) 認識運動管理學的演變與運動產業範疇暨現況
(2) 加強運動管理基礎學⾨之認識與瞭解
(3) 提升學⽣對於運動管理領域之學習意願
課程內容：
1. 現今運動的價值
2. 全球及台灣地區運動產業現況
3. 運動管理的範疇與演變
4. 運動的永續發展
5. 運動⾏銷
6. 運動賽會之管理
7. 運動場館之管理
8. ⼈⼒資源管理
9. 運動組織的規劃
10. 運動組織的組織
11. 運動組織的領導
12. 運動組織的控制
13. ⽣涯規劃
14. 實務經驗探討
教學⽅式：
1. 課堂講授
2. 分組作業
評量⽅式：
1. 上課參與 / 出席率  (20%): 積極參與上課期間的討論
2. 平常測驗  (10%): ⾄少安排⼆次以上的隨堂測驗
3. 課堂⼼得寫作 (10%) ：依據指定週數撰寫課堂⼼得
4. 期中測驗  (20%): 根據學校⾏事曆與課程進度進⾏書⾯測驗
5. 期末作業 (20%): 根據運動產業之調查撰寫企業運作個案報告
6. ⽣涯規劃報告 (20%) ：撰寫個⼈⽣涯規劃及學習計畫
參考書⽬：
程紹同等  (2017) 。運動管理學導論 (4nd ed) ，台北，華泰出版社。
陳鴻雁等 (2016) 。現代運動管理學。臺中，華格納出版社。
鄭志富等譯（ 2013 ）。運動管理學原理與實務，臺北，⽲楓出版社。 (Masteralexis, L.P.,Barr,
C. A.,Hums, M. A.,2012)

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Basketball (I)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
國立清華⼤學體育課程綱要
(112學年度第⼀學期 )
課程名稱：籃球⼀  科號組別： 11210-110600
授課教師：盧淑雲  聯絡電話： 0975337529
上課時間：星期三  13:20-15:10 E-mail ： shylu@mx.nthu.edu.tw
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程內容包括：基本動作及規則講解，了解籃球歷史文化，同時學會各種籃球技術在戰術戰
略上的運⽤，融入⽣活提升運動能⼒及⾝體素質，從中享受籃球樂趣，並養成規律運動的習慣。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.⾃⾏選取相關書籍作參考
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1.動作⽰範講解
2.分組練習
3.綜合應⽤
4.分組比賽
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. 09/13 籃球概論及重量訓練介紹、運動傷害防治
2. 09/20 運球  原地、⾏進、折返、繞環運球
3. 09/27 傳球  原地、⾏進、折返、繞環傳球
4. 10/04 投籃  定位投籃、轉⾝跑位、接應跳投
5. 10/11 五個⽅向運球上籃
6. 10/18 ⼆⼈組合、 inside screen 、 outside screen
7. 10/25 ⼆⼈組合、 pass and go 、 back door
8. 11/01 ⼆⼈組合、綜合練習 -3 對 3 半場
9. 11/08 期中測驗， inside screen 上籃 10 次
10. 11/15 三⼈組合、中樞策應外圍交叉上籃
11. 11/22 三⼈組合、傳球反⽅向擋⼈轉⾝接球上籃
12. 11/29 三⼈組合、傳球滑入接球上籃
13. 12/06 ⼆⼈快攻、接應交叉⻑傳上籃
14. 12/13 三⼈快攻、四⼈系統性快攻第⼆線接應跳投
15. 12/20 ⽅法戰、五⼈跑位
16. 12/27 簡要規則、分組比賽
17. 01/03 期末測驗：跑位定點跳投 10 次、繳交⼼得報告
18. 01/10 補⾏測驗
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1.出席率佔 50 ％
2.期中、期末 ( 技能評量 ) 佔 40 ％
3.平常成績、學習精神、學習態度、課於參與⾃我鍛鍊 ( ⼼得報告 ) 佔 10%
※缺席次數超過 3 次出席率予以 0 分計，請同學特別注意
事假⼀次扣 2 分、病假⼀次扣 1 分、遲到⼀次扣 0.5 分
傷假、防疫隔離假依校內請假規定辦理，不列入出缺席紀錄

科號  Course Number ： 11210KSS 200801學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：體操⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Gymnastics (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：張惟翔
上課時間  Time ： W3W4 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ 7501 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明
本課程主要教導學⽣體操地板、跳⾺之基本技術、器械與訓練環境安全評估、保護技術、教學⽅法
及評分原則。  課程中亦包括⼀般與體操專項素質訓練，因各項運動皆有屬於其特殊性之體能訓練⽅
式，所以此部分也會列入課程教學之中，以期能帶給學⽣在未來無論職場或任體育教學時最⼤的幫
助。
參考⽤書
1.Teaching basic gymnastics/Phyllis S. Cooper, Milan Trnka Macmillan College
Publishing Company 1994 ISBN:ISBN-13: 978-0023247
2.WAG Australia Routines - Level 1~3
教學⽅式
⼀、理論講述與討論 (30%)
(說明：  技術講解、⽰範 )
⼆、個案分析與作品賞析 (20%)
(說明：  動作分析、影片觀摩 )
三、⾏動實作與報告 (50%)
(說明：  實務操作 )
教學進度
⼀、體操專有名詞、規則與器材介紹
⼆、基本概念（延展、平衡、重⼼、位移、倒立）
三、地板輔助訓練。⼿倒立、頭⼿倒立、肩倒立
四、墊步、趨步練習。前翻系列：前滾、前滾跪姿、前滾分腿、各式跳躍、下肢平衡動作
五、後翻系列：後滾、後滾分腿、連續後滾
六、倒立前後分腿、側翻
七、跳板  ( ⾼跳接跳板彈起、助跑上板接⾼跳、騰空動作 )
八、地板整套複習、跳板複習
九、期中考
⼗、倒立前滾
⼗⼀、後滾推撐、後滾倒立
⼗⼆、⿂躍前滾
⼗三、側翻接前滾翻、跳板輔助練習
⼗四、跳板練習、跳板上接倒立前躺
⼗五、跳板接⿂躍、前滾分腿跳接⿂躍
⼗六、整套練習
⼗七、整套練習
⼗八、期末考
⼀、表現評量 (70%)
(說明：  期中、期末考試各佔  35%)
⼆、上課參與 (30%)
(遲到、早退、⾒習⼀次扣  3 分、請假⼀次扣  5 分、中途無故離席且未告知者直接給予不及格 )
特別注意事項：
1. 無故缺課達三次或請假達四次或缺課與請假加總達五次將不准予考試。
2. 請假需於上課前主動以  email 告知，緊急情況可⽤電話告知，但應於事後提出證明。不接受
任何課後補假。公假除外。
3. 本課程期中、期末考試以動作技術考核為主，原則上無法⽤報告取代，且沒有補考機制。
4. 為安全起⾒，課程中禁⽌嬉鬧，技術說明時若有疑慮請舉⼿發⾔切勿聊天，警告達兩次將請出
教室並以曠課論。
5. 若有影響上課安全、上課秩序或影響他⼈上課權益情事發⽣時，教師有權終⽌該⽣上課，還請
配合。
6. 若有需要，將以線上⽅式  ( 如： classroom, meet) 提供課程資料並發布每週作業，內容可能
與實體授課不同。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 參考書籍 (References)

講授、討論、互動
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
課程將分為四⼤單元：
1. 動作技能單元
　1)動作技能的界定
　2)動作技能成份分類　
　
2. 動作學習單元
　1)動作學習定義
　2)動作學習階段
　3)練習與休息
　4)理論與觀點
3. 動作表現單元
　1)動作表現分類
　2)動作表現測量　
　3)回饋分類特性
　4)回饋之應⽤
4. 動作控制單元
　1)感覺與動作控制
　2)神經動作控制　
　3)注意⼒與記憶⼒
課程內容依實際上課情況調整

科號  Course Number ： 11210KSS 300500學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 45
中文名稱  Course Title ：武術⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Wu-Shu (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：張惟翔
上課時間  Time ： T3T4 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ 7405 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明：
中華武術可分為競技與傳統兩⼤區塊，競技武術為亞運正式競技項⽬，可分為武藝套路及散打⼆⼤
項，武藝套路雖以演練為主，但若仔細探究將不難看出其內容包含豐富攻防技法，若將各個動作進
⾏提取、拆解訓練，同時強化技法所需之⾝體能⼒並融入運動科學訓練知能，對於現代格鬥運動實
踐將有極⼤幫助。本課程從介紹各種武術活動開始，逐步帶領學⽣進⾏功法與技法練習，以套路為
載體，探討武術上的各種肢體訓練，提升⾝體覺察與防衛意識。
教學⽅式：
⼀、理論講述與討論 (30%)
(說明：  技術講解  )
⼆、個案分析與作品賞析 (20%)
三、⾏動實作與報告 (50%)
教學進度：
⼀、課程與各種武術活動介紹
⼆、器械⽅法與運⽤原則  ( ⼀ )
三、器械⽅法與運⽤原則  ( ⼆ )
四、護⾝倒法、滾翻移動
五、初級⼑術
六、初級⼑術
七、初級⼑術
八、初級⼑術
九、期中考  ( 器械基本操作、⼑術分段 )
⼗、格鬥運動賞析  ( 學科教室 )
⼗⼀、五步拳、基本功介紹
⼗⼆、復興拳第⼀、⼆、⼗三、⼗四式功法與技法應⽤
⼗三、復興拳第三、四、⼗五、⼗六式功法與技法應⽤
⼗四、復興拳第五、六、⼗七、⼗八式功法與技法應⽤
⼗五、復興拳第七、八、⼗九、⼆⼗式功法與技法應⽤
⼗六、復興拳第九、⼗、⼆⼀、⼆⼆式功法與技法應⽤
⼗七、復興拳第⼗⼀、⼗⼆、⼆三、⼆四式功法與技法應⽤
⼗八、期末考  ( 復興拳單操、對練 )
成績考核：
⼀、表現評量 (70%)
(說明：  期中、期末考試各佔  35% ）
⼆、上課參與 (20%)
(遲到、早退、⾒習⼀次扣  3 分，請假⼀次扣  5 分、中途無故離席且未告知者直接給予不及格 )
三、觀賽作業（ 10% ，每次  5% ）
(說明：  各項武術賽事參與 )
特別注意事項：
1. 無故缺課達三次或請假達四次或缺課與請假加總達五次將不准予考試。
2. 請假需於上課前主動以  email 告知，緊急情況可⽤電話告知，但應於事後提出證明。不接受
任何課後補假。公假除外。
3. 本課程期中、期末考試以動作技術考核為主，原則上無法⽤報告取代
4. 為安全起⾒，課程中禁⽌嬉鬧，技術說明時若有疑慮請舉⼿發⾔切勿聊天，警告達兩次將請出
教室並以曠課論。
5. 若有影響上課安全、上課秩序或影響他⼈上課權益情事發⽣時，教師有權終⽌該⽣上課，還請
配合。
6. 若有遠距教學需要，請同學務必配合加入規定社群或線上教室（如  meet ），並完成指定之作業
（含上傳）。線上課程視為正課，出缺席比照規定辦理。

科號  Course Number ： 11210KSS 360000學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：應⽤運動⼼理學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applied Sports Psychology
任課教師  Instructor ：⾼三福
上課時間  Time ： T3T4 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ A413 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程內容：
本課程是必修課程運動⼼理學的進階課程，課程是以⼼理學知識為基礎應⽤⾄運動情境，課程著重在
討
論、應⽤與操作。希望建立同學對應⽤運動⼼理學知識的瞭解，並能應⽤在運動情境。沒有上過運動
⼼
理學的同學，不要修本課程。本課程作業量重，修本課程的同學，需有⼼理準備。
上課⽤書：
⼀、競技與健⾝運動⼼理學。⽲楓書局。
評分⽅式：
1.訪談稿作業 2 次（ 25 ％ *2 ， 50% ）。
2.靜坐考試 2 次（ 15%*2 ， 30% ）。
3.期末考 15%
4.隨堂⼩考  5% 。
6.出缺席 5% 。
上課⽅式：
⼀、本課程重視討論與分享，⿎勵同學發表意⾒、看法或評論。每⼀次上課老師會記錄哪些⼈參與討
論，以此作為課堂⽰範及討論的評分。
⼆、個⼈訪談稿作業⼆次：
1.根據上課規定找受訪者（不可以是本班修課同學）做訪談。訪談時間⼆⼗⾄三⼗分鐘，訪談需
錄⾳並謄成逐字稿。
2.報告必須使⽤標準國語，正確使⽤標點符號，格式必須正確（格式⾒附錄）。格式極嚴重錯誤扣 20
分，嚴重錯誤扣 10 分，錯誤扣五分。作業需準時繳交，遲交⼀天扣 10 分。
3.每次訪談逐字稿，需超過 A4 五⾴以上。
4.嚴禁拿他⼈作業檔案修改（例如只修改文字語句），或拷⾙他⼈作業做為個⼈作業，違者（提供者
與
繳交者）屬重⼤作弊，無法拿到本課程學分。
三、運動個案⼼理服務練習
1.在期中考後，同學⾃尋的個案進⾏四週的運動⼼理服務練習，將上課的⼼理技能訓練（覺醒調
整、意象、⾃信⼼、⽬標設定及專注、畫圖法、動機氣候、儀式動作）  應⽤到實習個案。
2.學期末同學在課堂上進⾏⼝頭報告。

⼀、除非老師同意，嚴禁使⽤ 3C ⽤品。違者每次以無故缺席⼀次計算，達⼆次無法得到本課程學分。

於
下⼀次上課向老師說明。病假（含⽣理假）或臨時無法到課的次數，是出缺席的評分來源。
三、上課遲到進入教室或中途離開，需徵得老師同意。
四、無法遵守以上規定的同學，請勿選修本課程。

課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程以五項體適能要素為架構－⼼肺耐⼒、肌⾁適能、⾝體組成、柔軟度與平衡。內容包含實地
與實驗室的評估與測驗⽅式，以及促進各項體適能要素的處⽅指引。透過獨特的廣度與深度，探討評
估體適能與設計個別化運動計畫，確實地銜接研究與實務之間的落差。

科號  Course Number ： 11210KSS 600500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：動作發展專題研究
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Research topic on motor development
任課教師  Instructor ：曾鈺婷
上課時間  Time ： W3W4Wn 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ A310 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 (Course Description)
Our focus is on the use of perceptual/sensory information for the control of
movements
across the life span. We will discuss the behavioral and neurological research
examining the role of different sensory modalities (e.g., somatosensory,
visual information) in motor functions and skills during the development. We
will also examine research relating to the effect of physical intervention
(e.g., motor skills, sports, physical activity) on physiological and
psychological changes in typically and atypically developing children as well
as younger
and older adults.
參考書籍 (References)
Selected journals will be handed out in class or distributed via email
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture, discussion, laboratory
教學進度 (Syllabus)
The course includes the following topics:
- Definitions of motor development; growth and maturation; the motor milestone
- Theoretical perceptive of motor development
- Development of fundamental motor skills (e.g., object control skills,
locomotion skills, ballistic skills)
- Relationship between somatosensory function on motor skills in typically,
atypically developing children, younger and older adults
- Characteristics of sensory and motor functions in atypically developing
children (e.g., developmental coordination disorder)
- Assessments and examinations of motor skill performances
- Effect of movement intervention (e.g., motor skills, musical instruments,
sports, physical activity) on physical, physiological or psychological changes
(from behavioral and neurological perspectives) across the life span
成績考核 (Evaluation)
Participation/Professionalism: 40%
In-class presentation: 30%
Final project: 30%

本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤
-----

劉先翔

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程⼤綱 Detailed Course Syllabus
● 課程說明 (Course Description)：本課程為跨領域知識體系，基於運動產業相關⾼度的需求，
結合運動、電機、⼯程及其他跨領域師資，利⽤清華在理⼯背景的堅強實⼒，希望提供學⽣對於運動
科
技創新產業的認識，積極培育跨領域運動科技⼈才，將運動科學研究提升到運動科技，對運動科技產
業
⼈才提供前瞻性的背景⽀持
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books) ：無（本課程屬於跨領域課程，⽬前無相關書籍）
● 參考書籍 (References) ：
運動相關期刊、資、通訊相關期刊
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method) ：
1.運科知識的傳授與文獻討論 : 現今運動科技研究知識的介紹與探討
2.網路討論：資料不懂或過去經驗無法理解之處，可以透過網路學習平台，將困難點提出與同學或老
師
進⾏互動。
3.上課討論 : 課程中會針對運動科技等進⾏問題討論、經驗分享、策略反思以及同學與老師的意⾒分
享。透過討論的⽅式，可以提升學⽣表達與思辨能⼒外，也能試著學習解決實務設計問題與因應問題
的
技巧，並進⾏反思。藉由授課教師的回饋，亦能從中獲得⿎勵，建立良善互動關係。
4.上課報告 : 請同學進⾏相關研究報告。
● 教學進度 (Syllabus) ：
1.課程簡介以及運動科技趨勢
2.⼈體運動技術分析介紹
3.運動效能量測⽅法
4.運動效能量測⽅法相關文獻探討
5.穿戴式感測器原理
6.感測器運動資料收集及驗證
7.感測器運動資料相關文獻探討
8.運動⽣理感測及分析
9.運動⽣理感測及分析相關文獻探討
10.影像感測原理及分析
11.影像感測原理及分析相關文獻探討
12.⼈⼯智慧應⽤於運動效能分析
13.⼈⼯智慧應⽤於運動效能分析相關文獻探討
14.運動數據⾃動標記技術
15.運動數據⾃動標記技術相關文獻探討
16. AR/VR 於運動科技之應⽤
17. AR/VR 於運動科技之應⽤相關文獻探討
18.智慧場館

評
量的⼀部分。。
3.上課參與態度及出席狀況（ 15 ％）：評量學⽣在上課表現出積極學習態度，上課發表、報告狀況以
及
出席率，作為「情意」評量的⼀部分。

as younger
and older adults.
參考書籍 (References)
Selected journals will be handed out in class or distributed via email
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture, discussion, laboratory
教學進度 (Syllabus)
The course includes the following topics:
- Definitions of motor development; growth and maturation; the motor milestone
- Theoretical perceptive of motor development
- Development of fundamental motor skills (e.g., object control skills,
locomotion skills, ballistic skills)
- Relationship between somatosensory function on motor skills in typically,
atypically developing children, younger and older adults
- Characteristics of sensory and motor functions in atypically developing
children (e.g., developmental coordination disorder)
- Assessments and examinations of motor skill performances
- Effect of movement intervention (e.g., motor skills, musical instruments,
sports, physical activity) on physical, physiological or psychological changes
(from behavioral and neurological perspectives) across the life span
成績考核 (Evaluation)
Participation/Professionalism: 40%
In-class presentation: 30%
Final project: 30%

科號  Course Number ： 11210KTLT111100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：台灣閩南語概論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction of Taiwan Southern Min
任課教師  Instructor ：劉秀雪  HSIU-HSUEH LIU
上課時間  Time ： R5R6R7 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ 9426 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
學⽣使⽤  AI 的規則  (2) 有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出
課程說明
本課程主要是針對台灣閩南語 ( 台語 ) 各個語法層⾯的介紹，包括閩南語的歷史背景、語⾳、構詞、以
及語
法、語⽤等。就台語的歷史背景⽅⾯，將述及閩⽅⾔與閩南語的形成，現今台語次⽅⾔的異同與分
布。語
⾳⽅⾯，討論語料的收集記⾳、⾳節結構與書寫形式。除了構詞句法的整體介紹，構詞部分進⼀步討
論包
含⼩稱、重疊等構詞⽅式，句法部分討論台語的連讀變調與句法結構的關係、情態詞、否定詞、疑問
詞組
以及有字句的使⽤。語⽤部分則探討台灣地區的語⾔接觸現象，主要將針對台灣國語與台灣閩南語的
互動
分析。
參考書籍
台灣話⾳韻入⾨。洪惟仁， 1996 ，國立復興劇藝實驗學校出版
台灣閩南語論文集。曹逢甫、蔡美慧編， 1995. 文鶴出版社。
台灣⽅⾔之旅。洪惟仁著， 1992. 前衛出版社。
台語、華語的結構與動向 (I-IV) 。鄭良偉編著， 1997. 遠流出版社。
台灣閩南語語法稿。楊秀芳， 1991 ，⼤安出版社
張振興， 1985 ，〈閩語的分區 ( 稿 ) 〉，《⽅⾔》，第三期 171-180 ⾴
───， 1993 ，《台灣閩南⽅⾔記略》，文史哲出版社，台北
陳章太＆李如龍， 1991 ，《閩語研究》，北京：語文出版社
鍾榮富  2002, 台語的語⾳基礎，文鶴

盧廣誠 (2003) 《台灣閩南語概要》南天出版社  初版 1 刷  台北
教學⽅式
本課程主要是以逐步講授閩南語各個語法層⾯的⽅式進⾏，並且討論各個層⾯與台灣國語間的互動關
係。
課堂均會預留時間給同學進⾏相關練習與討論；希望能藉此將課堂上所學習的材料與⽇常⽣活語料相
互印
證，從⽽增進對閩南背景了解，以及對閩南語的認識。此外，我們也會學習語⾔調查的訪談和紀錄技
巧，
並請同學在學期中，實際規劃、進⾏⼀項閩南語語法的⽥野觀察調查筆記。
課程進度
1. 課程介紹 / ⾃我介紹。
2. 閩南語的歷史背景與次⽅⾔分布
3. 閩南語的⾳節結構與聲調。
4. 閩南語標⾳介紹與練習。
5. 閩南語與國語的⾳系對應  ( ⼩考 I)
6. 語料的收集、記⾳與書寫形式。
7. 閩南語的構詞
8. 閩南語的句法
9. 連讀變調與句法、⾳韻結構。
10. 閩南語和國語的語法轉換  ( ⼩考 II)
11. 閩南語構詞與詞組：指⽰代詞、⼩稱、重疊。
12. 期中⽥調紀錄討論
13. 閩南語的特殊句型介紹、有字句。 KA/HOO 以及其他
14. 閩南語的疑問詞和疑問句、否定詞、情態詞。
15. 語⾔接觸與外來詞 ( ⼩考 III)
16. 期末課堂報告

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本課程聚焦於臺灣閩南文化的認識，「語⾔是文化的基礎，⼜是文化的結晶」，因此從語⾔出發，接
續
分別介紹各文化特⾊，包括地名、⽣命禮俗、歲時節慶、⺠間信仰、歌曲、文學、建築等，以臺灣本
地
的文化特徵為主要內容，必要時對比閩南原鄉的異同。從各⾯向概略性地了解臺灣閩南文化的風貌。
⼆、指定⽤書  無
三、參考書籍
何綿⼭，《閩文化概論》，北京：北京⼤學出版社， 1996 年
施懿琳等， 2013 ，臺閩文化概論。五南出版社。
洪惟仁， 1986, 09. 《台灣禮俗語典》，台北：⾃立晚報
洪惟仁， 1993, 03. 《台灣哲諺典》《台語文摘》專刊第 5 期。
陳耕等，《閩南⺠系與文化》，⾦⾨：⾦⾨縣文化局， 2006 年。
黃秀政、張勝彥、吳文星， 2005 ，《臺灣史》，臺北：五南出版
陳嘉琳， 2011 ，台灣文化概論 (2 版 ) ，新文京出版社。
四、教學⽅式
視情況有的週次會進⾏線上同步課。上課時由教師於課堂上介紹各週主題的閩南語發⾳、漢字以及詞
彙
意義，學⽣參與討論。期中作業為學⽣錄製臺灣歷史⼈物朗讀文章：〈和仔先〉、〈文化頭〉、〈八
⽥--sáng〉、〈切膚之愛〉，四篇選⼀篇上傳。期末為個⼈進⾏某項文化主題的⼝頭加 ppt 簡報，必須
有實際相片或影片的記錄，重要詞彙需以閩南語漢字書寫並加上臺羅標⾳，⼝頭報告語⾔為閩南語，
時
間25分鐘，並繳交書⾯報。
五、教學進度
1. 課程簡介、閩南語的分佈
2. 語⾔層積
3. 中秋節停課⼀次
4. 地號名
5. 盤喙錦、唸謠、臺語詩
6. 臺語經典歌曲
7. 性命禮俗
8. 臺灣歷史⼈物 - 朗讀文章
9. 漢文詩詞
10. 戲文、褒歌、歌仔簿 ( 冊 )
11. 傳統建築文化
12. ⽩話字文獻
13. 期末報告
14. 期末報告
15. 期末報告
16. 期末報告

⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明：禁⽌使⽤
經仔細考量後，本課程授課教師認為不宜於此⾨課程當中使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧於課堂學習當中。因本
課
程的內容於⽣成式 AI 中尚有諸多錯誤，且容易影響學⽣對基礎核⼼知識之判讀。
根據本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取禁⽌使⽤，以下
為
相關的監管機制
修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧所產出的作業、報告或個⼈⼼得。若
經
查核發現，教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

由論文素質，研究態度決定。

⼀、課程說明  本課程主要在培養語⾔教學的論文寫作能⼒，課程內容包含研究論文各部份，如
摘
要、前⾔、文獻回顧、研究⽅法、研究結果與討論，以及結論與建議的寫作要領介紹與實際練習。
具體學習⽬標 :
1. 能熟悉論文寫作之基本格式。
2. 能掌握論文結構及寫作要領。
3. 能運⽤論文寫作之相關⼯具。
4. 能撰寫⼀份結構完整的論文計畫。

課程說明
本課程介紹社會語⾔學的基本概念和研究⽅法，包含進⾏中的語⾔演變如何觀察、社會網絡分析法、
語⾔變異與各類
分層因素的互動等，學⽣可以藉此觀察分析本⼟的各類語⾔現象，且能轉⽽將其概念與⽅法運⽤於語
⾔教學與語⾔研
究之中。
教學⽬標：
1） 能了解社會語⾔學的基本概念和⽅法；
2） 並以之觀察分析本⼟的社會語⾔現象；
3） 且能將其概念與⽅法實際運⽤於語⾔研究與教學。

Limited.
c) Sociolinguistics: Method and Interpretation, Lesley Milroy,Matthew Gordon May 2008, Wiley-Blackwell

參考書⽬：
Overview

⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明  「有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告」
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據
本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，請註
明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告，說明如下
學⽣可於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議
題發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。然⽽，在本課程的「個⼈反思報告」、「⼩組採訪作
業」中，學⽣不得使⽤⽣成式 AI ⼯具撰寫作業。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學
校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
科號  Course Number ： 11210KTLT711000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：臺灣文學語⾔專題研討
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Studies on Taiwan Literary Language
任課教師  Instructor ：鄭縈
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ 9426 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  語⾔研究不侷限於⼝頭語⾔，書⾯語⾔、尤其是文學語⾔，其研究課題和領域更
為寬闊⽽重要。本課程從語⾔分析和語⾔美感的相關性著眼，以台灣文學作品為對象，帶領學⽣從語
⾔的各個層⾯，包括認知理論、語⾔風格及資訊科技等，探討其⾳韻、作品形式、⾳韻、詞彙、語
義、語法等特點，並經由討論來協助學⽣欣賞文學中的「語⾔美」及提升其研究⼒，並應⽤於教學。
關鍵詞 : 台灣文學作品、語⾔分析、認知理論、語⾔風格、資訊科技；
Taiwanese, literature, linguistic analysis, cognitive theory, linguistic
style,
technology

科號  Course Number ： 11210KTLT722800學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：語文領域數位⼯具研發
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Development of ICT in Language Teaching
任課教師  Instructor ：呂菁菁
林書宇
上課時間  Time ： M8M9Ma 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ 9426 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
數位學習⾃全球進入網路時代以來，都是改變教育的重要⼀環。 2023 年全球進入後疫情時代， Covid-
19迫使全球進⾏⼀場「線上學習社會實驗」。也因此更凸顯數位學習教材研發與評鑑的重要性。數位
學習
與是現今教育的趨勢，未來疫情過後將成為常態，⾯對如此變⾰，不論老師或學⽣都必須調整步伐，
針對
不同世代的數位學習教材，亦需要與時並進，進⾏不同的教材研發與成效評鑑設計。語⾔教學更是需
要更
多的⼼思，教材研發需符合在地化、線上學習更要強調互動性，並且能夠進⾏評鑑，持續精進。數位
學習
教材研發與評鑑，全球正因應⽣成式⼈⼯智慧（ Generative AI ，簡稱⽣成式  AI ，如 ChaGPT ），⽽出現
⼀些改變浪潮。本課程將探討如何利⽤善加利⽤現代科技⽣成式  AI ⼯具（例如：  ChatGPT ）於教材
研
發、評鑑；特別是數位學習之評鑑，將成為重要的⼀環，如何透過數位科技進⾏評鑑科學化、輔助化
等，
將會是本課程重點。
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Dolgui, Bernard, A., Lemoine, D., von Cieminski, G., & Romero, D. (2021). Anatomy of
a
Digital Assistant. In Advances in Production Management Systems. Artificial

中文名稱  Course Title ：從腦電波研究認識多語處理的多⾯向
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Exploring Multilingual Processing through ERP Studies
任課教師  Instructor ：呂菁菁

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
在現今的全球化環境下，多語⾔處理已經成為了⼀個重要的領域。這⾨新課程將為本所的研究⽣介紹
⼀個
可⽤來探索和掌握多語⾔處理的技術，包括多語使⽤者如何受第⼀語⾔以外的語⾔熟練程度的調節、
語碼
轉換經驗對理解難度的影響、多語學習過程中對第⼀語⾔處理產⽣的變化等不同⾯向，並深入討論多
語⾔
處理中的⼀些常⾒問題和挑戰，以及事件相關腦電位技術在多語⾔處理⽅⾯的應⽤。
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
(1) 講解研究設計
(2) 引導學⽣思考研究結果的啟⽰
(3) 實作
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1:
The electrophysiology of the bilingual brain
Week 2:
Complex brain network properties in late L2 learners and native speakers
Week 3:
Event related potential study of language interaction in bilingual aphasia patients
Week 4:
Neural correlates of retrieval practice on the learning and memory retention of L3
French vocabulary
Week 5:
Electrophysiology reflects the influence of discourse context on auditory semantic
processing in bilinguals.
Week 6:
Bilingual experience shapes language processing: Evidence from codeswitching
Week 7:
From the field to the lab: A converging methods approach to the study of
codeswitching
Week 8:
Native language change during early stages of second language learning
Week 9:
Prolonged L2 immersion engenders little change in morphosyntactic processing of
bilingual natives
Week 10:
When late second language learners access the meaning of L2 words: Using ERPs to
investigate the role of the L1 translation equivalent
Week 11:
You win some, you lose some: Comprehension and event-related potential evidence for
L1 attrition
Week 12:
Arithmetic in the Bilingual Brain
Week 13:
Are All Code-Switches Processed Alike? Examining Semantic v. Language Unexpectancy
Week 14:
Methods in bilingual reading comprehension research
Week 15:
Phonological activation in Korean word recognition between Korean native speakers
and Japanese-Korean and Chinese-Korean bilingual speakers: Evidence from event-
related potentials
Week 16:
ERP indices of vowel processing in Spanish-English bilinguals

⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明  「有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告」
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據
本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，請註
明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告，說明如下
學⽣可於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議
題發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。然⽽，在本課程的「個⼈反思報告」、「⼩組採訪作業」
中，學⽣不得使⽤⽣成式 AI ⼯具撰寫作業。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或
相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

科號  Course Number ：
11210KWEN500200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：知識理論與學習
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Theory of Knowledge and Learning
任課教師  Instructor ：成虹⾶
上課時間  Time ： S2S3S4 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ N413 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
知識理論與學習
清華⼤學華德福碩專班 2023/7
成虹⾶  hornfaycherng@gmail.com
本課程旨在介紹華德福教育學賴以建立的知識理論，包含歌德的知識觀與 Rudolf Steiner 加以引申發
揮的⼈智學知識理論及⽅法。此外，本課程也探討如何將此知識⽅法應⽤於教學與⾏動探究，並反省
其
時代意義。
教學⽬標：本課程期待學⽣獲得以下的能⼒與素養，包含
⼀、  對於歌德與⼈智學知識理論的理解。
⼆、  能將此知識理論靈活運⽤於課程與教學活動中。
三、  能將此知識⽅法運⽤於⾃我教育與終⾝學習。
四、  能將此知識理論與⽅法運⽤於教育研究中，並與主流學術對話。
教學⽅法：
⼀、  講授式
⼆、  ⼩組討論
三、  植物觀察
四、  團體對話
評量⽅式：
⼀、  反省札記 (30%) ：暑期上課期間每⽇撰寫⼀⾴省思札記。
⼆、  課堂參與 (30%) ：準時出席，主動提問與積極分享，互助合作。
三、  期末報告 (40%) ：⼗⼀⽉底前，按 APA 格式，完成 10000 字期末報告。報告主題將於暑期結束
前確認。
主題 :
1.我的知識觀？ ( 成虹⾶， 2014)
2.歌德的知識觀  (Seamon & Zajonc, 1998)
3.我如何認識世界（ Steiner, 2022/1894 ）
4.我如何認識你（ Seydel, 2015/2009 ）
5.教學的邏輯（ Steiner, 2015/1919 ）
6.Ｕ理論（ Scharmer, 2019/2017 ）

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Project Learning (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：成虹⾶
謝⼩芩

上課時間  Time ： SaSbSc 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ N414 ／ 48
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Rationale:
This course is intended to enable the students to become independent researchers
in their field of practice. Namely, the aims of the course are primarily
concerned with developing practitioners as researchers in the broadest sense.  The
students will be exposed to a variety of inquiry approaches. It is expected
that the students as educational practitioners will be able to inquire into the
genuine problems in their situation with appropriate research approach in order to
transform themselves and their practices.
objectives:
After finishing this course, students are expected to acquire the ability of
Establishing a research question relevant to their practices,
Identifying suitable research approaches,
reframing and transforming ways of action,
and structuring a thesis.
Teaching methods:
1. Lectures
2. Group activities
3. Individual project
Evaluation:
Participation (30%)
Group work (30%)
Final paper and presentation (40%)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This two-credit class is designed for high-intermediate students to learn
and acquire essential skills to communicate effectively in a wide range of
English settings. Upon completion of this course, students are expected to
acquire (1) the ability to capture main ideas, read for details, and make
inferences to comprehend a text more deeply; (2)the ability to read between
lines and guess meanings of unfamiliar words from context ; (3) the ability
to understand English idioms and expressions used in a variety of
settings; (4) the ability to use grammar correctly; (5) the ability to
express ideas and opinions fluently and effectively.
Text Books:

Requirements & Rules:
1. Class attendance, lesson preparation and active class participation are
required.
a. The instructor takes attendance almost every class throughout the
semester. If you are all present whenever the instructor takes the roll, you will
get 80 (i.e. the primitive score) in this category (i.e. Class attendance).
b. If you are absent from a class meeting, 10 points will be deducted from
this primitive score.
c. If you are absent in case of uncontrollable situations (e.g. illness,
emergency, important occasions, etc.), please email the instructor as you decide
to take a leave and give the instructor the valid proof WITHIN TWO WEEKS. A
receipt or a medicine prescription with correct stamp of date by accredited
hospitals can be seen as a valid proof.
d. Being late for more than 10 minutes is treated as absence from that hour
(5 points will be deducted).
e. If you are absent for more than 8 hours, you will definitely be flunked.
2. Absence from a class is no excuse for submitting assignments in time or
ignoring assignments or the class you have missed. It is your responsibility to
ask your classmates or the instructor what has been covered in the class.
3. Plagiarism on assignments and cheating on the exam is absolutely
unacceptable. If someone is found plagiarizing or cheating, it means he/she will
get a zero point for that assignment or exam.
4. There will be NO make-up exams or presentations unless you notify the
instructor valid and official reasons for your absence beforehand. If a group
presentation is “crippled” due to your lateness or absence, you will receive no
grade on the presentation.
5. Assignments are expected to be completed and submitted by due date. No
late submission will be accepted or graded unless the instructor approves your
application of late submission.
NO full credit for late submission/Penalty for late submission: 10% of the total
mark awarded will be deducted for each working day after the submission date.
Late Submission Mark Awarded After Penalty
Number of days late Penalty Original grade 90 Original grade 60
1 10% 81 54
2 20% 72 48
3 30% 63 42
4 40% 54 36
5 50% 45 30
More than 5 days Not completed and grade of zero awarded
6. Penalty for no or poor participation in group work
Students are expected to take part in various group work activities. Failure to
engage with these activities may lead to reductions in grades awarded. Sometimes
the reduction may be suggested by other group members, in other circumstances the
academic in charge may reduce the grade awarded without reference to other group
members.
7. Mobile devices are only used for educational purposes relevant to the
subject or tasks in the classroom setting with the permission of or at the request
of the instructor.
During class students are not to be seen with a cell phone in hand. Mobile phones
are expected to be turned off or switched to a silent mode. The syllabus,
handouts, returned assignments should be kept at least to the end of this semester
for later reference or the final exam.
8. In this class, AI-assisted reports and assignments are allowed in limited
instances: AI can be used to prepare for reports and assignments by brainstorming,
but students must show how it helped them reach the result. AI is not allowed to
be used in generating personal and group presentation content.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
COURSE GOALS & Description:
2學分英語語文課程，主要⽬的為訓練學⽣參與進階主題式英語溝通與表達，強化學⽣知識學習的批
判思考、組織表達的整合能⼒，⿎勵與引導學⽣發現問題、尋求解決⽅法，以英語提問並表達意⾒
的能⼒，奠定並厚實同學⽇後獨立學習英文的基礎。
This is a two-semester, twoX2 credits course designed for intermediate to
high-intermediate English language proficiency level learners. The academic goal
is to cultivate learners’ communication skills focusing on listening and
speaking proficiencies. Theme-based texts allow learners to extend and
utilize learners’ existing knowledge while exploring new contexts and skills.
This course specifically targets on guiding learners to practice using critical
thinking approaches while exploring various thematic units designed for
classroom and further studies. Communication, comprehension, and critical
thinking are the three prime concerns in this class.
The class welcomes individual learning performance as well as community
approach learning. Learners will be assessed based on their individual, pair-
up, and study groups’ team performances. This is a tentative schedule; it is
subject to change when necessary.

中文名稱  Course Title ：初級英文⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Elementary English I

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Subsidiary Aim
This course is the first half of a year-long required course on English basic skills. This semester, students
will be accomplish a variety of tasks. Except for listening to the conversations and reading their
scripts, role-play is also covered. As we move along, students can give their own renditions of the
conversations in the textbook for the oral presentation.
Corresponding CEFR Can-do statements
1. Can understand the main points of clear standard speech on familiar matters regularly encountered in
work, school, leisure etc., including short narratives.
2. Can give a simple description or presentation of people, living or working conditions, daily routines.
likes/dislikes etc. as a short series of simple phrases and sentences linked into a list.
3. Can understand short, simple texts on familiar matters of a concrete type which consist of high
frequency everyday or job-related language.
4. Can write a series of simple phrases and sentences linked with simple connectors like “and", “but”
and “because”.
5. Can interact with reasonable ease in structured situations and short conversations, provided the other
person helps if necessary. Can manage simple, routine exchanges without undue effort; can ask and
answer questions and exchange ideas and information on familiar topics in predictable everyday situations.
Teaching materials and References
Beatty, Ken, Series Consultant (2019). StartUp 4. Pearson Education.
ISBN: 978-0-13-468417-8
CEFR Scale: A2+; B1

Requirements & Rules
YOU CAN EXPECT ME TO:
1. Plan the course and change the plan if it's necessary.
2. Give you both written and oral feedback. I take the assignments in this class seriously, and I believe that
giving feedback a top priority.
3. Bring my expertise into the classroom. For example, many years of my study, professional experience
(well, I work as a translator), and stories from real life. I believe that we can learn through stories. (You,
too, are encouraged to bring stories to class to stimulate discussion.)
4. Regard struggling with ideas as a process of learning.
5. Be open about different ideas.
6. Treat you with respect since you are adult learners.
HERE IS WHAT I EXPECT FROM YOU:
1. Class attendance, lesson preparation and active class participation are required. If you are absent for
more than 6 hours with no valid excuses, you will fail this course.
2. Absence from a class is NO excuse for not knowing the assignment and what has been discussed in that
class. It is YOUR responsibility to ask your fellow classmates what has been covered and what will be
doing in the class.
Effort to make this class your own. Always ask yourself: What will I do to promote my learning?
3. Plagiarism and cheating on the exam is absolutely not acceptable. If someone is found plagiarizing or
cheating on an exam, it means he/she will get a zero point for that exam. If you have any questions
regarding the expectations for a specific assignment or exam, please do not hesitate to ask.
4. Honesty. I will ask you many questions throughout the semester. “I don’t know,” “I need to think about it
for a while,” or “I need to pass on that question” are acceptable answers.
5. There will be NO make-up exams/presentations unless valid and official reasons for absence are
presented beforehand.
6. The handouts given in the class should be kept at least till the end of the semester for later reference or
final exam.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Subsidiary Aim
This course is the first half of a year-long required course on English basic
skills. This semester, students
will be accomplish a variety of tasks. Except for listening to the conversations
and reading their
scripts, role-play is also covered. As we move along, students can give their
own renditions of the
conversations in the textbook for the oral presentation.
Corresponding CEFR Can-do statements
1. Can understand the main points of clear standard speech on familiar matters
regularly encountered in
work, school, leisure etc., including short narratives.
2. Can give a simple description or presentation of people, living or working
conditions, daily routines.
likes/dislikes etc. as a short series of simple phrases and sentences linked
into a list.
3. Can understand short, simple texts on familiar matters of a concrete type which
consist of high
frequency everyday or job-related language.
4. Can write a series of simple phrases and sentences linked with simple
connectors like “and", “but”
and “because”.
5. Can interact with reasonable ease in structured situations and short
conversations, provided the other
person helps if necessary. Can manage simple, routine exchanges without undue
effort; can ask and
answer questions and exchange ideas and information on familiar topics in
predictable everyday situations.
Teaching materials and References
Beatty, Ken, Series Consultant (2019). StartUp 4. Pearson Education.
ISBN: 978-0-13-468417-8
CEFR Scale: A2+; B1
Platform for course material
清華⼤學 eLearn 數位學習系統  http://elearn.nthu.edu.tw

Requirements & Rules
YOU CAN EXPECT ME TO:
1. Plan the course and change the plan if it's necessary.
2. Give you both written and oral feedback. I take the assignments in this class
seriously, and I believe that
giving feedback a top priority.
3. Bring my expertise into the classroom. For example, many years of my study,
professional experience
(well, I work as a translator), and stories from real life. I believe that we can
learn through stories. (You,
too, are encouraged to bring stories to class to stimulate discussion.)
4. Regard struggling with ideas as a process of learning.
5. Be open about different ideas.
6. Treat you with respect since you are adult learners.
HERE IS WHAT I EXPECT FROM YOU:
1. Class attendance, lesson preparation and active class participation are
required. If you are absent for
more than 6 hours with no valid excuses, you will fail this course.
2. Absence from a class is NO excuse for not knowing the assignment and what has
been discussed in that
class. It is YOUR responsibility to ask your fellow classmates what has been
covered and what will be
doing in the class.
Effort to make this class your own. Always ask yourself: What will I do to promote
my learning?
3. Plagiarism and cheating on the exam is absolutely not acceptable. If someone is
found plagiarizing or
cheating on an exam, it means he/she will get a zero point for that exam. If you
have any questions
regarding the expectations for a specific assignment or exam, please do not
hesitate to ask.
4. Honesty. I will ask you many questions throughout the semester. “I don’t know,”
“I need to think about it
for a while,” or “I need to pass on that question” are acceptable answers.
5. There will be NO make-up exams/presentations unless valid and official reasons
for absence are
presented beforehand.
6. The handouts given in the class should be kept at least till the end of the
semester for later reference or
final exam.

中文名稱  Course Title ：中⾼級英文三 - 聽講
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Upper-Intermediate English III ： Listening and Speaking
任課教師  Instructor ：⾦祖詠
上課時間  Time ： M1M2 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 110 ／ 38
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
2學分聽講課程，主要⽬的為訓練學⽣進階主題式英語溝通與表達，更加強化學⽣思考、組織及
表達的整合技能，並培養學⽣發現問題、以英語提問並表達意⾒的能⼒，奠定並厚實同學⽇後獨
立學習英文的基礎。
This is a one-semester, two*2 credits course designed for upper-intermediate to
high-intermediate English language proficiency level learners in NTHU college
program.
The academic goal is to cultivate learners’ communication skills focusing on
listening and speaking proficiencies. Theme-based texts allow learners to
extend and utilize learners’ existing knowledge while exploring new contexts and
skills.
This course specifically targets on guiding learners to practice using critical
thinking approaches while exploring various thematic units designed for
classroom and further studies. Communication, comprehension, and critical
thinking are the three prime concerns in this class.
The class welcomes individual learning performance as well as community
approach learning. Learners will be assessed based on their individual, pair-
up, and study groups’ team performances. This is a tentative schedule; it is
subject to change when necessary.

305-95547-9
CEFR scale B2-C1
Note: We will use this one for our 2022 Fall semester and 2023 Spring semester.

(main campus ⽔⽊ , south campus 銓⺠ )

(2021),New YOrk: Oxford University Press. ISBN:978-0-19490663-0

purchase this book for class.

Upper-Intermediate English II -- Listening & Speaking This is a one-
semester, 2 credits course for Upper-intermediate to high-intermediate
English language proficiency level learners. The couse aim is to build
learners’ listening and speaking communication skills. Thematic-based
texts invite learners to extend and utilize their existing knowledge while
exploring new contexts. This course targets on leading learners to using
critical thinking approaches while exploring various thematic units.
Communication, comprehension, and critical thinking are the three prime
learning objectives. This class welcomes individual learning performance
as well as community approach learning. Members will be assessed based on
their individual, pair- up, and study team performances. The following is a
tentative schedule; it is subject to change when necessary.

中文名稱  Course Title ：中⾼級選讀英文 - 職場英語寫作
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Writing for Professional Pursuit
任課教師  Instructor ：黃佩如
上課時間  Time ： T5T6 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 103 ／ 47
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
LANG200024
Writing for Professional Pursuit, Fall 2024
Instructor: Pei-Ju Huang
Email: pjhuang@gapp.nthu.edu.tw
Tuesday 13:20 – 15:10
Credits: 2 (Elective)
本寫作課程不開放⼈⼯加簽。所有學⽣須由選課系統亂數選課。
Course Description and Learning Goal
This course is designed for learners of upper-intermediate English proficiency who have no many writing
experiences in the real world, aiming to develop effective written communication skills in the pursuit of their
professional career goals. Several job-related genres will be introduced, including employment documents,
result-oriented email messages, short reports, memos, updates, proposals and recommendations. In order to
discover the structures and language forms of the introduced genres, learners will accomplish various tasks
individually and collaboratively by reviewing and analyzing authentic texts of the genres, completing hands-
on writing tasks, and making presentations for text-analysis findings. Achieving an effective learning
outcome, learners have to actively participate in discussions, expressing ideas, and exchanging information.
By the end of the course students are expected to:
(1) critically examine and analyze the structural features of authentic texts of specific genres for occupational
purposes,
(2) write conventionalized, structured job-related genres with focus and relevant support,
(3) communicate and exchange information showing complex relationships, and rectify their writing in
meaning and form.
本課程以職場慣⽤英文句型教授電⼦郵件和信函撰寫，可實際應⽤⾄校園⽣活和職場溝通需求，非以
國際貿易為⽬
的，亦不需商學背景。
Prerequisites
Students who wish to take this course should:
1. complete the training of Upper-intermediate English III – Reading and Listening, or Upper-intermediate
English I and II
2. be able to write a paragraph of at least 150 words about experiences or events, describing personal
feelings and reactions.
3. need to know and properly use most of these language areas: comparatives and superlatives; conditionals
2nd and 3rd; modals; future continuous; past continuous; past perfect; past tense responses; present perfect
continuous; reported speech; simple passive; connecting words expressing cause and effect, comparison and
contrast; relative clauses, etc.
Core Capabilities ( 英文核⼼能⼒指標 )
英語溝通與表達能⼒  35%
深度分析與組織思考能⼒  25%
英語學習策略與技巧  15%
對英語與多元文化的國際視野  10%
善⽤英語學習資源，培養獨立學習英語的習慣能⼒  15%
Course Materials
Online course package will be provided.
(*The teacher reserves the right to make changes for pending tasks.)
Course Requirements and Evaluation
1. Attendance & oral participation 10% (*No free points for oral participation!)
2. Employment writing 25% (*multiple drafts of resume and cover letter)
3. Email message writing 10% (*take home exercises, and 1-2 individual email messages)
4. Mid-term exam 20%
5. Presentation 10%
6. Final writing 15%
7. Learning tasks 10%
Course Rules
1. Every week this class requires students to preview the lessons and write exercises. Come prepared for the
pre-study sessions, and complete the writing exercises before the class.
2. Students should always bring pens, pencils, paper notebooks or loose-leaf paper to keep notes or learning
records. To achieve better learning results, students are encouraged to bring laptops and tablets to access to
online teaching materials in the classroom, or print them out and bring to the classroom, rather than using cell
phones.
3. Oral participation is required in all English classes. Writing courses need students’ active thinking and
participation, too. Silent and inactive sit-ins, sleeping, or using cell phones in class will cause your
participation credits (10%) not to be granted.
4. Regular attendance is important due to various learning tasks that requires students’ participation.

中文名稱  Course Title ：中⾼級選讀英文 - 中英文筆譯
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chinese-English Translation
任課教師  Instructor ：王遠洋
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 202 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Subsidiary aim
This course explores language learning, cross-cultural knowledge, and translator as a professional career. The
focus of language learning is close reading with different types of English text, including news articles,
transcripts of TED talks, film subtitles, songs, and English novels. QA discussions and regular quizzes and are
required. The emphasis of increasing cross-cultural knowledge is introducing basic translating skills and
strategies of translation. Students are supposed to know differences between Chinese and English language
and culture by discussing the examples that the instructor provides in the class. Through various exercises,
students get to know the process of translation, how to communicate with clients, and the responsible attitude
about working as a translator.
Corresponding CEFR Can-do statements
This course is an introduction of English-Chinese translation. It requires an intermediate level of English
(CEFR B2).
a. Can read straightforward factual texts on subjects related to his/her field and interest with a satisfactory
level of comprehension.
b. Can read linguistically complex texts such as specialized articles and literary works.
c. Can paraphrase short written passages in a simple fashion, using the original text wording and ordering.
d. Can express news and views effectively in writing, and relate to those of others.
e. Can express thoughts on more cultural topics such as books, films, music, etc.
Textbooks
1) Dylan, Bob. “The Lonesome Death of Hattie Carroll.” The Portable Sixties Reader, edited by Charters, Ann,
2003, pp. 63-5.
2) Rob Patterson, “Bob Dylan Finally Gets Some Recognition”
3) Michael, dir. The Emperor’s New Clothes. Revolution Film, 2015. Film.
4) Hurston, Zora Neale. Their Eyes Were Watching God. Perennial, 1990.
5) Morrison, Toni. The Bluest Eye. Vintage, 1999.
6) Waldman, Adelle. The Love Affairs of Nathaniel P. Picador, 2013.
CEFR Scale: B2

3) 艾黛兒 ‧ ⽡德曼（ Adelle Waldman ）：《紐約文青之戀》，侯嘉珏、王遠洋譯，台北，聯合文學，
2015。
4) 柔拉 ‧涅爾 ‧ 賀絲頓（ Zora Neale Hurston ）：《他們眼望上蒼》，王遠洋譯，台北，聯合文學，
2017。

Requirements & Rules
YOU CAN EXPECT ME TO:
1) Plan the course and alter the plan when it's necessary.
2) Give you both written and oral feedback. I take the assignments in this class seriously, and I believe that
giving feedback is my top priority.
3) Bring my expertise into the classroom. For example: many years of my study, professional experience (well,
I work as a translator), and stories from real life. I believe that we can learn through stories. (You, too, are
encouraged to bring your stories to class to stimulate discussion.)
4) Regard struggling with ideas as a process of learning.
5) Be open about different ideas.
6) Treat you with respect since you are adult learners.
HERE IS WHAT I EXPECT FROM YOU:
1) Class attendance, lesson preparation and active class participation are required. If you are absent for more
than 6 hours with no valid excuses, you will fail this course.
2) Absence from a class is NO excuse for not knowing the assignment and what has been discussed in that
class. It is YOUR responsibility to ask your fellow classmates what has been covered and what will be doing
in the class.
3) Make every effort. Always ask yourself: What will I do to promote my learning?
4) Plagiarism and cheating on the exam is absolutely not accepted. If someone is found plagiarizing or
cheating on an exam, it means he/she will get a zero point for that exam. If you have any questions regarding
the expectations for a specific assignment or exam, please do not hesitate to ask.
5) Honesty. I will ask you many questions throughout the semester. “I don’t know,” “I need to think about it
for a while,” or “I need to pass on that question” are acceptable answers.
6) There will be NO make-up exams/presentations unless valid and official reasons for absence are presented
beforehand.
7) The handouts given in the class should be kept at least till the end of the semester for later reference or final
exam.

Course Aims / Description
The aim of the course is to prepare students with essential skills for
effective office communication. Students will be familiarized with
vocabulary, phrases, idioms that are often used in different office
scenarios.
Pair works and group projects will be given to facilitate the learning of
target language and to produce language output.The subsidiary aim of the
course is to equip students with professional work manners and ethics by
showing them videos of different business contexts. It is hoped that by the
end of the course, students will acquire both the English and knowledge
necessary for successful workplace communication.

Business Letters and Email Messages, Fall 2023
Instructor: Pei-Ju Huang
Email: pjhuang@gapp.nthu.edu.tw

本課程開放⼈⼯加簽 4 位學⽣。學⽣符合以下條件，得於第⼀週上課時，向老師提出加簽申請。老師

Course Description and Learning Goal
This course is designed for students of intermediate English proficiency who have no many writing
experiences in the real world, and aims to develop their written communication skills for workplace purpose.
Students who wish to take this course do not need to have any business background, but will expect to be
engaged in completing short writing exercises, applying useful phrases to produce proper languages for
specific purposes, and collaboratively writing to get their business done. By the end of the course students
are expected to:
(1) read emails and letters, grasp main points, and respond to the other person;
(2) write emails and letters to communicate relevant information for various business occasions and needs,
following a conventionalized or standard format
(3) produce neat business email messages or letters to convey clear and coherent meaning in a structured
manner.
(*本課程以英文撰寫電⼦郵件，可實際應⽤⾄校園和職場溝通需求，非以國際貿易為⽬的亦不需商學
背景。）
Prerequisites
Students who wish to take this course should:
1. complete the courses of Intermediate English I and II, or Elementary English I and II
2. be able to write a paragraph of at least 120 words about things and people using simple language, e.g.
descriptions of friends, what happened during the day
3. be reasonably proficient in most of these language areas: adverbial phrases of time, place, and frequency
including word order; prepositional phrases (time & place); prepositions of time (on/at/in); modals; future
time; past simple; present perfect; simple passive; connecting words
Core Capabilities ( 英文核⼼能⼒指標 )
英語溝通與表達能⼒  35%
深度分析與組織思考能⼒  20%
英語學習策略與技巧  20%
對英語與多元文化的國際視野  10%
善⽤英語學習資源，培養獨立學習英語的習慣能⼒  15%
Course Materials
Online course package will be provided.
(*The teacher reserves the right to make changes for pending tasks.)
Course Requirements and Evaluation
1. Attendance & oral participation 10% (*No free points for oral participation!)
2. Writing assignments 25% (*take-home exercises; two email messages)
3. Mid-term exam 20%
4. Final writing 20%
5. Presentation 10%
6. Learning tasks 15%
Course Rules
1. Every week this class requires students to preview the lessons and write exercises. Come prepared for the
pre-study sessions, and complete the writing exercises before the class.
2. Students should always bring pens, pencils, paper notebooks or loose-leaf paper to keep notes or learning
records. To achieve better learning results, students are encouraged to bring laptops and tablets to access to
online teaching materials in the classroom, or print them out and bring to the classroom, rather than using cell
phones.
3. Oral participation is required in all English classes. Writing courses need students’ active thinking and
participation, too. Silent and inactive sit-ins, sleeping, or using cell phones in class will cause your
participation credits (10%) not to be granted.
4. Regular attendance is important due to various learning tasks that requires students’ participation.
Absence may suffer the result of in-class activities (15%) when you do not ask to make up for them. Absence
may be authorized under exceptional circumstances, if a proof of justifiable reason can be provided.
5. Writing assignment must be submitted on time. Every writing assignment loses 10% per day when the
assignment is late (including weekend). Presentations should be made according to the date you sign up, and
you cannot make up the presentation if you miss it. If you have any problem with the presentation date,
please come to fix the date beforehand. Absence cannot be an excuse of not knowing assignment submission

6. ***AI-assisted reports and assignments are allowed in limited instances:*** AI can be used to prepare for
reports and assignments by brainstorming, but students must show how it helped them reach the result.

⼀、課程說明
原則上限  [ ⽣醫學院院學⼠班 ] ⼤學部學⽣選修。
學⽣在老師指導之下檢索文獻，選定⼀⾄數篇論文，閱讀理解後提出⼝頭報告。全班學⽣於報告後進
⾏討論與問答。本課程希望學⽣能學習到檢閱文獻、統整資料、⼝頭報告、與學術討論 … 的技巧，以
及指定⽣物醫學領域的最新發展。

限由  Science, Nature, Nature series, Cell, Cell series, PNAS, Circulation,
Circulation reserach, Blood, JBC ，或任何 Impact factor >10 與  Top 25% ranking 之期
刊上，選出與  “Cancer; Regenerative Medicine” 相關 , 最近 3 年內發表之原始研究論文  (Feb
01, 2016 以後發表 ).
如欲選擇不符上述表列期刊之論文，需由授課老師事先許可。
⾃選論文需於指定時間前， email 其  PDF 檔⾄授課老師電⼦信箱 : yjchuang@life.nthu.edu.tw,
以上傳  NTHU eeclass system, 供同學預覽 .

89

七、使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出
有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出。
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據
本校公布之「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，以下說明
如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出。
學⽣須於報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議題發想、文
句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相關單位有權
重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
科號  Course Number ： 11210LMIP391102學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 8
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：林郁婷
上課時間  Time ： Wn 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 217 ／ 87
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Requirements:
1. Course requirements will be presented in the first class, including paper
selection, presentation order, and grading criteria. Student presentations will be
started in the third class.
2. Presented papers will be assigned from neuroscience-related journals and
published in the last two years.
3. The presenter has to provide the paper to classmates and the teacher one week
before the presentation week. Each presentation should be finished in 30-35
minutes and the discussion will be in the next 10 minutes.
4. The host will be the previous presenter responsible for the brief
introduction at the beginning and the Q&A session after the presentation.
5. Students should read the paper before each class and participate in the Q&A
session. Each student should have at least three questions in the semester.
6. Grading: Oral presentation 70%; Q&A 20%; Attendance 10 %.

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Life Science
任課教師  Instructor ：桑⾃剛
張慧雲
陳韋靜
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆  113 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
112 學年第⼀學期  ⽣命科學導論  (Introduction to Life Science) 課程⼤綱
課程名稱 : 11210LS 110302 ⽣命科學導論  (Introduction to Life Science)
任課老師 : Chang, Hui-Yun ( 張慧雲 ) 、 Sang, Tzu-Kang ( 桑⾃剛 ) 、 Chen, Wei-Ching ( 陳韋靜 )
Time: R7R8R9 (15:30-18:20) Room: Life Science Build II-Room 113
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
本課程主要  提供  本校非主修⽣科系 ( 但已修過⼤學有機化學以上學分優先 ) 的學⽣，對於⽣命科學之認
識。主要以選
⽤的 2021 年⽣物學教科書  全⽅位介紹當代⽣物學討論與關注的課題  [ 詳⾒下列  授課內容  課程表 ] 。
本課程  將分三⽅⾯來介紹  「⽣命科學」 :
1. 從傳統⽣物學研究的內容  [ 如 : 早期的⽣物與相關之演化課題 ]
到近代⽣物學所關注的議題  [ 如 : ⽣物圈的現代、未來與⽣態、環境相關 ]
2. 從物理、化學⾓度開始介紹⽣物分⼦、細胞、遺傳、免疫、癌病⽣成與相關近代⽣物科技應⽤，幫
助未曾在⼤學
修習過⽣物課程的學⽣了解⽣命科學的基礎理論。
3. 從⽣物個體的⾓度介紹⽣理學。從⽣物個體之組織、器官、系統的協調了解⽣物有機體如何的運作
以維續⽣命。
*這些介紹  將使學⽣⽅便整合所學，⽽立即應⽤到與本⾝相關的特定議題研究。並可作為未來研讀⾼
階課程的準
備。論文研究與⽣命科學有關之學⽣，可以優先選修本課程。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
針對對植物多樣性及保育相關研究有熱誠的⼤學⽣，於辜嚴倬雲植物保種中⼼進⾏兩周植物學課程
並實地感受豐富植物類群與型態多樣性，如受疫情影響將正課改為線上進⾏，講師來⾃國內各單位
之研究⼈員與⼤學教授，之後學⽣植物材料進⾏短期研究。

轉知相關訊息給有興趣的非⽣科院同學。聯絡⽅式如下：
郭立園助理教授 - lykuo@life.nthu.edu.tw

辜嚴倬雲植物保種中⼼簡介 :
財團法⼈辜嚴倬雲植物保種中⼼ (KBCC) 是由本院李家維教授主持的熱帶植物活體異地保育中⼼，
⾄今已收集近 34,000 種活體植物，栽種於 17 棟溫室內，是全世界蒐藏最豐富的植物園，其中蘭
花、蕨類、秋海棠、鳳梨、苔蘚等類群物種數亦是世界第⼀。該中⼼平⽇不對外開放，僅提供學術
交流或是採集植物以供研究，但每年暑假會開設研習課程，招收有對植物多樣性及保育相關研究有
熱誠的⼤學⽣。

⼀、課程說明  ⾃從  ⻄元 2022 年  網路開放⼤眾平台使⽤⼈⼯智慧的 ChatGPT 之後，有關於⼈⼯智慧是
否具有類似⼈類⼼智的意識⾏為，以及對於⼈⼯智慧的研發是否需要像基因⼯程⼀樣，給與法律與倫
理上的規範，成為科技與社會上⼀個討論的熱⾨話題。由於對於這些議題⼀個有意義的討論，必需建
立在我們對於⼈類⼼智與⾏為的科學了解上，如何從⽣物演化的觀點來檢視⼈類的⾏爲與⼼智，便成
為⼀個重要且切時的課題。
「⾏為，⼼智  與  演化」  這⾨兩學分的課程，便是針對這個議題，分四部份：  （⼀）⼈類與猿猴
（⼆）⼤腦的運作（三）語⾔與思考  （四）文化與社會，主要從演化的觀點探討  ⼈類的⾏為與⼼
智，並且圍繞著⼈⼯智慧的最新進展來了解物質與⼼靈的關係。  它是緊接在另外⼀⾨兩學分的課「宇
宙與⽣命」之後，從物質演化到⽣命的過程，進⼀步探討⼈類⼼智與文化的起源，  也是從科學的觀點
來了解美國比爾蓋茲  (Bill Gates) 所謂的地球⽣命的「⼤歷史」 (Big History) 。授課的過程中會隨時引
⽤當代在相關領域的最新發現，並且配合學⽣分組報告的討論，來看⼈⼯智慧的未來發展。最終的⽬
標，是希望修課的同學能在這些⼈類的⼤歷史事件中，找到⼀個⾃⼰偏好的議題，在未來隨時關⼼注
意該領域的最新進展，進⽽成為個⼈終⽣學習的嗜好。
⼆、指定⽤書  每周在網路上提供上課講義及指定閱讀資料
三、參考書籍  ⼀  Brains: How they seem to work by Dale Purves, FT Press 2010
⼆ 從叢林到文明，⼈類⾝體的演化和疾病的產⽣  商周出版社  2014
三 ⼤腦解密⼿冊  天下文化  2015
以上暫定  將在開學前  公佈三本必讀書⽬及文章

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
透過實驗操作，讓學⽣熟悉⽣物化學中各主要分⼦ ( 如醣類、脂肪、胺基酸和蛋⽩質等 ) 的特性，以及
⽣
化研究中經常使⽤到的實驗⽅法與技術 ( 如透析、電泳、⾊層分析、酵素的分離與檢測等 ) 。

11 Thin layer chromatography
12 Electrophoresis

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明：
想要有優秀的報 paper 能⼒嗎？那就要先學會如何念 paper 。念 paper 比較像是念⼩說還是傢俱組裝說
明？在這
⾨課中，我們先學習如何正確的念 paper 。其實，幾乎每篇 paper 都會依照固定的架構來作科學陳述。抓
住這個
架構後，不但可以讓念 paper 更有效率，⽽且會能更明暸實驗的重點。進⽽在報告 paper 時能更有效的傳
達
paper的內容給聽眾。
教學進度：
於學期初公佈。
成績考核：
1. ⼝頭報告  (60%) – 會依據 ppt 製作及報告內容之邏輯性評分。
2. 發問討論  (30%) – 會依據問題的重要性評分。
3. 其他  (10%) - 評分項⽬會在學期初公佈。

科號  Course Number ： 11210LS 473200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：免疫學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Immunology
任課教師  Instructor ：徐⼦勝
謝琬甄
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 217 ／ 87
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
免疫系統是⼀專⼀且⾼度多樣化之個體防禦系統，在這防禦系統中，各類特定功能的細胞與分⼦密切
合作形成⼀動態的網絡，藉以清除致病性微⽣物與癌細胞。然⽽免疫系統的失調以及微⽣物與癌細胞
的
反制亦造成感染症、癌症、及⾃體免疫疾病的惡化，我們該如何設計有效的免疫療法及疫苗 ? 近年
來，由於免疫學研究有多項突破性的進展，使得這⾨科學漸趨成熟，已成為⼆⼗⼀世紀之顯學。無庸
⾄疑地，免疫學是⼀不可或缺的⽣命科學課程。
本課程歡迎對免疫學有興趣的⼤學部學⽣及研究⽣修習。亦歡迎非⽣科系院同學選修。課程內容包括
探討基本的免疫學現象及機制，簡⾔之，即是分⼦辨識 (molecular recognition) 與反應
(response) ，以及免疫學在⽣物醫學及產業的應⽤，如免疫療法 (immunotherapy) 、單株抗體、疫
苗設計、⽣物感應器 (biosensors) 等。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Parham's The Immune System, 5th Edition, 2021; Garland Science; ed: Peter Parham
三、參考書籍 (References)
Kuby Immunology, 9th Edition, 2019; W. H. Freeman and Company; eds: Thomas
Kindt, Richard Goldsby, Barbara Osborne.
Cellular and Molecular Immunology, 7th Edition, 2012; Elsevier Inc., eds: Abul K.
Abbas, Andrew H. Lichtman, Shiv Pillai.
Scientific journal articles and reviews
Janeway's Immunobiology, 9th Edition, 2016; Garland Science; ed: Kenneth Murphy

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)

⼆、⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明  「有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告」
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據本
校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，請註明如
何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告，說明如下
學⽣可於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議題
發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。然⽽，在本課程的「個⼈反思報告」、「⼩組採訪作業」
中，學⽣不得使⽤⽣成式 AI ⼯具撰寫作業。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相
關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

科號  Course Number ： 11210LS 545700學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣命科學之模式⽣物
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Model Organisms in Life Sciences
任課教師  Instructor ：桑⾃剛
王歐⼒
李以如
王翊青
劉姿吟
上課時間  Time ： T7T8 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆  213 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. 課程說明 (Course Description)
The primary reason for using model organisms in research is the evolutionary principle that all organisms
share some degree of similarity in different aspects of functionality and genetics due to common ancestry.
Genetic analysis in model organisms is a powerful approach to gaining detailed insight into biological
processes. This class offers essential information about the commonly used model organisms in biomedical
research. Professors with expertise in each model organism will cover each model's basic introductory lecture
and how to apply these model organisms in studying a range of biological questions. In addition, the course
teaches a variety of skills that are important for every researcher in the biomedical field. At the end of the
course, the student has:
1. Obtained a thorough introduction to research in the Mouse, Yeast, Xenopus, C. elegans, Drosophila,
Zebrafish, and Arabidopsis
2. Gained a basic understanding of genetics and how genetic analysis can be used to dissect biological
processes
3. Acquired knowledge of critical reading scientific articles from different model organisms
2. 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
由各單元授課老師提供講義及相關參考資料  (Digital handouts will be provided by individual lecturers) 。
3. 參考書籍 (References)
由各單元授課老師提供  (Provided by individual lecturers) 。

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBS525100學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：創傷癒合與癌症療法特論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Wound Healing and Cancer Therapy I
任課教師  Instructor ：莊永仁
上課時間  Time ： MaMb 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 217 ／ 87
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
The ability to repair tissue injuries is essential for
survival and is a prerequisite for all invasive medical intervention. It has
been shown that wound healing and cancer metastasis share common early
signaling pathways that have led to the hypothesis that tumors are “wounds
that do not heal”. In fact, cancer progression and wound healing are
influenced by many common factors, for example, regulators of angiogenesis and
inflammation are instrumental in different types of oncological therapy and
wound healing/regeneration.
With a focus on current research projects in Prof. YJ Chuang;s lab, this
special topics course begins with a systemic review of current topics in wound
healing and cancer therapy, followed by general and then focused discussion of
involved factors that are of interest.
需與老師討論後加簽。
⼆、指定⽤書  1. The link Between Inflammation and Cancer: Wounds that do
not heal (Cancer Treatment and Research), Springer, 2005, by Angus G.
Dalgleish and Burkhard Haefner
2. Tissue Repair and Fibrosis: The Role of the Myofibroblast (Current Topics
in Pathology), Springer, 2012, by Alexis Desmouliere and Beatriz Tuchweber
三、參考書籍  選取⾃知名期刊  (i.e. Science, Nature, Cell, Proc. Natl. Acad.
Sci. USA, Blood, Circulation Research…) 之相關最新原始文獻
四、教學⽅式  講解、討論、辯證、報告
五、教學進度  每週深入探討、解析  1-2 篇學術論文與實驗數據
六、成績考核  課堂中參與討論  (50%) ；專題報告  (50%)

http:// NTHU iLMS ： http://lms.nthu.edu.tw
八、學⽣使⽤  AI
有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於報告
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據本
校
公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，請註明如何
使
⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告，說明如下 :
學⽣可於報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議題發想、文句
潤
飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相關單位有權重新
針
對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBS554500學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：進階核磁共振光譜發展及應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced NMR Development and Application
任課教師  Instructor ：蘇⼠哲
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 206 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明
本課程基本上探討核磁共振技術近年來最新的進展及運⽤。我們將選定近五年內特定且具代表性及重
要性的新
技術作探討，選定的課題在核磁共振光譜上，有著較⾼的應⽤性及重要性。本課程不是核磁共振光譜
入⾨課程，
適合對核磁共振技術有基礎且有興趣的學⽣修習，例如修過核磁共振原理、⽣物核磁共振導論或其他
相關課程。
入⾨學⽣建議先修習初階相關課程，或是與授課老師討論後選課。
教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
上課講解加上⼝頭報告
教學進度  (Syllabus)
A paticular topic will be discussed every week in the course. We focus on the new
development in
certain
NMR technique or application with high impact. The selected topics are listed as
below. Any other
interesting topics will be incorporated if necessary.
1. Spectroscopy for macromolecular proteins (M.W. > 100 kDa) in solution.
2. Segmental isotopic labelling.
3. Cell free method in NMR spectroscopy.
4. Determine global fold by spin labelling.
5. Spectroscopy in organic solvent and inverted micelle.
6. Angular restraints for structural refinement.
7. Hydrogen bond scalar coupling.
8. Identification and characterization of the binding of ligands to
proteins.
9. In-Cell NMR.
10. R2 relaxation dispersion experiment.
11. Protein NMR study in aggregation state.
12. Protein folding.

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBS565200學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：微管動態變化及微管相關蛋⽩特論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Microtubule Dynamics and Microtubule Associated
Proteins
任課教師  Instructor ：鄭惠春
上課時間  Time ： M3M4 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 217 ／ 87
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
⾃從 Mitchison 和 Kirschner 在 1984 年第⼀次揭⽰微管的動態變化特性和調控機制後，⼀個全新的⽣物領
域
因
⽽誕⽣。細胞中的微管具有調控細胞分裂、細胞移動、細胞極性、胞器運輸等重要功能；⽽微管調控
失調則
與神經退化性疾病、纖⽑相關疾病、癌症息息相關，故微管及其相關蛋⽩常是新藥開發的標靶。以微
管為
例，紫杉醇能有效抑制微管動態變化，在細胞內可以抑制細胞分裂，臨床上是⼀種抗癌藥物。
本課程旨在使學⽣了解細胞骨架蛋⽩微管的⽣成與調控機制、以及該領域的重要研究主題與最新發
現，將藉
由報告討論的⽅式培養學⽣在閱讀科學期刊、主動探索進修、以及研究設計與分析的能⼒。此外，亦
訓練學
⽣使⽤英文進⾏簡要的⼝頭研究報告，並練習問答技巧，進⽽分享⾃⼰的研究成果。
⼆、參考書籍
選⾃ Science, Nature, Cell, PNAS, Nature Structural and Molecular Biology,
Molecular Cell 等期刊中相
關文獻。
三、教學⽅式
講解、討論、學⽣演講。

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBS567900學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣物資訊與結構⽣物特論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Bioinformatics and Structural Biology
任課教師  Instructor ：林珮君
上課時間  Time ： Fa 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 217 ／ 87
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This class will introduce every aspect of structural biology and bioinformatics.
We will discuss fundamental knowledge and state-of-the-art applications of
bioinformatics, computational modeling and protein structure determination. In
addition, to broaden participants’ horizon, new technologies in plant science and
vascular biology will also be addressed.
Text Books:
N/A
References:
Selected papers from high-rank journals and research reports from individual
group.
Teaching Method:
All members are required to deliver oral presentations and discuss different
aspects of research topics with attendees during the class.
Syllabus:
Week 1 Structural Biology: X-ray crystallography I
Week 2 Structural Biology: X-ray crystallography II
Week 3 Structural Biology: X-ray crystallography III
Week 4 Structural Biology: X-ray crystallography IV
Week 5 Bioinformatics
Week 6 Pathogen evolution
Week 7 Molecular virology
Week 8 Phamacoproteomics
Week 9 Structural Biology: NMR I
Week 10 Structural Biology: NMR II
Week 11 Vascular biology I
Week 12 Vascular biology II
Week 13 Plant physiology I
Week 14 Plant physiology II
Week 15 Structural Biology: Cryo-EM I
Week 16 Structural Biology: Cryo-EM II
Week 17 Structural bioinformatics
Week 18 Molecular modeling
Evaluation:
Faculty members serve as judges to grade in the oral contest.

四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. 演講同學於演講前兩週 e-mail 給老師研究論文 pdf 徵得老師同意
演講同學於演講前⼀週 e-mail 給全班同學演講論文的 pdf 全文
2. 演講同學於演講前天填寫書報 [ 報告範例 ]
演講當天發給全班同學演講英文條列式 synopsis (4-5 項 )
涵蓋給予演講者 comment 欄位  ( 同學意⾒不列入成績計算參考 )
書報報告演講結束後同學必須當天交給老師
3. 演講同學作 35-40 分鐘的演講  ( 背景介紹⾄少 10 分鐘 )
4. 全班同學就演講論文作 10 分鐘的討論  ( 每個⼈⾄少提出⼀個問題 )

六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Evaluation and grading policy:
Oral presentation (70%)
A. Preparation of introduction in your slides (20%)
B. Structure or outlines of your slides (10%)
C. Visualization of your message in your slides (5%)
D. Logic flow and clarity of your oral presentation (10%)
E. Timing of your oral presentation (5%)
F. Ability to answer the questions (10%)
G. Ability of speaking and comprehension (10%)
Report (30%)
Pick three talks and describe how you learn from the speakers their skills of
presentation
(no more than one page, single line, font-size: 12)
**Participants are only allowed excused absence once by providing proof of
leave
signed by the supervisor

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBS790101學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 10
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：楊立威
上課時間  Time ： W5 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 207 ／ 10
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
PhD Seminar 博班書報討論
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Scientific research is all about finding the verifiable truth and
literature survey stands as a forefront component in constituting verifiable new
knowledge. In this interactive course, the teacher will introduce the components
whereby a scientific presentation is compiled. Several search and active reading
skills will be described. Writing and presentation skills will be taught with
examples and practiced by students' presentations.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books) N/A
● 參考書籍 (References)
------- Suggested articles -------
1. https://www.thno.org/v08p0830 (Cancer, medicine and computation)
2. https://www.pnas.org/content/118/26/e2023051118 (Ribosome and medicine)
3. https://www.nature.com/articles/s41587-019-0224-x (AI and medicine)
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecturing and student presentation
(students need to bring their laptops for internet search and article editing)
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Types of scientific literature, motives of reading papers, reading styles
2. Components in a paper, get the essence of a paper, find relevant papers.
[[Letting listeners understand what is expressed is the goal of all presentations]]
3.4. 10-min presentation of one's master thesis (or a chosen special topic) & re-
write abstract
5. Introduction, Method, Results and Discussions I
6. Introduction, Method, Results and Discussions II
7. Credits and Citations
8. Quiz on Writing and Citations
9.10. 10-min Presentation on one's master thesis again.
11. Components that constitute critiques & how science is peer reviewed I
12. Components that constitute critiques & how science is peer reviewed II
13. Components that constitute critiques & how science is peer reviewed III
14.15.16. 18-min presentation 3 (designated papers with critiques)
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
10-min presentation 1 (10%)
10-min presentation 2 (10%) + Abstract rewritten (10%)
Writing and citation practices (10%)
Final presentation & Q&A (60%)
The grading come from mutual evaluation among students + the teacher
● 可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Personal Website)
● AI policy : Conditionally open; please specify how generative AI will be used in
course output
科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBS790102學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 10
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：殷献⽣
上課時間  Time ： F5 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆  107 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
本學期新規定，請有意修此課者注意
1. 每⼈須於每次上課對該次報告⼈提出⼀個問題進⾏討論  ( 共計 10 分 )
2. 期末報告為 2 ⾴ A4 ，不含圖表文獻， 12 字型⼤⼩， 1.5 ⾏距，針對個⼈報告題⽬
與他⼈提問做出討論與介紹，繳交時間為課程結束後三周內繳交。 ( 共 30 分 )
3. 老師對學⽣⼝頭報告評量佔 10 分。
4. 修課學⽣對該次報告⼈之⼝頭報告進⾏評量，佔 40 分。
5. 出席率佔 10 分。
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
限博⼠班研究⽣選修。
本書報討論主要為協助學⽣接觸不同⽣命科學領域之最新發展及其思維模式，因此偏重於多⽅向的最
新文獻和論文報告。同時希望學⽣藉此熟習學術討論的風格並訓練其理性的表達能⼒。另外，經由評
鑑講者的表現亦使學⽣體會掌握成功的學術報告的因素，本書報討論提供學⽣英文演講的訓練機會。
⼆、⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明  「有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告」
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據本
校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，請註明如
何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告，說明如下
學⽣可於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議題
發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。然⽽，在本課程的「個⼈反思報告」、「⼩組採訪作業」
中，學⽣不得使⽤⽣成式 AI ⼯具撰寫作業。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相
關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

四、參考書籍 (References)
五、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
由同學從國外知名期刊（可參考上列的指定期刊），摘選有興趣的⼀篇完整文章 ( 該文章需有材料⽅
法、結果討論 ) ，詳細閱讀理解後，在課堂上做⼀個完整的英文演講，並接受老師與同學的問題討
論。
注意事項：
1.每位同學講演以 30 分鐘為限 ; 10~20 分鐘問題回答 .
2.相關文獻於演講前⼀週寄發老師進⾏審核。
3.演講內容⼒求完整，有頭有尾，切忌斷章取義；並善⽤圖表說明，避免冗⻑文字敘述。
六、教學進度 (Syllabus)
每週以 1位同學進⾏報告為原則。
七、成績考核 (Evaluation)
依照同學演講表現、上課參與情況及、相關文獻由每位上課學⽣與老師客觀考核，並加入最前項之新
規定。

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBT525300學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：細胞核特論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics of the Nucleus I
任課教師  Instructor ：桑⾃剛
上課時間  Time ： F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼀ 323A ／ 10
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
The nucleus is the hallmark of eukaryotic cells that housing DNA in a membrane-enclosed compartment. The
emergence of nucleus during evolution offered a more sophisticated regulation for decoding genetic
information, which ultimately drove the evolvement of multicellular organisms. Thus, the maintenance of
nuclear structure and organization is key to the function of all eukaryotic cells. In this class, we will discuss
topics relate to (1) the nuclear envelope, (2) the nuclear lamins, (3) the lamin-binding proteins, (4) the
nuclear
pore complex, (5) the nucleoplasm and cytoplasm transport, (6) the functional organization of the nucleolus,
(7) the nuclear proteolysis, and (8) the nuclear structure maintenance.
⼆、指定⽤書
The nucleus, by Tom Misteli and David L. Spector
‧ ISBN-10: 0879698942
三、參考書籍
四、教學⽅式
Student presentation and paper review (in English)
五、教學進度
(1) nuclear envelope (three weeks)
(2) nuclear lamins (two weeks)
(3) lamin-binding proteins (one week)
(4) the nuclear pore complex (one week)
(5) nucleoplasm and cytoplasm transport (two weeks)
(6) the functional organization of the nucleolus (two weeks) (7) the nuclear proteolysis (two weeks)
(8) the nuclear structure maintenance (two weeks)
40 min presentation and 1 hour discussion/paper review for each class
六、成績考核
Presentation (50%)
Summary report (30%)
Class participation (20%)

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBT545100學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：基因修飾與調控
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Epigenetics and Epigenome
任課教師  Instructor ：張壯榮
上課時間  Time ： M3M4 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 206 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. Course Description:
The course of Epigenetics and epigenome is focus on the study of stable
genetic modifications that result in changes in gene expression and
function
without a corresponding alteration in DNA sequence. The epigenome is refereed
to a catalog of the epigenetic modifications that occur in the genome. Many
diseases have associated with epigenetics changes. New methods to detect the
modifications and better understandings of factors that drive these changes
have made progress in this field. Thus, this course is designed to introduce
the concepts and the new developments of epigenetics to students. Latest
papers related to epigenetics will be discussed along with the
corresponding lectures.
2. Text Books: N/A
3. References:
Epigenetics, Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Press, 2007, ISBN 978-087969875-1
Related papers in the latest journals such as Nature, Science, and Cell.
4. Teaching Method:
English lectures with paper discussions
5. Syllabus:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: The rise of Epigenetics
Week 3: Euchromatin and Heterochromatin
Week 4: Silent Chromatin
Week 5: Position Effects
Week 6: Nucleosome and chromatin assembly
Week 7: Chromatin dynamics
Week 8: Mid-term
Week 9: Histone modification code
Week 10: Transcription activation
Week 11: Gene suppression
Week 12: Cohesion and gene repression
Week 13: RNA and gene regulation
Week 14: Epigenome
Week 15: Epigenetics and diseases
Week 16: Final Exam
6. Evaluation:
40% - Mid-term Exam
40% - Final Exam
10% - discussion in the classes
10% - attendance.
7. Hyperlink:
http://lms.nthu.edu.tw/
8. Students shall declare the use of AI (ChatGPT) programs in the assignments.

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBT575300學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫研究⼩鼠模式
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Genetically Engineered Mouse Models in Biomedical Research
任課教師  Instructor ：王翊青
上課時間  Time ： W3W4 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆  213 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
In this course we will learn: 1) recombinant DNA technology; 2) procedure of
generation of transgenic and gene knock mice; 3) the molecular mechanism of
gene gain/loss of function in mouse transgenic model; 4) conventional and
conditional transgenic gene expression models; 5) conventional and
conditional
gene KO models and Cre-Lox technology; 6) applications of mouse models in
developmental biology research; 7) established mouse models in human disease
research. We will review about how transgenic animals are generated and what
recombinant DNA technologies are involved. The well-established disease models
will be introduced in class and discussed, including the rationale and
application of transgenic models in developmental biology, physiology and
disease
related research.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Selected papers
三、參考書籍 (References)
(1)Methods in Enzymology Vol. 476. Guide to Techniques in Mouse Development,
Part A: Mice, Embryos, and Cells, 2nd Edition. Edited by Paul M. Wassarman and
Philippe M. Soriano.
(2)Regulation of Gene expression: Molecular Mechanisms. Gary H. Perdew, John
P. Vanden Heuvel, and Jeffrey M. Peters. 2006.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture/ Seminar /Discussion
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1 Introduction and principle of transgenic mouse models
Week 2 Promoters and tissue specific expression
Week 3 Doxycycline and Tamoxifen inducible system
Week 4 Loss of function technique (I) : Technical knockout: Antisense RNAi
Week 5 Physical gene targeting (KO): Homologous recombination in ES
cells
Week 6 Loss of function technique (II):Physical gene targeting gene KnockIn
Week 7 Conditional gene knockout with nuclease: CRE-LoxP, CRSIPR/Cas9 (I)
Week 8 Lineage tracing in Developmental Biology Research
Week 9 mid-term
Week 10 Gene trapping strategy and Mutagenesis
Week 11 Mouse models in Neuroscience and brain mapping
Week 12 Genetic and chemical induced lung cancer models
Week 13 Prostate cancer models: Tramp and Lady
Week 14 Mouse models for pancreatic cancer and diabetes
Week 15 Liver cancer (HCC) and Colorectal cancer model
Week 16 Injury and tissue regeneration
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Attendance (10%), Discussion/Seminar (30%),Mid-term (30%) and Final report
(30%).

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBT575800學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：基因轉錄因⼦ Forkhead Box 蛋⽩特論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Transcription Factor Forkhead Box(Fox) Proteins I
任課教師  Instructor ：王翊青
上課時間  Time ： M3M4 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 207 ／ 10
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Transcription Factor Forkhead Box (Fox) protein family members regulate
transcriptional network of genes control multiple cell physiology, such as
development, cancer and other diseases. This course aims to help students
understand the molecular mechanisms and biological roles of FoxM1 and FoxO by
covering the following issues: 1)Biological functions of Forkhead box family
transcription factors; 2) Fox proteins transcriptional regulate cell cycle
progression; 3) Fox target genes and regulatory signal pathways; 4) Fox proteins
in mouse embryonic development; 5) Fox proteins in cancer biology; 6) Cross
talks between Fox proteins and related diseases.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Book)
三、參考書籍 (References)
Selected papers
四、教學⽅式
Lecture/ Seminar /Discussion
五、教學進度
Week1 Introduction to Fox transcription factors
Week2 Discovery of Foxm1 and liver transcription factors
Week3 Molecular analysis of Foxm1 protein
Week4 Fox family in cell cycle regulation
Week5 Holiday
Week6 Fox family, SCF and Protein degradation
Week7 Fox family in lung and liver cancers
Week8 Fox family in ovary and colorectal cancers
Week9 Fox family in lung development and maturation
Week10 Fox O and FoxM1 in oxidative stress response
Week11 Fox family in embryonic development
Week12 Fox family in injury-repair process
Week13 Fox family in stem cells
Week14 The crosstalk between FoxO and FoxM1
Week15 Fox in cell metabolism and mitochondria autophagy
Week16 Overview of the other Fox family proteins
六、成績考核
Attendance 10%
Discussion/Seminar 60%
Mid-term and Final report 30%

5) Risk management for manufacturing processes
Grading: Midterm (50%), Final Exam (50%)

depicting roles of ion channels in non-excitable cells (i.e.g, not neurons nor
muscle cells) on journals with Impact Factor >10 (https://jcr.clarivate.com/).

任課教師  Instructor ：周裕珽

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. 課⽬名稱 / Course
(中文 ) ⽣⻑因⼦訊息專題 : 於癌症治療之應⽤
(英文 ) Special Topics in Growth Factor Signaling: Its Application in Cancer
Therapy
授課老師 /Instructor ：周裕珽  (Yu-Ting Chou)
學分數 /Credit ：  2 ( 須與老師⾯談後加簽選課 )
2. 課程⼤綱 /Course Description
Growth factors play critical roles in tissue homeostasis. Deregulated
expression of growth factors and their receptors contribute to tumor
initiation and progression. Several Targeted therapies blocking deregulated
growth factor signaling achieve successful outcomes in cancer patients. This
course will cover cutting-edge topics including the roles of growth factor
signaling in cell proliferation, differentiation and cancer development. We
will discuss the current progress of the inhibitors of growth factor signaling
in cancer therapies.

presentation
and discussion

cancer therapy
Author(s): Gajanan V. Sherbet
Amsterdam ; Boston : Elsevier.
eBook available at NTHU library http://www.lib.nthu.edu.tw/
5. 參考書籍 (References):

Amsterdam ; Boston : Elsevier Academic Press, c2004.
eBook available at NTHU library http://www.lib.nthu.edu.tw/

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSBT790103學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 10
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：林亦凡
上課時間  Time ： F5 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼀ 405A ／ 10
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Introduction
Giving useful critiques to research works is an important skill for not only personal development as a scientist
but also for progress of scientific fields as a whole. In this course, students will learn how to critique and
evaluate scientific papers. Students will be required to use a standardized method, which will be introduced in
the class, to offer critique and evaluation of an assigned paper. Moreover, by applying these skills, reading
papers will transform from passively receiving information to an active process. This will enable students to
read papers in a more efficient manner.
Syllabus
TBD. (Will be discussed and determined at the beginning of the course.)
Evaluation
1.Oral presentation (60%) – Evaluation of this part is based on organization logic and clarity of presentation.
2.Discussion (40%) – Evaluation of this part is based on the questions raised in each of the fellow students’
presentation.
3.More detail requirement and grading criteria will be provided at the beginning of the course.

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSMC516300學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：蕨類植物⽣態與演化學特論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics on Pteridophyte Ecology and Evolution I
任課教師  Instructor ：郭立園
上課時間  Time ： T9Ta 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆  213 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Pteridophytes, ferns and lycophytes, contain the second largest lineage among
land plants, but their biology is poorly understood compared to that of seed
plants, a model organism concentrated lineage. An improved understanding of
pteridophyte ecology and evolution provides the key to uncovering mysteries
behind the natural history of plants. In this lecture, we are going to focus
on several important issues that are much unique in pteridophytes by reading
assigned textbook chapters and other scientific literature.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Fern Ecology by K. Mehltreter et al., Cambridge (2010)
● 參考書籍 (References)
Selected recent papers from high profile journals such as New Phytologists,
MPE, GBE, American Journal of Botany, American Fern Journal etc.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
All students are required to read all assigned chapters and papers and then
participate in classroom discussion.
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Topics
SYSTEMATICS & EVOLUTION
Phylogeny
Classification systems
Fern fossils
MACROECOLOGY
Biogeography of ferns
Species and speciation
FUNCTIONAL ECOLOGY
Ecological importance of ferns
Nutrient ecology of ferns
Ferns, disturbance and succession
Interactions of ferns with fungi and animals
CONSERVATION
Fern conservation
Problem ferns: their impact and management
Schedule:
Week 1~3: SYSTEMATICS & EVOLUTION
Week 4~8: MACROECOLOGY
Week 9~14: FUNCTIONAL ECOLOGY
Week 15~18: CONSERVATION
Schedule:
Week 1~3: Life history
Week 4~6: Reproductive mode
Week 7~8: Phenology
Week 9~11: Ecophysiology
Week 12~14: Systematics & diversity
Week 15~18: Genome biology
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Class performance: 20%. Assigned presentation: 20%. Attendance: 60%

科號  Course Number ： 11210LSMC546100學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：染⾊體同源重組特論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Homologous Recombination of Chromosomes I
任課教師  Instructor ：李政昇
上課時間  Time ： M5M6 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼀ 421A ／ 10
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This class will introduce the major concepts and methods in homologous
recombination of chromosomes. The students will learn how DNA double strand breaks
are repaired by homologous recombination mainly in budding yeast. Both conceptual
background in yeast genetics and detailed molecular approaches to analyze
chromosomes will be covered.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
DNA Recombination Editor(s): Tsubouchi, Hideo ISBN: 978-1-61779-129-1
Humana Press
三、參考書籍 (References)
Selected papers from high profile journals
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
All students are required to read all assigned chapters and papers and then
participate in classroom discussion.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1-4. Methods to Study Mitotic Homologous Recombination and Genome Stability
5-8. Characterizing Resection at Random and Unique Chromosome Double-Strand Breaks
and Telomere Ends
9-10. Characterization of Meiotic Recombination Initiation Sites Using Pulsed-
Field Gel Electrophoresis .
11-12. Genome-Wide Detection of Meiotic DNA Double-Strand Break Hotspots Using
Single-Stranded DNA
13-14. Detection of Covalent DNA-Bound Spo11 and Topoisomerase Complexes
15-18. Molecular Assays to Investigate Chromatin Changes During DNA Double-Strand
Break Repair in Yeast
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Class discussion: 40%. Assigned presentation: 40%. Attendance: 20%.
七、採⽤下列何項  AI 使⽤規則  (Indicate which of the following options you use to
manage student use of the AI)
有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出  Conditionally open; please specify how
generative AI will be used in course output
八、講義位址
http://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw

⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明  「有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告」
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據本
校
公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，請註明如何
使
⽤⽣成式 AI 於作業或報告，說明如下
學⽣可於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議題
發
想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相關單
位
有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Endometriosis I

● 課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程的⽬標為了解⼦宮內膜異位症的致病機轉，需要徹底了解其相關科學文獻，透過閱讀和討論學

到疾病的病因和進程。
This course will explore the pathogenesis of endometriosis through reading the
scientific literature and discussion to learn the etiology and disease
progression.
需與授課教師討論後加簽選課。
Permission from the instructor is required.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
無
None
● 參考書籍 (References)
⼦宮內膜異位症相關章節及期刊論文
The scientific literature and book chapter of endometriosis.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)

獻
回顧及報告，討論及了解此疾病之致病機轉。
The teacher will organize the etiology, clinical symptoms, and epidemiology of
endometriosis. Through literature research and discussion with students, the
pathogenesis of endometriosis will be understood.
